As I was already in the process of paying, I wrote on the back of my receipt "I am NOT a food blogger, and I'm sorry that you have to put up with that. So I am giving you a larger tip than I normally would have because of that woman." So I tipped her $9 on a $25 ticket. I showed her my note, and she got a good laugh. She packaged up the rest of my food to go, and I left. The end.

I got a small (10 inch) meatball, onions, spinach and garlic and I could only finish 3 of 4 slices and I'm a big guy who was pretty hungry. I didn't really like the burnt crust gimmick they have but the cheese and ingredients were quality and overall it definitely filled my expectations for a Chicago style pizza I had to try as a tourist. Definitely better than Giordano's, but maybe I gotta try Lou Malnati's or whatever it's called and compare it to that.My bartender Jennifer was pretty attentive and kept the refills coming.

My friend and I came at a really great time. A little bit after they opened when the crowd isn't there yet. We ordered their famous deep dish pizza. You get to choose the toppings. Each topping is $1.85 so don't go too crazy because that is how you get an expensive pizza.They have a sign for you telling you that it will take about 40 minutes for your pizza to be ready if you order it. My friend and I have small stomachs so after a slice we were pretty full.

Chicago pizza... the real deal! This place is zero frills but some of the best damn pizza I have ever had! Coming to Pequod's on my last day in Chicago was like the cherry on top of my birthday weekend sundae! Looking forward to making a stop at this place a Chicago trip tradition. The $5 personal pizza lunch special seemed too good to be true... but it wasn't!

The pizza here is amazing!! The dough is thick, and nice and crusty on the bottom. The edges are just covered in baked cheese, so every bite has great flavor. The toppings are a bit pricey, $3 each, but they PILE them on, so I would recommend just choosing a few. The pizza takes a while to cook, which they tell you up front, so just get an appetizer to munch on and relax. Or, come outside of peak lunch/dinner hours. The appetizers are pretty standard fried fare, don't expect much. The pizza slices are very filling, so a large pizza stuffed four hungry people. Definitely recommend visiting!

Fantastic deep dish pizza.  Far superior to Giordanos and the other tourist places, this comes from a guy who was born in Chicago.  Only downside to the place is the long wait and parking can be tough in the area.  That being said it is definately worth the visit.

Everyone and their mother has told me to check out Pequod's, and it really is the epitome of deep dish. I've tried many other deep dish places but this one definitely stands out in the ratio of crust to cheese to toppings.Eating in the actually restaurant, my cousins called for preferred seating which is not a reservation but to be able to be seated quicker. They told us the wait for them to make pizzas is about 40 minutes, but we didn't mind with our large group while we drank. The second pizza we ordered came with the wrong toppings and they were kind enough to make a new one and give us a discount for the wait.

There's not a single bad thing I can say. I'm from NYC, where everyone knows a NY Slice is one of the best things anyone can have. And as the pizza lover that I am, trying Deep Dish or Pan Pizza in Chicago (whatever you'd love to call it), has been on my bucket list my entire life and these guys did not disappoint. Started off with Mozzarella Sticks to hold off the long wait, and it was one of the best I've had. Not even going to lie. Super crispy, full of cheese, good for a beautiful cheese pull. And then came the pizza. And my goodness was it tasty. We got extra sauce, pepperoni, half pineapple (for my lady) and half sausage (for my half). Every single bite had a tremendous flavor, not excessive in dough and the iconic crispy/burnt crust was soooo good. Its one of the things they are known for! So happy we chose Pequod's! Our waiter was super attentive and checked in throughout. Can't wait to return when we are back in town! Thank you!

My favorite of the deep dish genre in Chicago. As a newbie to the city, I have always been on a quest to find the perfect deep dish. I have traveled to 4 locations and Pequod's is by far my favorite. The crust is thick, the sauce is flavorful, and the toppings are fresh. Definitely worth it!

Yum, yum, yum. And I don't even like things like the "burnt" caramelized crust. But here, delish! Always hopping. Especially on a nice summer night. Lots of families even though it was later in the evening since the kids don't have school. I got lucky and snagged a bar seat to eat at right away so I didn't have to wait for a table. That's a nice thing they've got going on there. See a seat open at the bar and you can grab it and order your meal there. The bar tender was awesome. He made sure my Arnold Palmer was always filled before I hit bottom and did it perfectly. Super friendly and nice. Speaking of nice, the hostesses are always pleasant as you walk in. Let you know wait time, etc. The pie was nice and gooey. Eat your pizza there. It's repeatable but absolutely best eaten hot and fresh. I like to get the combo of pepperoni and sausage on this pie. Nice amount of sauce. These people appreciate your business and always treat their customers well. It's a fun, loud atmosphere with a unique take on deliciousChicago deep dish. I'd much rather come here than some other pizza joints that ignore you and are lackluster in both food and people. Can't wait for the next time I'm nearby and stop in.

After hearing about the long lines at Pequods, my husband and I decided to go at around 3:00 on a Wednesday. We were seated right away, but there weren't many open tables. The service was quick and friendly, and perfectly attentive. We ordered buffalo wings and a pizza 1/2 sausage and 1/2 meatball. The wings were really good. The pizza was delicious. The crust was crispy with cheese, the sausage, meatballs, and tomato sauce were super flavorful. We liked the sausage a bit more than the meatball. The downfalls: the meat was unevenly placed so there were many bites with just cheese. Also, by the time we got to the second piece, the bottom crust had gotten a bit soft. Regardless I would definitely go back and recommend it to others.

Best deep dish I've ever had! This spot came highly recommended, and I was not disappointed. We were expecting a small wait for lunch, but were quickly seated when the host realized he had a free high top near the bar. A personal big component in eating near a bar is the amount of distraction (hubbub, TV, etc), and it was perfect- plenty of sports options, but not so overwhelming that you couldn't focus on your conversation. We started with the garlic cheesy bread, which was sooooooo good! It came with a little cup of marinara, which could have been bigger (I mean come on, marinara), and was steaming and fresh. Totally worth burning my taste buds.And then the pizza. God, the pizza. I was interested in the caramelized crust when I saw it on the menu, and it was AMAZING. Normally I have to get really motivated to eat an entire pizza by myself, even a personal size, but this pizza was the motivation. I honestly questioned whether it's still really that unacceptable to lick a plate. Best place to start my time in the city, and I'm craving it now that I'm gone!

I live this place. Be prepared to wait unless you go at an off time. There are a few bars I'm nearby, so you can stop in for a drink waiting for your table. Nothing else to comment about besides the deep dish. All of the other food is average, exactly what you would expect, (salads, apps, etc). The pizza is off the charts, my favorite deep dish in the city. Carmel crust is the nail in the coffin. So delicious, I typically get the sausage since it's not your typical store bought Italian sausage. It's fresh crumbles that make for an unbelievable pizza. Go here if you want the best Chicago deep dish experience in the city

This is my experience after a few trips to Pequod's. There is always a wait...always. You just have to accept that fact and plan accordingly. Have been hear with small groups at 5 a d at 7, and no matter what, you'll have a 45-60 minute wait. However, the pizza is pretty darn good, the crust with caramelized cheese however, is AMAZING!! I legit could eat 5 lbs of the crust, I'd be sick, but happily so. The toppings are always plentiful and service doesn't take too long, about 40 minutes usually. Service is okay, considering how busy a d over worked the staff always seems. Prices are decent a d I have heard they have an amazing lunch special that is really a bargain. Personally, I think this is better than Lou's and the rest of the Chicago staples for pan/deep dish, and if you are patient, will be happy you waited every time.

I've never been a big fan of Chicago deep dish pizza, the first time I had it (at another restaurant) I wasn't impressed so I was hesitant to have it again.  I heard so much and read so much about this place that I decided to give Chicago pizza another try.  This is more unique than other places, they have the cheese on the side that burns, I love that!  The sauce really made the pizza really delicious.  I couldn't stop raving about the sauce!  All the ingredients are fresh and delicious.  Keep in mind, it takes about 40 minutes for the pizza.  The wait wasn't that bad, and the service was great.  I highly recommend if you're in the Chicago area!

Hands down amazing pizza and worth the wait! There are hour long waits for very good and delicious reasons! If you don't mind sitting at the bar as opposed to waiting 1+ hours for a table, then it's first come first serve!We were expecting to wait 1.5 hrs, but luckily bar space opened up so we snatched up those seats right away. Sitting at the bar also has its perks, because you can order and receive your drinks right away. We ordered the Fried Mushrooms, Half Order of French Fries, and the Small Pan Pizza with Mushrooms, Sausage, and Spinach!The Fried Mushrooms were perfectly Fried. The inside wasn't complete mush or still raw. The Half Order of Fries were also seasoned well and not overly salty. The given wait time for the pizzas are 1 hour, which makes sense since something this good takes time. The appetizers helped to satiate the hunger as we waited. The pizza was phenomenal! The crust was just so perfectly buttery and crispy at all the right places. The crust was not damp and soft from the cheese, sauce, or toppings like how some other deep dish places get. The toppings were very generous! The sausage piece were the size of meatballs!

A must visit if you are in Chicago, most if not all locals suggested this was their favourite deep dish pizza in Chicago. Personally I preferred Lou Malnati's but the rest of the party said Pequods was their favourite by far. Great atmosphere, excellent drinks and they tell you the wait time for deep dish pizza as you walk in.

We waited for 2+ hours to eat Chicago deep dish. TWO HOURS. Yet, we destroyed our half cheese, half mushroom-jalapeño pizza in about 10 minutes. We accomplished this fest not because we were ravenous, but because the pizza really was that great. Compared to the big deep dish names in the city, this local pizza joint boasts flavors that ensnare the senses. The tomato sauce is more than just sugar and tomatoes, but a blend of Italian herbs that flood the mouth with a full, umami experience. There is a healthy amount of fresh mozzarella cheese layered on the pizza, the kind that pulls away in long beautiful strands with each bite. I loved that each bite was a burst of cheese and sauce, with a fluffy bed of crust to cradle it all from beneath. There was no grease at all on the bottom of this crust, and the ends are definitely not going to be skipped: additional cheese is toasted to a crisp on the edges and is a special surprise at the end of each slice. Deep dish looks overwhelming and can certainly be excessive. However, this place managed to strike the perfect balance of flavors and breadth. We left stuffed and happy, not gross, and I couldn't have asked for a better first deep dish experience in this city.

It took me forever to believe my friend's assertion that Pequod's was really THAT DAMN GOOD...but now that I've been here, it really is THAT DAMN GOOD. There are so many things about Pequod's deep dish pizza that make it superior to any other pizza I've had in Chicago. Their trademark crust made of caramelized mozzarella cheese instead of extra dough. The sweet and tangy tomato sauce that balances out the crust. The fact that they use a ton of mozzarella cheese, but it never gets too stringy at any point. The plentiful amount of toppings they throw into their pizza unlike other places in Chicago (yeah, I'm looking at you Giordano's). The super high quality meat they use in their pizza. Bottom line, if there is such thing as deep dish pizza perfection, Pequod's has achieved it!If you're trying to wonder how much is the right amount, a large pizza is RIDICULOUSLY huge and should be more than enough for four people. And the wait for the pizza to cook is about 30-40 minutes, about what I expected.Service was pretty friendly, I have zero complaints on this end.Sometimes you gotta call it how you see it immedaitely, and I'm calling it right here: Pequod's has the best deep dish pizza in Chicago!

A pizza poem! You can eat here but you do u know em? Located in Lincoln and pick ur toppings, With garlic, peppers, sausage--there's no stopping! The classics are the best here I can't deny, The top deep dish in Chicago I won't lie!There's room at the bar to dig in your teeth, A pro tip to remember when there's not a seat. The first time you go skip the apps and not the pizza, Always order extra sauce and extra cheese--duh!So if u live here or aren't local give it a try, Guarantee you'll enjoy this pizza pie!

WoW oh WoW Im not a big pizza fan first off I may have it 3x a year tops and have never really liked deep dish but this completely changes the game for me. I fell in love. My mother and I both had the lunch special ( a personal pizza with soda for $5 wow!) Only downside is the pizza takes a while to cook so I have learned to call ahead so the wait is not as long. the personal size is enough even if your big hungry, tho you will be wanting left overs later. I am already craving going back!

My Chicago friend recommended this place. Upon entering, we saw the sign that said it will take 40 mins to make the pizza and we were already starving. We ordered the chicken fingers which was regular and came with bbq sauce in a to go container. The chicken fingers were crispy just the way I like it. I thought the deep dish was ok. Don't get me wrong, it was delicious but nothing spectacular. I felt like I had something similar. It had the right amount of meat vs cheese and dough, wasn't overwhelming! A small deep pan for 2 is more than enough for us. They had the lunch special, a personal cheese deep  pan and drink for $4.95 I believe, such a great deal if you don't mind just a cheese pizza.

When I tell you this place is that place? It's THAT place. Had this a while back, but just now getting to the review. Piquods is a weird little restaurant (maybe bar??) that we found out in Chicago. It's mainly famous for having a whale with panties on it's head or something like that...  while the inside joke of that or why it's a whale goes completeeeeely over my head, let me tell you, it's the best Chicago pizza I've had thus far! That crust is to LIVE for and it's sooooo thick. The cheese was just dripping off fresh out the oven and I enjoyed every last bite!If you're ever in Chicago, please check out this place because I know whenever I go back, I'm gonna get this again along with a few other spots I didn't get a chance to go to. Trust and believe you won't be disappointed.

Super busy location after being seen on the travel channels food show.We ordered the pepperoni and sausage deep dish.It's a traditional tavern, bar & grill type establishment.  It was seen on Food Network or the Travel network and so it was extremely busy when we walked in the only tables are available for two chairs at the bar. Which I prefer.We received our food within 20 minutes and the bartenders were extremely nice.The restaurant was clean and I can highly recommend this restaurant.

This was a fantastic deep dish pizza. It's the best I've ever had. I don't think there's much that can be improved upon. Do not go anywhere else. Do not mess with your one chance at an excellent Chicago style deep dish. Come with an empty stomach, with your sleeves rolled up and you won't be disappointed. Definitely get the caramelized deep dish. There is no other way to go. A small feeds two people. Medium can work for two very hungry people. The pizzas are dense and they do not skimp out on the toppings. I don't think I have ever had better Italian sausage than what they serve. I won't even ding them for this but the pizza came out a bit luke warm. It wasn't pipping hot, burn your tongue and the roof of you mouth. So that's good. But then again the pizza cooled off rapidly. I am not really sure what I am getting at by saying bus because I both appreciate how it wasn't too hot but then again it became a bit unappealing when it cooled off. Maybe I'm hard to please. The service was great. Just attentive enough to not be annoying and get what we needed. The place is your standard brick walled pizza shop. Our wait on a Friday was about 30 min at peak dinner hours. Not bad! I highly recommend this place. This is just about as perfect as it gets.

Coming to Chicago I had to try some deep dish pizza and after extensive research, I settled on Pequod's. Everyone was raving about their "caramelized" aka burnt-looking but not really burnt crust.What I wasn't looking forward to was the hour plus long wait that everybody mentioned. Fortunately, it only took our pizzas about 30 minutes to come out. This was likely because we ordered personal-sized pizzas. The pizza was delicious as was the crust. The personal size ended up being more than enough. It looks deceptively small until you remember that it's deep dish, so I actually had some leftover. We got some apps beforehand because we expected the pizza to take longer to come out (cheesy garlic bread and fries), and I'd recommend the cheesy garlic bread.
ONE OF THE BEST PIZZAS IN CHICAGO!! Forget those chain deep dish places, this is where it is at!

My friends and I went out to eat tonight and it was my first time coming here and I was impressed.We were told the wait was gonna be 30 minutes but it was shorter than that which was great. Also, we were told the pizza would take about 40-45 minutes to make, but it came out sooner which was also great.Our server Kelly was really polite and kept coming to check on us every so often. Will definitely be coming back

Came to Chicago for a friends New Year's Eve wedding so we didn't have much time in the city. My boyfriend suggested we hit up this place, Pequod's. Super cold 2 degree afternoon, snagged a table by the door( that sucked) but the service and people were great. We immediately ordered a medium pepperoni and mushroom deep dish and buffalo wings. The wings came out lightning quick and we devoured every last one. That sauce was amazing!As we waited 45 min, my impression of this place fell a bit. Since we were by the table by the door, the 5pm traffic flow came thru and people were crowding around us at all sides. My chair was getting smacked by people walking behind me, getting their coats snagged on my chair. By the time our food arrived people were hovering over our deep dish pan, faux fur from people's coat hoods literally above the pan. My boyfriend had his back to the main entrance(which was worse than my seat) and people were literally talking loudly in his ear and hovering over our table while we attempted to eat dinner. We asked to switch to a booth and the waitress was unable to make the switch happen. Not a huge fan of deep dish to begin with but if I were in town again there's a chance I would swing by.
Came in for a late night grub. Holy pizza. We ordered half pepperoni half veggie, extra crispy, and extra red sauce on the side.
My favorite deep dish in Chicago! Good beer selections and you can buy pitchers ! Good as take out/delivery but the best eaten in house. Nothing fancy about it -no frills just some good pizza !

Forget Giordano's and Lou Malnati's; come HERE for the actual best pan pizza in Chicago. Not quite deep dish, but the crust is thick enough for my liking. There's only one location in the city, but no matter where you live, it's worth the trek!

This review has been a long time comin! As a Chicagoan let me break down the significance of Pequod's to you. Gene and Jude's is to the native Chicago hot dog as Pequod's is to native Chicago pizza. Both of these places are highly over looked by tourists but deeply loved by us natives. If you're newly introduced to either, well, better late than never- just get wit da program! Until my most recent visit I strictly ordered the deep dish (i never say pan. sorry not sorry.) because that's what they're known for! This will probably be the crispiest deep dish crust you'll ever have and instead of a nice handled crust to hold onto it's sloppy & a little burnt. Perfectly imperfect achieving even more crunch when you've reached the top! Thin crust is equally good but that shouldn't surprise you because even the littlest mom & pop pizza place cranks out the best thin crust. Chicago pizza is unbeatable. Chicken tenders and no cheese garlic bread are a must for appetizers. Just don't forget to leave room for the pie. (Pizza pie, duh. not dessert. lol)Dinning during prime time weekends you're looking at an hour+ wait and impossible parking. Can vouch that this is a great place for large groups. They accommodated our group of 20 allowing us to make resos and place our order in advance. 7 Pizzas and 1 Italian Beef. Only one pizza order was incorrect and for the most part, service was good. They will not seat your party unless everyone is in attendance. Thankfully, that was no problem for this group of Elites! Special Shout Out: To our honorary guests-Yelp Team Leaders wishing them a farewell, to Christopher V for suggesting Pequods, to Ahmad A for all he did for us that night (We still owe you, Friend), to everyone who was in attendance & on time (blown away by your punctuality!!), & to Selena C + Liang H for planning!
I'm visiting from Cali and asked the locals the best pizza in Chicago.. And this is it.

You will just have to trust me when I say..don't be scared of the 60-90 min wait time to sit down and the additional 45 min to have your pizza cooked. IT IS ALL WORTH IT! I promise. That is why I have constantly endeavored the gruesome act of my stomach battling me inside. So if you do decide to come on a weekend night for dinner, don't come hungry. Come when you think "yeah I'll be hungry in about an hour or two." There is also a bar connected to the restaurant called Whale Tale, where you can wait to grab an app and drink.Now, be prepared for the best deep dish in the city. No BS, it'll end any Jordan/Lebron argument.15/10

My love for deep dish pizza started with Lou Malnati's during my first visit to Chicago and it only exponentially increased when I had dinner at Pequod's Pizzeria. The wait for a table and for pizza can be long, but I really appreciate that Pequod's is blunt and straight forward about the wait. My friend and I came to the restaurant on a Sunday evening around 6pm and waited about 45 minutes for a table. While we waited, we headed a couple doors down to a bar also owned by Pizano's. When we finally got a table at Pizano's, we ordered wings and fries to munch on while our pizza baked. We ordered a small deep dish pizza with sausage. The crust is absolutely delicious with melty cheese baked in a cast iron skillet. Pizano's is also very generous with their toppings. Between the two of us, we finished the wings and fries, but we were only able to eat a slice of pizza each. I gladly asked for a box and enjoyed the leftover pizza as a midnight and breakfast the next morning. Only downside was that Pequod's a bit of a trek from our hotel.

Dang. I wanted to love this place but I'm just not there yet. EVERYONE says that this place is truly the best deep dish place in Chicago. The one that locals, and not tourists go to. While I can vouch that it seemed pretty void of the tourist disasters that are Giordano's and Lou Malnati's, it still didn't blow my mind. I felt that the cheese and sauce on the deep dish were lacking flavor - the only thing that impressed me was the flavor and consistency of the crust. We ordered a "thin" crust too, and it was super thick - and not that good. Service was great though and I liked the low key atmosphere. Overall I would give it another shot. And would still come here over any of the other deep dish places in the city.

We went on a pizza tour.  So yummy!  Service was good!  Only issue was very inconsistent slices for our group.  Mine was literally two times as big as my husbands...but likely due to serving big group. Sausage pie was so good!

Yumyumyumyum the crust and the dough are delicious. The service was attentive but be prepared to wait for your thick, luscious pizza to be cooked. I got cheese and tomatoes. My friend got pepperoni, green peppers. The medium was just right to stuff us with no other appetizer.

This place is a bit of a jaunt to get to if you're using public transportation, but it's worth it. We were seated right away, upstairs. The temperature of the restaurant was a bit uncomfortable, too hot. The restaurant is a bit dingy, but hey, we're here for the food. We ordered a pan pizza with sausage. It was delicious! Really large, flavorful hunks of sausage. They caramelize the edges of the crust, so it ends up being a slightly burnt mix of cheese and crust. In comparison to other deep dish places, I'd say the crust here is thinner and there's less cheese. It's also quite a bit cheaper than other deep dish places.

Deep dish pizza is a Chicago thing and Pequod's sure executes it well enough! I've been to almost all the deep dish place you can name in Chicago but still like Pequod's better. And yes their pizza does have more bread and it's charred at the bottom (which is the best part). Other appetizers are not bad too for your regular bar food.Just be aware that this place is overcrowded over the weekend for peak dining time, and would be a long wait if come with a big group. To what level? Well, there was one time a group of my friends came here, put our name down, went across the street to watch a movie, and then came back to get our table. if you come a bit early or only a few people, the wait isn't too bad.

"Real Chicagoans don't eat deep dish!" I'm a real Chicagoan, and I'm telling you, that statement is WRONG. Especially when it comes to Pequod's. Don't get me wrong, there is a time and place for deep dish, but if you're making that time and place for it, Pequod's can't be beat. The crust is absolute perfection. Great portions of both meat and veggies. And just has that "pizza place feel".There's not much else to say. Pequod's has the best deep dish in the city.

Looking for Chicago style pizza? Then you need to check out Pequod's!! It's usually very very busy, so try to make a reservation ahead of time. We came here as a group of six and ordered a few appetizers and two medium pizzas to share, which was more than enough! For apps, we got the cheesy garlic bread, bruschetta and breaded shrooms. I highly recommend the cheesy garlic bread, which comes with a marinara sauce on the side, as well as the breaded shrooms. I mean c'mon, fried mushrooms!! The bruschetta was underwhelmingly flavorless. For the pizzas, they weren't kidding about the caramelized crust! This is hands down the best part about the pizza. I'm typically more of a thin crust pizza kinda gal but Pequod's makes me wanna change my mind!

Went here on a Friday night with a reservation for four people. Had to wait about 15 Mins to get a table. Not bad at all. I'm a White Sox fan so all the Cubs stuff was great to see (haha).Restaurant has an upstairs that I didn't notice was so big. We requested the table right in front by the entrance but to no avail. Host did what she could (I think!?)I knew I wanted some of this caramelized crust I kept hearing about. Also knew the pizza would take 45 Mins so we ended up ordering two appetizer combos and some wings (wings suck). The fried platter was LIT. Zucchini and BOOMERS were en fuego. The table ordered some beers and a margarita.But let's get to the pizza...pepperoni and sausage pan. Both awesome. Crust was the boss. Better than Lou Malnatis and Due/Uno. I love places that have a large following and there aren't a ton of locations.Parking was easy to find too. Our server was good but VERY upset about a table next to us that told her they felt "pressured". As Kramer says, POISE COUNTS!If I want deep dish or pan pizza, I'd go back. If I want stuffed in the city I have to find my way to ART OF PIZZA!

Always have enjoyed deep dish pizza. Pequod cheese pan pizza small size and a personal of sausage, onion, and mushroom was ordered. The personal was a bit on the soggy end to my liking. I think partially due to the toppings. The cheese was perfect. Crunchy, a little doughy, but enough sauce and cheese for each bite. The burnt crust was also tasty and not overly charred. Overall had a good experience and with good company

I don't even know where to start...When we planned our trip to Chicago, we had made a list of restaurants to try based on recommendations from friends and colleagues. Pequod's never made the list. What a sad mistake it would have been to have missed this place. Fast forward, we are in Chicago, dining at one of our favorite restaurants in the country, when we strike up a conversation with our server. We give him the list, for his take, and he immediately questions why we have omitted Pequod's? We all look at each other and shrug; never heard of it... He went on to tell us that it's the best pizza in Chicago. Well then, on the list it goes. So, on our last day in town, before heading to the airport, we made it in. The hope was it would live up to the recommendation as this would be our last meal in town. And boy did it! The great experience started with the fist call. I asked if they could store our bags (party of four, each with a suitcase) and reply was "we don't have a spot, but head on down, we'll figure it out" - love that!We get there and the place is packed! That said, they found a spot for our bags and we were seated within ten minutes. The appetizers were great, especially the fried zucchini and fried mushrooms. The beer selection was great. And finally, the deep dish (extra cheese and mushrooms) was to die for. We hit Lou Malnoti's and Giordani's on the same trip, but Pequod's blew them out of the water. Do not leave Chicago without giving them a try!

We made a visit to Chicago for the marathon this weekend. My boyfriend, who is the runner, requested classic Chicago deep dish pizza for his post race meal. Our server another restaurant actually referred us to Pequod's. We took a short metro ride and a lovely walk through Depaul University to get to the restaurant. The wait was 1 to 2 hours but we were able to find a seat at the bar. The food was absolutely incredible and I am so glad that we were told about this spot. We ordered the bruschetta and a deep dish pizza with meatballs and canadian bacon. We weren't able to finish it all in one seating and happily took it home for a snack later.   When I make a return trip to Chicago I will definitely make this one of my meal stops.

Pizza- check, sauce- check, carmalized crust - check! This pizza and cornbread crust is to die for. Sometimes the crust can be a little too carmalized but sometimes you get that sweet perfect bite by the crust and its just heaven. One of my fav pizza joints in Chicago.

Had to give Pequods a second trial after so many people raved about them. Second time around, pequods stole our heart. We ordered sausage, pepperoni, and onions; it was delightful. The crust is so fulfilling (my favorite part is the burnt cheese). Definitely a must try. There is usually a long wait but the buzzers they give you as place holders connection reaches to the bar next to Pequod's- go get some dranks while you wait! P.s. fried mushrooms hit the spot as an appetizer

So by recommendation of a local Chicago resident, we decided to partake in Pequod's for a real legit Chicago Deep dish pizza.  This is a small joint with old school charm but for all the right reasons.  After a short wait, we got to sit upstairs which we didn't even know existed.  We started with the appetizer platter of fried cheese, zucchini, mushrooms and hot poppers.  I love fried cheese however the hot popper was the winner as it pleasantly had a cheddar cheese/pimento mix instead of what the normal cream cheese that I'm accustomed to and it was delicious.  But that's not where this journey ends, as recommended by the waitress we had the Supreme deep dish pizza.  The pizza takes 40 minutes to cook so I had time to have a house salad, which was good but I should have not wasted stomach room as the main event was coming!  The pizza arrived.  Giant cast iron pan filled with mushrooms, peppers, onions, and sausage - homemade sausage made in house.  I'm not usually a fan of sausage on pizza but this place is the  exception, soo good.  Sound good?  I haven't gotten to the best parts!  The crust was crunchy on the bottom but perfectly cooked  which made the best vessel for all of these toppings and then we get to the sauce!  Oh my!  I don't think I need a pizza to eat this sauce but it sure went well with it.  This is my first real Chicago deepDish pizza and was possibly the best pizza I've eaten thus far.  I truly want this pizza at home and it makes me mad knowing I cant( no offense to my pizza owner friends) but I have a totally new respect for deep dish and what we have is not deep dish, for true!

Was really impressed We went here on a tip from a Uber driver Solid 10 for the deep dish crust was perfect, sauce had a nice little bite with a hint of spice,  that went well with the meats we chose and a 10 inch was perfect for 3 people we'll be going back for sure

Pequod's serves pan-style deep dish, with sauce underneath the toppings. The thick, crispy, black edges are the perfect vessel for lots of cheese and a variety of toppings that include Italian beef, meatballs, spinach, giardiniera and more. If I had to pick one pizza place in Chicago to send my friends when they come to town, this would be it.

My biggest problem with the pizza is that it is too doughy. But I come to realize this issue varies day to day. It is less likely to occur with smaller pizzas. With bigger pizzas, I add extra tomato sauce (not an ideal solution).Overall, pequod's is a good pan pizza. It's caramelized cheese crust is to die for which is properly a very accurate term because there is no way burnt cheese is good for you. However, the pizza does lack some texture balance with the dough. And, unfortunately I do find this distracting to my eating experience. Don't get me wrong! You should still go out of your way to have this pizza if you haven't had it. It's unique. Just don't expect it to be the best unless all you care about is the caramelized crust.

I love pizza in all its forms: NY style, New Haven style, and Chicago-style. This was certainly worth the wait. I ended up going online a few days ahead and getting on the priority list, which made getting a table on a Friday night only 15 mins.It is very crowded so don't expect much for elbow space. Our waitress was awesome and quickly got our orders in (because Chicago-style is 45 mins of cooking).  We ended up getting a small pepperoni pizza for two and it was the perfect size with leftovers and not feeling completely disgusting. The sauce was incredible and crust quite flaky. Highly recommend going!

This is seriously the best pizza I've ever had in my life.  You want real Chicago deep dish?  Then forget Lou Malnati's. Forget Giordno's.  Come to Pequod's.  They cook the pizzas in cast iron deep dish skillets.  It gets served to you in the dish with all amazingly delicious crispy edges.  The pie is so full of the toppings you select.  We had a pizza with sausage and you can tell the sausage is home made.  This place is pretty big too.  You walk in and think the only tables are there on the main floor around the bar but the space goes back a ways and there's an upstairs.  It's a great space for sports viewing as there are TVs everywhere.  Pretty decent beer selection too.  We had to wait about a half hour for a table which was fine.  They have a space next door where you can order a drink while you wait.  Just expect to have to wait and plan ahead.

Ah where to begin! Chicago is notorious for their deep dish pizza and besides Lou's, I would recommend staying away from the Big 3 (Gino's East & Giordano's) because of Pequods and Art of Pizza. Don't get me wrong, the Big 3 are good, but I prefer Pequods over them any day. I have been here many times and Pequod's is one of my favorites in Chicago, but I ordered delivery for this review. Pequods is a official Blackhawks bar and it has a limited selection of beer on tap. It's two floors and the place is actually kind of old/grungy, but it really doesn't matter because you come here for the pizza anyways, right? In my opinion, Pequods has the best and biggest toppings in Chicago. It would probably rank as the heaviest deep dish pizza in Chicago! Their tomato sauce and bottom crust isn't the best, but it does it's job. To be honest, the bottom layer of crust is quite dry. The tomato sauce is a little wet, but it is flavorful. Lou's, Giordano's, and Art of Pizza have better sauce. But the best part about their pizza is the caramelized cheese crust! It looks burnt, but trust me is it glorious! I highly recommend ordering extra cheese as it gets applied to the crust. Two slices will definitely fill you up and it's about 2,000 calories. But it is worth it! Service is usually adequate and their appetizers are ok. I've had the Jalapeno poppers and cheese sticks, but they're average fried food. The salad was ok as well, but you should really save yourself for the pizza. Wait times can be very long at peak times so it's usually best to get on the preferred table list. Here are my rankings for deep dish pizza in Chicago: Art of Pizza, Pequods/Lou Malnati's, Giordano's, Gino's East, and Nancy's Pizza. Piece Pizza actually might be my favorite in Chicago and it's New Haven style.

In the beginning, there were Mount Vesuvius tomatoes that inspired the pizza napoletana (my favorite pizza). Later in 1900's, her younger sister, New York-style pizza was born (my second favorite). Many years later, their giant big-boned Chicago deep-dish brother was delivered. This pizza snob dude tried four deep-dish pizza big names in Chicago so far, and I hereby dub Pequod's  my favorite. However, do you know what the best part is about Pequod's pies!! For me, it was those caramelized burnt ends!! People don't like their ''cornicione''. But I found myself eating them, non-stop. My criticism is they pour a lot of sauce into the pizza. So when you're working on it, the sauce will burst all over your face and most importantly your beard. Thanks to some awesome Chicagoan friends, I was invited to a small event over here. We were about 20 people. Michelle, the organizer, pre-ordered lots of pizzas. To be safe, I ordered a small thin crust cheese pizza, because I'm a part time vegan. Michelle said it was the best among all pizzas ordered!! I really liked it. The cheese amount was a generous Midwestern portion by default. I would've loved more crunch on the base. But you know how it is. The flavors were there, 4.2989899 stars. The waitresses were efficient but you can feel they were pressurized as it was so busy and crowded. The place is old and dim from inside. But who cares if you have a fancy photographer friend like Daniel to make photos look amazing!. Location by the far nicely crowded western side of Lincoln Park is so smart and full of life. I had much fun meeting with new yelp friends over here. Cool people. My buddy Alex A was a must to be present, as usual. PS. my 26K marathon runner buddy from New York LOVES this place. Would definitely come back for those caramelized cornicione.

Food taste wise its delicious. My only complaints are how crammed the inside is, and felt a little nickle and dimed (got a big order of cheesy garlic bread that came with no marinara which seemed odd and got charged for the mini cups they brought us when we asked, weren't told we'd get charged for each one either) Food wise though the pizza is delicious. Split... or at least tried to split a small with a girlfriend and we didn't even close to finish it. Next time I'm back in Chicago this will definitely be back for the pizza, they know what they're doing in that kitchen.

03/23/18 - Last night an unofficial Yelp event was held as a farewell party for our former Chicago CM Alex S at Peaquods Pizzeria @ 2207 N Clybourn Ave in Chicago.  In Alex's S. short stint as Chicago CM he has did a great job of bringing together some epic Yelp events.  I would like to take this opportunity to thank him and to wish him the best in whatever his future endeavors are.  It was a fitting tribute hosted by Michelle, Salena & Liang at Pequod's Pizzeria for Alex S.  I was honored to be one of the chosen to attend the farewell party.As far a Peaquod's pizza I love the caramelized crust on the perimeter of the pizza, but I'm not especially fond of the thick soft doughy interior of the pizza.  Like many of the pizza restaurants they have both thin & the thick doughy pizza crust which I got to try both last night thanks to the thoughtfulness of the 3 ladies that took the time to canvas the 20 or so people in attendance to try and find out what their preferences were on pizzas.  I mentioned to Michelle that while I appreciated the thoughtfulness of doing that, it is very difficult to please everyone and suggested maybe a vegetarian options for those non meat eaters & a mix of meat & other toppings as it is hard to cater to everyone's individual choices.  Naturally I was surprised when both Michelle & Liang told me my pizza with sausage, mushrooms, black olives & garlic was sitting on the table as requested.  Thanks to the ladies for organizing this event for Alex S.  We all want to wish the Best for Alex S in his future whatever that may beThis is the first time I ate at the Clybourn location so it was kind of cool to see the restaurant which is a 2 story restaurant.  As I arrived I ran into Sarah S outside.  As we walked in we were told they had 2 groups upstairs in the 2nd floor dining area.  This is where we met our fellow Yelpers.  When it came time to pay the girls were working out the bill when Ahmed A came up and snatched the bill out of their hands and paid the bill for the group.  Thank you Ahmad That was a very unexpected and generous thing to do. I give 5 stars + for the cool Yelp people at the event, but only 4 stars for the pizza.  Very good pizza, but my favorite pizza is Lou Malnati's butter crust.

Pequod's makes the best deep dish pizza. I left off the elusive 5th star for one reason, well actually two. ..extra sauce. ..extra cheese. Make sure you order both & load up on toppings. Pequod's isn't at it's best with simple one or two ingredient pies. These mandatory additions (which should be standard) will make all your deep dish pizza dreams come to fruition. Let me explain.Pequod's doesn't serve the traditional Chicago deep dish pizza with a thick cheesy layer, instead there's a deliciously crisp bread-like crust with a caramelized cheese rim (see pics, it's not burnt despite the color). The extra sauce and cheese balances out the thick crust. All the standard toppings are offered and always fresh. No arugula, artichokes or pesto drizzles if that's what you're into. Just delicious satisfying pizza. Be forewarned the cook time is 45mins to an hour, but well worth the wait. Some tips suggest placing your pizza order with the hostess as you wait for a table. This was not an option during my last three visits. I suggest ordering wings and sit tight until perfection arrives.

Came in for my mom's birthday on a very rainy and icky Saturday. I had made a table request online the day before, which I would recommend because it seems to be crowded at all times, including 2:30pm on a Saturday.We came about 20 minutes earlier than our reservation and they were still able to seat us after only about 5 minutes of waiting. We grabbed drinks at the bar, I was pleasantly surprised to see they had Krombacher on tap.We were seated on the main floor towards the back, but they do have an upstairs that gets more natural light and looks to be a little more spacious. The seating is close-quarters for sure, but nothing super uncomfortable. Frankly, it is a pizzeria that has a bar and is not fancy, pretentious or otherwise, no frills.We kept it super simple and just ordered a large pepperoni pan pizza. We were advised it would take 45 minutes, but it came out in less than 30 minutes, so that was great!The pizza itself was fantastic! As others have said, it is not exactly like other Chicago deep-dish/stuffed pizza. This has a caramelized crust that is crispy enough to add good texture, but not like other deep dish where you need a knife to cut through it. I liked the sauce a lot, it has a little sweetness to it. Really a fantastic blend of what seemed like good quality ingredients. Not skimpy on pepperoni, cheese or sauce, everything came together wonderfully and we had a lot to take home from a large between 3 people. It's filling but I actually would argue not as "stuffing" as traditional deep dish.Our server was good, we didn't really need much, literally just ordered the pizza and that was about it.Great spot for a unique pan pizza, nothing but good things to say about Pequod's, I'm a big fan.

Finally, after trying 4 different pizza places in Chicago, this takes the cake for the best Chicago pizza I've had! I think this is what we envision when we say "Chicago deep dish pizza". However, it did remind me of Pizza Hut's pan pizza since I think they use a pan pizza base/structure, but different crust and sauce of course. It made me appreciate pizza hut's pan pizza! LolWe ordered sausage and pepperoni on our pizza and let me tell you, the sausage here is amazing! So definitely order sausage if you can.
Walked from our hotel for a city tour walk to eat at Pequod's.  We had to have the traditional pan pizza.  It is a great family neighborhood restaurant that you will love.
Two thumbs up for Pequod's Pizza. Cool little old brick building with a hip vibe. The service awesome.
Excellent pizza and great service. Looks like a small place from the outside but we'll accommodating

Having only had Lou's when visiting Chicago in the past, I was looking for deep dish pizza at a location that was favored by the locals and was not just a large local chain. My sister suggested Pequod's having been there before and I'm glad we came here.We were lucky to easily find the table as the 45 minute wait for the pizza is agonizing when you are starving! We ordered a medium deep dish pizza and customized one half while leaving the other as a cheese pizza. The pizza was amazing, the crust in particular was delicious. The servers were attentive even as the place got busier the later it got. Definitely, would recommend Pequod's to anyone looking to try deep dish pizza while in town.

Finally made it to Pequod's when an old friend was visiting from out of town, and just like everyone says, it is GOOD.It did take the full 35 minutes or so for the pizza, but that's to be expected with any deep dish. They just have their standard sizings of cheese pizza, and you can add whatever toppings you want - so we got peppers and mushrooms.  The whole place smells amazing, and when the pizza got to the table we were all practically drooling over it. The cheese is so meltey and perfect when they serve the slices onto your plate, and they've got a solid proportion of sauce to cheese to crust.  The best part is probably the caramelized edges of the crust, but the whole pizza eating experience was all in all amazing.If you like deep dish - go to Pequod's.

Although I'm not the biggest deep dish fan, this was definitely my favorite over Lou's and Giordano's. Their pizza is lighter and has an awesome crispy crust. It also feels much more traditional and less of a tourist trap than some of the other chains. The only time we eat deep dish is when people come to visit from out of town. This will be our go-to spot from now on!!

What to get: pan pizzaService: 5/5Atmosphere: Casual, sports barWait: 45 mins (Saturday 11:30AM for 1)The Experience:Another out-of-towner trying to get a taste of that legendary Chicago, deep-dish pizza. I should specify that this is a pan pizza, where it has a caramelized crust rather that a fulling-encasing thick crust. That extra crunch at the bottom of your pizza is what you're after.Even when it just opens, you're going to have to wait. It gets crowded easily and even as a solo diner, I nabbed one of the few spots at the bar. The waiting is actually for the pizza to cook. A personal size takes about 45 mins. Just choose your toppings, have a drink, and wait.The staff is attentive since they know you'll be waiting. The name of the game is waiting here. If you can do that, you're rewarded with a stellar pizza. A personal size is filling enough for 1 person. I even took some home to eat later, but it is similar to eating a pie. Best part is that crunch from the crust with the gooey cheese melting all over.It's a wonderful must-try if you're in town.
I ate here while in town and fhe food ans service was great!  Cant wait toCome back!

Attention, attention!! I don't care who you talk to or what they say, Pequod's Pizzeria is by far the absolute best pizza in Chicago.  I am not exaggerating. There's nothing else like it! I've ordered delivery and dined in at this fabulous locally owned establishment and I've never been disappointed. While the wait may be long depending on the day and time, it's totally worth it. Do yourself a favor and ignore the hoopla surrounding the larger pizza chains around the Windy City and eat pizza like a local!I'm pretty basic when it comes to my pizza options... I tend to stick with a plain cheese pizza and I douse it with red chili flakes and dip it in ranch. This pizza is what I believe most people would describe as a pan (deep pan) pizza, however it's truly unique and unlike any other pan pizza I've had. Not only in Chicago, but anywhere! The crust is buttery and caramelized to perfection! The crunch is amazing and gives it the texture you need when it's topped with ooey gooey cheese and red sauce. So delicious and filling. You're welcome! I can just picture the huge smile that will spread across your face as you devour your first Pequod's pizza... or your 50th (wink, wink)!

Insanity. Pure insanity. This place is fantastic and the pizza was the best we have had on our trip. The cheesy burned cheese goodness on the edge was fantastic. Thankfully it was the Blackhawks official bar, it was empty and had no wait. LETS GO PREDATORS!!!!

Is there a TEN STAR button?!?!?!   Noel was freaking AMAZING and it is the best pizza I have ever had in my 37 years on this green earth!    The meatball app warmed me up enough for the wait and the House dressing was fire!   But I swear best cheese, best pepperoni, best crust and unreal amazing customer service.  No question no doubt I'll go back!

Love love love Pequod's! This has to be my favorite deep dish pizza place in Chicago. I'm not a local, I'm not a native. Just a foodie Yelper who loves Chicago style pizza!I've had the typical places like Lou Malnati's and Giordano's, which are also good in their own rights. But when you pile your cheese high over the edge of the dough that it crisps up and makes each bite of the crust tantalizingly cheesey, how can you say no?I'm a classic with the sausage, which here consists of giant blobs of pure deliciousness and the best kind of kick to your encasd meat. They pile the toppings on sky high so you don't have to worry about bring jipped of the $2+ per topping. Honestly, my most recent visit consists of sausage, pepperoni, and green peppers and I had more toppings in each bite than dough, which is not a bad thing.Whenever I get meat toppings, I find that there's always enough sauce, but looking at the table next to me last night, who got all veg, I did notice it was a little drier than ours, so I can see why people ask for extra sauce.Even with the hour long wait to get a table and 30-40 min for the pizza, I still love it here. I do say, plan ahead - cause waiting nearly 2 hrs will get to you. I come hungry, but not hangry, and grab a small appetizer to share to tide free table over. 4 people, a medium pizza with app combo was about $10 a person. Definitely worth the trip!

The best. This is my favorite deep dish pizza in Chicago and I've lived here 30 years. I've gotten into arguments with people about which is THE BEST (between this and Lou Malnatis) but in those debates Pequads is always part of the discussion. It speaks for itself as you'll always find a line out the door of people waiting to get a table. It's a short wait (and they have a seated indoor place next door you can wait in), but worthwhile one. Definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for good quality Chicago pizza.

I've had Pequod's a couple times before (dine-in and delivery) but decided to stop in today for their awesome lunch special deal before a movie. For $4.95 you get a personal sized cheese pizza and a fountain drink-- it's an amazing deal! I added giardiniera and pepperoni (each topping was 80 cents) and a side salad ($2.50 extra). When it comes to Chicago pizza, I'm typically a diehard Lou's girl but I was really impressed by Pequod's-- especially for the price! The personal sized pizza had a lot more of the crunchy cheese on the crust that Pequod's is famous for compared to the larger pies. I would skip the side salad next time as it had not been spun properly and left a huge puddle of water in the bottom of my bowl. That amazing lunch special does not include any refills on drinks. My server never offered me another one which I gladly would have paid for. I'm in the service industry so I definitely understand the woes of a lunch shift where everyone is spending $5. It certainly wouldn't deter me from returning. Overall, this was by far my favorite Pequod's experience. I will go back next time I'm going to Regal Webster.

After a 2.5 hour wait...yes we hung out for that long, we were not disappointed. We had individual an pizzas; mine was sausage and mushroom and friend's was peppers, garlic, and pepperoni. The caramelized crust/cheese is what makes this Pequod's. Hip joint with upstairs area. Loud when crowded! Definitely will bookmark and be back next time in Chicago!

I had seen Pequod's on the Food Network and it was also recommended by locals, so I had to give it a try while in town for the race on the previous day.  I came in during lunch, so I had the lunch special, which includes an individual stuffed cheese pizza and drink (no refills) for $4.95 + tax. An extra topping is 80 cents, so I got bell peppers.  The lunch special is available weekdays from 11:00 AM to 3:00 PM.  You definitely cannot beat that deal anywhere in town, especially for the quality of the pizza that you get.The pizza itself is very good, just like everybody says!  It has a nice buttery crust that is nicely caramelized on the edges.  Despite all of the rave reviews, I think it is tied with Lou Malnati's for the best Chicago style stuffed pizza, which are both definitely better than Pizzeria Uno, Gino's East, and Giordanos.  However, Pequod's is definitely cheaper than all of the others, especially for the lunch special.  Pequod's stuffed pizza also has a higher crust to toppings ratio than the others, but that is OK with me...I know some prefer less crust and lots of cheese like Lou's prepares.Since it is so good, you can expect a wait since the dining area is quite small, unless you sit at the bar, in which case there is no wait if there is available space.  It is also very dark inside, and also very noisy and crowded.  If you are claustrophobic, you will not enjoy the dining area. People were bumping into me while I was trying to eat.If you are a fan of Chicago-style stuffed pizza, I highly suggest Pequod's.

This deep dish pizza is really good but is heavy. Got the deep dish pizza with Italian beef. It was really good, my critic to the pizza though is the crust is heavy and with all the sauce and beef it just keeps adding on. But to make up for the crust is the upper crust of the pizza is amazing. They melt cheese on the top crust and it looks burnt but is not and is to die for.

Soooooo good!!! I think they have the best pan pizza (deep dish).Ordered half fries, half wings, tossed salad, and a small pan (cheese, sausage, green peppers, mushrooms).Everything was amazing.The side crust is carmalized so it's basically a cheese crust. The bottom crust is more doughy so it's more of a thick toast than a regular pizza crust.

Yes this pizza is excellent.  However, I am just not Into the signature burnt crust.  Admittedly I totally inhaled three slices of deep dish pepperoni and mushroom.  And the scale showed it the next day.  This pizza IS excellent.  It all comes down to personal preference.

During my short trip to Chicago I had a tough decision deciding which deep dish pizza spot I would visit. I ultimately boiled down the choices to either Lou Malnati's or Pequod's and ended up picking Pequod's. Pequod's is not located in the touristy area of Chicago so I ended up having to catch an Uber here. Not wanting to wait a long time, my friend and I decided to stop by around opening time @ 11. We were quickly seated upstairs upon arrival. Our waitress was very friendly and was very attentive the whole time we were there. I opted for the personal pan pizza with green peppers, sausage, olive, and mushrooms. Keep in mind that toppings are not free of charge so it can quickly add up. The pizza came out within 10 minutes piping hot. It's worth mentioning that their personal pizza's don't come in the skillet. The thing that stood out to me most about the pizza at Pequod's was definitely the crust and the tomato sauce. The tomato sauce tasted very fresh and the crush was not too overwhelming. The toppings I opted for were not overcooked and paired well with the pizza. At the end of my meal I was glad that I was able to try out a Chicago deep dish pizza and throughly enjoyed it.Overall I had a positive experience from food to service at Pequod's. If I were to be 100% honest though I personally prefer NY pizza compared with the Chicago deep dish. The deep dish got a bit tiring for me near the end of my meal. If it's your first time in Chicago as a tourist, I would highly recommend trying out a deep dish pizza. I can't compare between Lou's or Pequod's but I'm sure neither one would disappoint as they both have very positive reviews on Yelp.

How have I never been here before!.... it still strikes me to say this, but they're... *taking a momentary pause. not for drama. more because it still hasn't sunken in, yet* .... I think I like Pequod's more than Lou Malnati's.I'm actually sad that I haven't been here sooner.I'm actually resentful that nobody's told me sooner.I'm actually pretty angry because I could have had much more Pequod's in my life, and what if my life had been over before I never even tried them.And maybe I'm in denial, and just haven't had a good pizza fix lately, as if being Chicago-born doesn't entitle me to a bit of pizza-coinnoisseur-ness, and I've shamed other 90'kids TMNT lovers by having denied myself such ooey-gooey-goodnesss..... I think these are stages of grief.BUT OH, HOW THIS PIZZA MAKES MY HEART SOAR!to find out that they sometimes have a 3-hr wait, makes perfect sense. That it has an adjacent bar next door, which is the DEDICATED space for waiting for your table --- also makes perfect sense. No... it's not pretentious. Pequod's is just that serious. This is like the Disney World for pizza, where you look forward to it, and expect the wait (on top of 45 min cook-time wait) because standing in line earns your right to taste the Pequod glory.OK ok I'm really over-embellishing.. it's just that Chicago is so rampant with pizza, that it remains difficult to be impressed.  But even their tomato soup was bomb dot com! ... and I sure love my tomato bisque from Panera, but DANG. it was slurptastic.... Even the leftovers were just as amazing. It's nice because their crust is crispy all throughout, unlike other competitors that can rave about a butter crust, that you have to commit to a slice to get to that tasty finisher at the end.  Every bite has that buttery finish.Idk. IF you haven't yet, you're missing out. I recommend a party only of up to 4 people so you don't have to wait, and to go at an off-time (like during the week, or before/after typical dinner service).  If you can eat 9 or later, I think that would be prime time to come during the week. Wow. I just can't say enough great things, and I'm already salivating, waiting on an excuse to come back.

The best pizza in town! I do not care what other people has to say but this is it. I would always bring my friends that are visiting here for a good ol' pizza. The toppings are generous! And the wait is certainly worth it.

5 stars for the pizza. 3 stars for the service. We arrived in Chicago for a short three day vacation and wanted some good Chicago style pizza. Upon recommendation, we gave these guys a try. We ordered a few standard appetizers which were pretty good with how basic they were. Then on to the main dish, the Chicago style pizza. Amazing. Absolutely amazing. We kept it simple with pepperoni, sausage, peppers and onions; and we were not disappointed. From the large chunks of toppings to the buttery crunchy crust. Words can't describe the awesomeness of this pizza. I highly recommend the pizza here. Trust me, you will not be sorry.

From the outside it looks small but when you go in boy is it spacious!! Folks had been telling me for years about the pie at Peaquods but being brand loyal to other Chicago pizzerias I paid them no mine. The unique thing about Pequods in my mine is the carmelized crust on the deep dish. The sauce has a nice balance as far as zestiness. Ate some deep dish, ate some pieces of thin crust. Enjoyed my Coca Cola! Refills were done promptly. Had a reservation with a tremendous group of people and we all enjoyed ourselves.I think it's neat how Pequods has a good reputation but it isn't of the old guard of Chicago deep dish places. It signals to the world that the torch has been passed to a new generation.

Pequod's salad was amazing, get the Caesar dressing as it comes on the side. Jalapeño Poppers were good, they messed up our order of the sauces but corrected it quickly. Mozzarella Sticks were very good.We ordered two pizzas and, while they were good, I cannot say they were great. The caramelized crust was good but I would not say it made the pizzas. I am a big fan of Lou Malnati's and, in my opinion, I would choose a deep dish sausage from Lou's over this. The big question is would I come again? Taking into account the wait, the pizza and the cost = No. For me Pequod's is one and done.

I'm from the area, and I have always thought deep-dish is gross. Pizza often makes me feel sick due to an excess of cheese and bread, so I only eat it if I know it will be worth it to feel terrible later. This stuff was the s**t. Not exactly deep dish like other places, but a deep pan pizza with a large amount of the toppings you ask for. I was surprised by how good it was and by the insane amount I ate of the spinach and onion I got - was also glad we got an appetizer as the wait is long (although they are very clear and up-front about it). I used to tell tourists that they were the only ones who liked deep-dish and locals thought it was meh, but it turns out I'm a fool who was just going to the wrong place. One star off because the A/C does not seem to be working there and it was crazy hot.

You can't beat the $5 lunch deal at the best deep dish pizza spot in the city. While the tourists flock to Lou's and Giordanos, the true Chicagoans know that it's all about the crispy cheesy crust, the savory smooth sauce, and the toppings for days on what can only be described as "crust with the perfect amount of pillowy, bready goodness while still remaining crunchy."Pequod's is the best. Get there as early as you can to avoid waiting for 3 hours. Call ahead to start your pizza order so you don't have to wait 45 mins once you sit down. And get a side of ranch to dunk your 'za. Trust me on this one.

Hands down best Chicago style pizza I've ever had!! I went for lunch and found that the personal pizza is the perfect size! I had nothing bad to say about this pie, it has enough sauce, cheese and whatever ingredient you choose to enjoy it completely and the burnt cheese as the crust gives the pizza an incredible crunchy taste! Besides the lunch special is perfectly priced and impossible to pass by. My experience at this place was so great that I did not mind the 45 minutes the pizza took to be made!

A m b i a n c e:Dim lighting, indoor seating on 2 levels, TV's, like a chill sports bar without obnoxious drunk people. Be patient, there will be a wait, but it's worth it. N o i s e  L e v e l: Kinda loud, tables are close to one another, so it can be a good date night spot. D r i n k s: Beer, wine, cocktails, and soft drinks.F o o d: Always get the deep dish pizza, it's the only kind a true Chicagoan will eat proudly. The ingredients are delicious, the sauce is not sweet, a great balance of toppings/crust/cheese/sauce ratio. Ranch dressing is also amazing. R e v i s i t: Yes, duh!

Late and quick lunch at one of my all time favorite pizza places in the world...Glad to see the quality of the pies hasn't declined since the passing of the owner/founder, Burt Katz... Personal Deep Dish with sausage and mushroom... Every pizza can be a personal pizza! Service was fantastic sitting at the bar...

Pequod's is delicious! Hands-down one of the best Chicago Deep Dishes in town.They are ALWAYS busy - especially on Cubs game days! I think they started delivery finally, so I will have to give it a try. I'm not a fan of waiting outside when it's cold for an hour+ for a table. The lunch special is awesome.
As far as pizza goes, pan pizza if my favorite vs thin crust and deep dish and ny style.  I love all the carbs that go with pan pizza and pequods does it the best.

Sitting in Hinsdale on a Sunday afternoon. Wife: Oh I could go for some pizza! Me: Mmmmm, Pequads!Wife: Yes, but that's so far!Two hours later (including drive and wait) we had the best pizza in front of us!! Thank you Pequads for existing. Now come to the Southwest suburbs so we can be even more friends.

Yum! This has been my favorite pizza place in Chicago. We went on a Thursday evening around 7 and only waited about 10 minutes for a table. The Pequod's salad and garlic cheese bread as apps were great and came out quickly. The pizza took the expected 40 minutes and was cheesy, saucy, and crispy.

I knew it would be hard to find a favorite pizza joint with a short trip to Chicago. And I know I still have many more to try. But after many recommendations for this place and trying a hand few pizza joints, this one. Pequod's. Is BESTEST (ok maybe it's tied with Bonci but these are completely different places that  also should both open up in Houston... please?). I prefer cheesy pizza with a thick yet crispy crust and savory toppings. Toppings like Giardiniera. If you like mildly spicy, tangy type flavors, you better add this stuff because it's a pizza game changer. And just thinking of their lightly burnt caramalized crust makes me want to get back on a plane and Uber straight to pequod's. Great place to spend a Sunday watching football with fantastic pizza and beer.

I got mixed recommendations about Chicago's Deep dish pizza. Some of our friends recommended skipping it, others compared it to a heavy casserole. Our friend and host recommended that we try Pequod's Pizzeria. I'm glad that we did!This Chicago style pizza is deep dish is made with a caramelized cheese crust. So the crust is cheesy-burnt, the bread is light and fluffy and you get a massive amount of sauce and toppings! The small sausage deep-dish easily fed 3 of us (me, K and a friend). Other than that, the service was great. The setting is bar/pizzeria. There is more seating upstairs. If you reserve with priority seating requests, you cut your wait time in half! I definitely recommend this style of deep dish!
Worth the uber from our hotel! Super small; got lucky and got 2 seats at the bar.  Delish pizza and beer!

Probably one of my favorite deep dish pizza places in Chicago.  It's hard to compare Pequod's to other deep dish joints, since this reminds me more of a pan pizza (which I guess is basically deep dish) but the crust is just different than the chains in Chicago.  The crust is fluffier, spongier, and more like bread than it's chain competitors.I really like that it's not a chain, locally owned, and there is only one in the city.  On the other hand, this makes getting a table sometimes difficult.  Going on weekdays and off hours helps with this.  Toppings are good, they have other appetizer options, but pizza is the way to go here.  Always been cooked well and never burnt, no complaints.
I was blown away. Was never a fan of deep dish but this place changed my mind. While the place was dingy and kinda cramped I will definitely be here again!!!!!

Definitely the best pizza place in Chicago. It's kind of a weird cross between a pan pizza and a few dish pizza. The crust is crisp and buttery like that of a pan pizza, but it's deeper and denser than a normal deep dish. That being said, I prefer it over all other deep dish or pan pizzas in Chicago. Our go to toppings are pepperoni, garlic, and onion.  We usually don't get garlic on our pizzas but someone recommended it to us and we've gotten it every time since!  However, if I had to pick one reason why this is my favorite, it's the crust! Smallish place, so I'm sure there could be long waits from time to time. We usually get it to go and max out on our couch at home.

This is a long overdue review. My friends were asking for food recommendations in Chicago and hands down, this restaurant is what the locals look for in deep dish pizza. Yes, be prepared to wait long but the great part is that they let you put your order in while you wait for a table. So once you are seated, your pizza is already cooking and waiting to be devoured. Don't be skeptical on how much a personal sized pizza can fill you up because my boyfriend and I underestimated and actually ended up ordering way too much. The deep dish pizza is so filling especially after ordering a generous amount of toppings. The crust is cooked to perfection, fluffy as a marshmallow but so much flavor in each bite. Just thinking about the pizza makes my mouth watery. Oh how I wish I could have my hands on a Pequod's deep dish pizza again... It really was love at first sight as you lift up a slice and all the cheese just oozes out.

Pequod's has the best pizza on earth, hands-down. Out of all the joints we have tried in Chicago, this one is the best. The sauce is perfect, not too sweet and very hearty. The burnt cheese crust is so much more delicious than we ever could have imagined. It doesn't taste burnt, just good. My favorite thing about Pequod's is that they don't skimp on toppings. If you order pepperoni, prepare for it to be completely covered - sometimes 2-3 ronis thick. I love it. It is my favorite stop in Chicago. Highly recommended.

So I'm generally not a fan of pizza but I really enjoyed the deal they offered for lunch more than the pizza :P Def going to come back here because why not have a slice and soda for a price that won't hurt the bank account!

I cannot believe I waited so long to finally get here! Ugh. I miss it so much. I wish I could eat Pequod's for every meal of every day.First, let's talk about the infamous wait time...Spoiler alert! The wait time was non-existent when I went at noon on a Friday! Amazingness! Score! Woo hoo!Next, let's talk about the lunch deal...It's about $5 for a personal pizza and then you can add a side salad for an additional ~$2. Well worth it! Okay, the salad dressing... UNREAL! They have homemade ranch and it's the best. It was perfect for the salad and obviously for pizza dipping. The pizza is beyond epic. The caramelized crust is everything it is cracked up to be and more.And last but not least, the service and the atmosphere...Every single employee was so happy and friendly. The interior kind of made me feel like I was in a pub. Okay, so Pequod's is like a neighborhood pizza pub. Well... Not LIKE a neighborhood pizza pub. I guess it IS a neighborhood pizza pub!If you want to get an authentic Chicago pizza experience, Pequod's is a solid place to check out! Get there!

I don't know how I've lived in Chicago for this long without reviewing Pequods. I am proud to say that without a doubt, Pequods is easily my favorite deep dish pizza in Chicago. It's a little different from your typical Chicago deep dish, and honestly reminds me more of a round Detroit style pizza with a buttery crust, carmelized edges, and sauce on top. In any case, it's awesome. Recently I discovered they offer fresh garlic and Giardinara as topping options- not sure I'd get those two together but both are nice additions. They get crazy busy on the weekends but you can put your name in and get a drink or appetizer next door. During the week the wait is shorter, if at all, and they have a really great weekday lunch deal too. They are open late, and while they do deliver, I don't feel as though it (or any deep dish for that matter) travels well, so I recommend dining in. It's also a fun place to bring your out of town friends who have only been exposed to the big chains.

Hands down the best pizza in chicago! Born and raised here and yes it's better then Gino's East and Girodano's! If you love cheese, this is the place to be. The crust on the deep dish pizza is caramelized cheese! It makes the pizza! Plus the pizza is very affordable compared to other Chicago deep dish pizza spots. The lunch special is about 7 or 8 bucks for a personalized pizza and fountain drink. There's also typically a line in the evenings so if you're going with a larger group, be prepared for a wait.

stopped in here for st. patrick's day dinner. as a first-timer to chicago, i really wanted to try deep-dish. didn't really matter *where*, i just wanted *some*. my boyfriend's friend recommended this place in lieu of a lou malnati's or something more popular. i will say this place was absolutely, ridiculously packed with people. we waited about 30 minutes before receiving a beeper... then 30 more minutes for a table. then about an hour for our food. i knew going out ANYWHERE was going to be a bear, so i was patient. got a salad to start. it was underwhelming. but the pizza? LAWD. i got a small pan pizza with extra cheese, onions, MEAT FRIGGIN BALLS, and spinach. ughhhhhh. it was so good. it tasted like a casserole. the crust was divine... sweet and almost caramelized. i can't WAITTTTT to come back here. on a regular weekend.

Literally my FAVORITE Chicago pizza spot! The Italian beef and giardinara is my go to. The pizzas are always perfect and super filling. I like to carry out because the restaurant itself can be very busy. It still tastes great but nothing beats fresh pizza straight from the pan in the restaurant.

Arrive knowing there is a long wait and no reservations nor a waiting list. Get a drink and watch one of the TVs while waiting for your buzzer to signal that your table is ready. Get a preview of the pizzas as they are delivered to the tables. There is a nice sized dining room and bar on the street level. However, there are stairs behind the bar that leads to the spacious upper dining room!  More TVs, windows and brick walls up here. Started off with the Piquad Salad which was packed with colorful veggies and dressing on the side; jalapeño poppers (not spicy, wish they were); mozzarella sticks (not impressed but teen son loved them). Ask for the marinara dipping sauce, it's really flavorful. While you endure the 50 minute wait for your pizza, the waitresses refill your drinks (complimentary soda refills!!).  Gave me time to organize my photos from the Chicago Auto Show. Impressive looking pizza!  Served piping hot and your first slice stays hot from first to last bite. And that's all I could eat because we had a lot of appetizers. But, this pizza is so good!  Love the burned edges on the crust. Added a unique flavor as it's not a "burnt" flavor, kind of sweet tasting.

As an out of towner hearing a lot of hype for this place, I must say I don't think it lived up to the hype food wise. I think it's a personal preference thing, my wife said if she could only have 1 pizza the rest of her life, this was it. I personally didn't care for the crust, it felt to me like pizza thats been left out, kind of stale. Like I said, it's a preference thing. I am giving them 4 stars however because they accidentally threw away the 1 slice we were taking to go when boxing it and they replaced it with a whole pizza. A+ service!

Really, really good deep dish pizza ; they're rated highly for good reasons. Not fine dine just a bar and great food.Highly recommended. The crust is absolutely the best part ...the crust should be eaten first the deep dish crust has the perfect savory with delicious burnt edges .The popular ones either load  too much cheese , too much meat or too much sauce. At Pequod's that was not the case.One of the best deep dish pizza I've ever had. The sandwiches are good as well the " combo sandwich" ( sausage and beef together ) are delicious.

Wow. This place lives up to the hype. We got mushroom and beef. Delish!We came at 4:45 pm found street parking right across the street and had no wait. They said the wait time would be 45 mins for the pizza. It was actually closer to 30, maybe less. We also got the app combo. It was ok. I probably wouldn't get it again.

The best deep dish I've had here in Chicago and the wings are good for an appetizer while you wait for your pizza to be cooked. We got here at opening time and the line gets long so be early and come hungry.

The legend is real! This place was ranked #1 on a few different websites in regards to being best pizza in Chicago, which is saying a mouthful. After ordering a medium deep dish sausage & pepperoni, I'd say you'd be hard pressed to find a better deep dish in Chi town! Everything about this pizza was heavenly; the carmelized crust, the sausage, the cheese, the sheer thickness & weight of each slice, good gosh!
