If you are looking for the DEEP dish style Chicago is famous for, you are in the right place. One of the best in the city at what they do, Pequod's is on most locals lost of top pie. Tourists, however, are missing out. Be prepared to wait, but so worth it!

Well, this was a pretty solid pizza.Arrived at 6:45p on Sunday night. There was a hawks game on.  The wait was approximately an hour. We ended up finding a bar seat.  The wait for pizza was advertised at 50 minutes but ours arrived after about 35 minutes.  In the meantime we ordered a Peqoud Salad (half size), which was more than enough for 2. Also ordered a tasty 3 floyds beer. Only 4 tap selections, but at least a couple were craft. The pizza was excellent. It had melted cheese on the side edge that was a little burnt and tasty. We also got meatballs and spinach on it. Both great options.

Very tasty pizza but for that price i would like to see more cheese. It's mostly bread and sauce. I believe their sauce and the way the cook it well done is the key. Maybe next time I go I will order extra cheese if they allow it. Therefore beware cheese lovers there is a paper thin layer of cheese on this pizza and the only way they can get away with this is because of how they caramelize the little cheese that is on there which amplifies the flavor.Also be prepared to for a possible long wait during busy hours, the restaurant is not very big.

Recommended to me by numerous people before my trip to Chicago, and most definitely praised by locals while I was here, I was on a mission to get to Pequod's. Seriously, this girl in an UberPool we were with was talking about the usual big dogs of deep dish since we said we were from out of town, but the moment I brought up Pequod's, she yelped (haha) like there were ants down her pants.It was a group of 5 of us, so we got the large (14") pie with pepperoni and sausage. We each had a couple of drinks so one slice was definitely enough, and two would bring you over the top. I had two :)While I still prefer the classic New York slice, I can definitely get behind the deep dish from here. The crunchiness of the crust is what sealed the deal, balancing out the gooeyness of the cheese, and the tasty (and not too salty) pepperoni and sausage. It truly tasted like they used some top notch ingredients and put a lot of love into their pies. To sum it up, there's no beating their meat! Might be fine in the back alley, though...
Best in town. If someone comes to visit it's the first place we go. If you think Lous is where you take someone from out of town, I feel bad for that person.
Best. Chicago. Pizza. If you're trying to decide between Pequod's, Lou Malnati's, Gino's, Giordano's, wherever else - you gotta do Pequod's hands down.

AMAZING. Seriously, if you are in Chicago and do not go here you are missing out. Me and my friend went here (world series weekend) on Saturday. We went on the website and requested a table for 2 at 4:30 p.m. about a week prior. When we got there we were immediately seated. I highly suggest you do that, the website claims it cuts the wait time in half. I know this place is always crowded so I was super happy when we were seated right away. We probably picked an early enough time. The place was pretty packed.When we were seated we ordered our pizza immediately (since the wait for a pizza can be up to 2 hours - ours was 2.5 hours). We also ordered fries and mozzarella sticks as apps, good choice because we were STARVING and smelling pizza and seeing people eat around you was not helping the wait. Oh boy I just wanted my pizza lol. We were told to order extra sauce, and thank the lord we listened to that kind gentleman because when our pizza came out it was AMAZING. We got a medium, extra sauce and pepperoni. I seriously am craving this pizza as I'm typing this it is that good. Any and every time I am in Chicago I will go to pequods. Seriously, it is that good and 100X better than the other chain pizza places (Giordanos and Lou Malnatis) I've tried them all and Pequods is by far the best. EVERYONE GO TO PEQUODS!

Everyone knows this is basically the best pizza ever. Just ask the insanely long line out the door every night. It's thick, hot, the veggies are fresh, it's not too saucey, and it's absolutely worth the wait. Perfection. The kind of spot you will insist upon to out of towners so they can experience joy for once in their lives.

Trust in the crust, not in the service.Pequod's is considered by many (the vivacious LeAnn P among them) to serve one of Chicago's best pizzas, and after a visit this past weekend I can believe the hype.It takes either a very special pie or a very special lady to get me to eat deep dish (as I much prefer thin crust); in this case it was a little bit of both.  Fortunately we came early enough in the evening before great masses crowded the place, so getting a table was no problemo.Knowing that their Chicago-style was legendary (3,000 reviews on Yelp, god damn!), we hastily asked for a 10" pan with pepperoni, sausage, and green peppers.  Pequod's is famous for their burnt cheese crust, which comes out black and delicious (much like Drake).Thirty minutes seems like an eternity when you're craving the 'za, but eventually it arrived and we dug in with little hesitation.  Great sauce, plentiful toppings, and a blackened cheesy pan crust had me singing their praises.  It was incredible, folks.  I'd say my expectations were high and even they got surpassed.  I still feel weird eating pizza with a knife and fork, but when it's as good as Pequod's I could honestly care less.Bread = 4.5Circuses = 2.5The 'za was as good as the service was bad.  But in what way?Our server Alex greeted us, got in our pizza order and brought us drinks, after which she pretty much vanished.  When our deep dish finally arrived, a different girl brought it out and sliced it for us, who later also brought us more refreshments......so where did Alex go?  Maybe she quit.  Perhaps a family emergency?  Noooooope!  Turns out, she was just chillin' at the bar, hobnobbing with some locals while enjoying a glass of wine and a slice.  Apparently, her shift had ended.  Areyouf*ckingkiddingme?I had no words.  None to describe how flabbergasted I was that our original waitress totally bailed on us without warning.  A quick "hey, I'm closing out, (new waitress) will be taking over for me", would have sufficed but we didn't even get that much.  When the check came, I wanted to confirm that Alex wouldn't get diddly squat tip-wise for abandoning her customers, but as the server was listed as "CZ01" (whatever the sh*t THAT means), I've really no way of knowing.The men's bathroom had a ton of graffiti in it, but not the cool kind like at Emporium Barcade where it's intentional in an edgy sort of way.  Here, it was a normal, clean-ish bathroom that a bunch of people straight up vandalized. lolIt's not that I wouldn't want to return here-- because the pan pie is really, REALLY good --but since everybody and their grandma claims that they're "Chicago's best pizza" I feel obligated to try them all before making a 2nd lap around town.Get here early to avoid the swarm of people, and pray that your server doesn't randomly disappear.

My sister & I came here Monday afternoon and we made it in time for the lunch special. We tried Lou Manalti's the other night, but we weren't amazed. On the other hand, Pequod's took our breath away.The Chicago Lunch Special is Monday - Friday 11 AM to 3 PM. You get a 7" cheese pan pizza and soda (no refills) for $4.95. If you want to add any other toppings, there is a charge per topping. For two lunch specials (w/ toppings), the bill came out to be around $12.One thing that I hate about Chicago deep dish pizza is the wait, but Pequod's was worth it. The crust was buttery and flakey. The sauce was amazing and it was cheesy (but not too cheesy). I highly recommend going here as the flavor is outstanding.
Not much else to say other than the food here is awesome.   The parking is a little off, but the food definitely made up for this.  My wife and I will be back sooner rather than later.

Pequod's has really gotten down how to get the perfectly crispy crust. If you love a crispy crust then you will love Pequod's.The taste is great and is a good location for deep dish pizza.The only thing I will add is that they could be a bit more generous with the toppings. I could count the pieces of ham that received on a pizza on 1 hand. Most other pizza locations overload the pizza with toppings.

The hype is definitely real. So this is how Chicagoan does pan pizza. Buttery flakey crust with nice and zesty tomato sauce. The caramelized crust is also really good. Here, you  build your own pan pizza, base comes with just cheese and sauce so add additional as you wish. Weekdays lunch special is probably the best deal. For $4.95, you get your own personal pan cheese pizza then add whatever toppings. Weekday lunch service is pretty quiet so if you're a tourist then I would recommend coming during this time.
Another Chicago staple.. I have been a customer for more than 25 years..., the crusted cheese sided pizza is like no other.. casual, friendly, family chi town must!!!!
Classic Chicago deep-dish pizza. Surprisingly inexpensive for how filling it is. Bring your A-game appetite.

Wow! What a terrific pizza rest, the personal size pizza is wonderful, the chicken wing were crispy and delicious, the service was fat, polite and friendly! We were lucky we didn't have to wait ! We will definitely go there again and again!

Place is much bigger than I thought.  We were seated on the 2nd floor. Needless to say even our big group of 23 people were quickly seated even though the place was so busy on a Thursday night.  It was my first time but we came here due to one person in our group saying it's the best deep dish pizza ever.  Well it was very good but it's not the best :). We ordered 5 large pan pizzas from regular cheese to sausage garlic to pepperoni garlic.  I'm so full as I ate 4 pieces.  The waitress was nice.  Don't know about the prices since I didn't pay.  My only complaint was the place was loud and we had to yell to talk and hear each other even though we were sitting so close to each other.  I would definitely come back if I'm in the area.
This is one of the best deep dish pizza places in Chicago. I usually get the sausage green pepper and black olive and it never disappoints. But whatever you get is good.

My most favorite thick pizza in the city. That crust is delicious and pizza is just amazing and worth the wait. Skip the typical bar food appetizers, they really aren't that great. But the pizza makes up for it. Just plan to wait for the pie.

Forget Giordano's or Lou's, Pequod's definitely has the best deep dish in town. Whenever we have friends coming in from out of town wanting some deep dish we always take them here. Main reason we don't come here more often for our pizza cravings is because the wait is usually 1-2 hours on any night of the weekend.  The staff is friendly and the food is great. Definitely order some appetizers since you'll have to wait about 30-45min for the pizza. I'd recommend the breaded mushrooms and bruschetta.

This is my favorite pizza in the city! The staff is INSANE about checking and double checking ID's here, which is so weird for a pizza restaurant. I've seen the waitresses drinking beer on the job too! I usually order and take home because I know the service is so poor, but god their pizza is so amazing

I've been eating Pequod's for years and love it! While I wish they put a little more sauce on their pizza, the overall quality and flavor is top notch! Make sure to swing by and check them out if you're in the area.

Best deep dish in my opinion. I'm usually a thin crust type of gal but after my experience with Pequod's. Would have to say it's my top deep dish. Been here a few times whenever my friends or family visit I would take them to Pequod's and they absolutely loved it. Some even order some to go on their flight back to California. It has all the right flavors. Perfect crust. Not too hard or soft. Just about right. The last few times I was at Pequod's. I order the vegetarian, can't go wrong with just pepperoni, and also the meat lover dish. Also order a side of fries and garlic bread as well. Just to warn you if you decide to come here get ready to wait. There's always a wait here that's how good it is or if you prefer not to wait. Order to go. Or come on an off time. There were days I've came here around noon during a weekday and longest I waited was 15 mins but weekends your average wait time would be 2hrs. There's only street parking so it's hard to find if you're driving but I always uber here.

Came here on a pizza tour; this was my second time here.  Ambiance: Large and crowded place. Pizza: We had the sausage pepperoni and it was quite yummy although quite heavy (maybe because we had been at two other pizza places before that). So i suggest you come with an apettie because the slices are quite large. Staff: We didn't have much contact with the staff so cannot comment.Everyone raves about this place and I suggest you try it at least once.

We were on the search for the best pizza in Chicago, and tonight I'm convinced we've found it. My sister is ignoring the fact she is lactose intolerant just to consume the deep dished goodness. The vibe is casual and in no way pretentious, the service was fantastic, and best of all, the food did not disappoint. Pequod's offers every comfort you would hope to find in a hometown booth.

This is real Chicago style pizza. It's the freshest pizza that I have eaten with traditional ingredients and their own special sauce. We were recommended to come here based on our hotel. We wish they had one of these places back home. It's so good. Highly recommend visiting if you happen to be in town. If you're a local, you're one of the luckiest person in town.

The pizza and chicken wings here are both top tier. Every time I have gone I have had to wait to be seated, which is a sign of how good they are. Because their popularity outweighs their capacity, I suggest trying to get before the dinner rush.

Amazing deep dish pizza. Really long waits, but sitting at the bar (first come first serve, wait for a spot) always gets  the job done! There's a small one upstairs too! Haven't had to wait for one of those spots yet.

I first heard of Pequod's on the Food Network. When I saw it, I immediately knew my first stop in Chicago. The wait wasn't as long as I expected and was seated within 20 minutes. I ordered fries for an appetizer and they came out quickly. The fries were really good and had some kind of seasoning on them to make them stand out. The pizza took awhile to come out and I expected that since it is made to order and deep dish pizza. The pizza was good  as advertised. The only downfall for my time at Pequod's was the wait to get cashed out.

Always great, and always worth the wait. Pequod's is, in my book, serves the best pizza in the city of Chicago. If you plan on coming though, know that during peak hours will could easily have an hour or more wait until you get seated, and then another 40 minutes to an hour before you get your pizza (not because they are slow, but because the deep-ish dish pizzas they serve take a long time to make). The bar has a good selection of beer, and the service is always friendly. On my most recent visit, about 2 weeks ago, we learned that the owners of Pequod's had opened a bar next door called Whale Tale. The great thing about that place is is that when you put your name in for a seat at Pequod's, your buzzer will work next door at Whale Tale. The people over there know that you are most likely there waiting for a table, and so the service is appropriately fast. Back to Pequod's though. Sure, ambiance-wise, it's a Blackhawks bar, but the pizza is the star of the show. Their pizza is, like I said before, deep-ish dish. I usually describe it as like a halfway deep dish. Pizzas are made in cast iron skillets and there is a layer of cheese baked in underneath and around the crust giving it a perfect, crunchy, parmesan seasoning all the way around. To me that is the best part. Pizza topping selections are plentiful, and they are not shy about loading them up onto the pizza. I've never had a bad experience here, but there was only one time that I was here that I didn't have to wait less than an hour for a table (I think it was the middle of the afternoon for some reason). I can not recommend this pizza enough. You should also note that they do have priority seating that you can access and set up from home before you venture out and take your chances with the wait time. That is definitely worth looking into.
Delicious deep dish pizza when done right. We unfortunately had severely burnt pizza the last time we have been here, alone with poor service, and incorrect bill.

4 stars for the very accommodating and very good service...but is it worth the Michelin hype? I didn't think so (3.5 stars for the pizza). The pizza crust is good, but when you order sausage in your pizza, you expect more than a few measly bits of sausage on your pizza. Seriously. My first slice was huge but had two tiny pieces of sausage. Good on the veggies, though. The next slice, which was smaller, did not fare much better. Alas, Pequod's, you will never replace my love of Lou Malnatti's with its stick of butter in the crust and wheel of sausage. Just to be clear, I didn't expect a wheel of sausage...just an adequate amount of sausage to reflect the medium pie we ordered. *sigh* Next time I'm in town, I will go back to my favorite, or even Giordano's which is a solid second in terms of pizza. This is clearly at least a third or a fourth. I really wanted to like you!!!

Visited Pequod's last week. My brother, nephew, and myself came out from California. I must say, you folks in Chicago don't know how good you have it there. You cannot get pizza half this good in California unless you make it yourself. We got 2 medium pizzas, sausage and pepperoni and sausage and onion. We are 3 big eaters and still had 2 pieces left over. The carmalized crust lived up to the hype, wasn't doughy at all, sauce was fantastic, and the sausage pieces were golf ball size. I loved the fennel taste and garlic. Servers were good and kept the water and beers coming as needed. I really enjoyed the old town feeling there as well. A dinner like that in CA would cost $100+, it was only $65 there. CA really sucks, at everything!!! I'm moving.

I'll start by saying: I'm not a fan of deep dish.  However, if I was in the rare mood for a bit, I'd say Pequods is amazing. Solid crust and good hearty sauce. Much is left to be desired on the restaurant venue appeal, didn't look pristine or clean, but I chalked it up to being a "dive pizza joint."  Plus, you're not eating pizza off the tables. :)
Not a huge fan of deep dish, however Pequod's hits the spot - way less cheese, more toppings & sauce. & the caramelized crust...! Give them a try!

Pequods was recommended to us by numerous people, giving it the title of "Best Pizza in Chicago". We were anxious to try the amazing caramelized cheese crust everyone was raving about. We arrived at Pequods on a Friday at 5 pm, thinking we would beat the dinner crowd. Upon arrival, we were told the wait time would be 20-45 minutes. After a little more than an hour, we were finally seated. We placed our order, and our waitress informed us that the pizza would take about 75 minutes. I wish they would have told us that earlier, but we decided to wait it out since we already made it this far. They weren't lying when they said 75 minutes. When the pizza finally arrived, we devoured it in less than 10 minutes. Was it amazing? Yes! Would I wait 3 hours again? Probably not. Next time, we're gonna try to avoid the weekend dinner crowd. Waiting 3 hours for a pizza is kind of ridiculous. Plus, they have a great lunch deal. Now back to the pizza. The bottom of the crust was buttery and golden, with just the right amount of crunch. The caramelized cheese crust was just how I imagined it would be. It had a nice chew to it. The ratio of bread to cheese and toppings was perfect. Not too heavy like most deep dish pizzas. I'm officially giving Pequods my vote for best pizza in Chicago.Four stars for wait time. But I guess good things come to those who wait.

WOW!!  Had the pan pepperoni with extra cheese and it was AMAZING. The dough was light and buttery sauce was perfect pepperoni just right and the cheese crust was out outrageous. Don't forget to order the wings,  a bit small but BIG on flavor. This is definitely the pace to come for great pizza and wings!

Delicious.  Great crust.  Amazing flavor.  Crust is out of this world.  Deep dish pizza is flavorful and is the best deep dish pizza in chicago.  the bread, crust, cheese is out of the park.  this caramelized crust is great. the cheese is fabulous.  Awesome Pizza!
Love this place a billion times!!!! Great pizzas!!! Velvet gorgeous voice waiter sang happy birthday. He made mr laugh so hard forget comedy clubs come here!!!!!!!awesome

The caramelized crust on their own pizza is to die for. I know this place technically isn't deep dish, but if you're looking for some Chicago-esque pizza in the city, I try to take visitors from out of town here instead of Giordano's or lou malnatis.
This is my favorite deep dish place in Chicago. The ingredients are fresh and delicious! You have to have the sausage, yum!

I've had just about every Chicago deep dish (I was born and raised in Chicago, so it's pretty hard not to try them all)I have to say, this was probably my favorite of them all.I loved the caramelized cheese on the edge of the crust, good flavor on the sausage, fresh toppings and plenty of cheese.The service was good, and although the place was extremely busy, we really didn't have to wait long for a table.  (had time for a beer at the bar)]Definitely a recommend, and in my opinion it's among the best in Chicago.

I wanted to kick off my first trip to Chitown right with a deep dish pizza. I was originally going to go to Lou Malnati's but my well-traveled friends steered me to Pequod's which is apparently where the real Chicagans go.My group of 4 waited an hour to be seated at 8pm on a Thursday. It took close to another hour before we actually got our deep dish pie. Caesar salad (9) - Pretty basic. It was pricey considering the salad came with nothing but what tasted like packaged croutons and one lone cherry tomato.Large w/ italian beef, mushrooms, onions (30) - Chicago is know for its italian beef sandwich so I figured may as well hit 2 birds with 1 stone and get it on my pie. The pizza came piping hot and the cheese were perfectly gooey. Pequod's is known for the burnt cheese that coats the edge of the pie and that was probably my favorite part. I'm usually not big on crust and unfortunately Pequod's wasn't an exception. I like my crust to be crispier but theirs is on the doughy, airy side.Was it delicious? Hell yes. Would I wait 2 hours again? Doubtful.Should you go if it's your first deep dish experience in Chicago? Definitely.
The only "deep dish" pizza I like. That carmely cheese... oh man...

First time in Chicago and I did some research on the best deep dish pizza prior to arriving. Pequod's was first on my list. I just HAD to go. The building was so old and had such a cool vibe. They took us up these old metal stairs to the upper floor. Loved the atmosphere! We were given shabby menus that you know thousands have seen and ordered the pan pizza which they were known for. We were told it would be a 40 min wait (they also had a sign as we came in that notified customers of the wait time). We ordered their bruschetta as we waited. It was phenomenal! The pizza seemed to come quicker than we expected. IT. WAS. AMAZING! It will haunt me in a good way. Staff was great. Heard about the Whale Tale. Can only imagine how crazy this place gets during the prime season. Will most definitely be back!!!

Best pizza in the city according to me. Love the sausage. Love the buttery crust. Deep dish is amazing l, but thin is quite good too. Definitely takes a bit to get a table sometimes, but it's worth the wait and they have good beer.
Our fav pizza in chicago- worth the wait for the atmosphere and classic flavor. We had drinks at the whales tail next door, had deep dish. Delicious!

My wife and I visited Chicago for a few days last week as part of our vacation before heading south.  I had never been to Chicago, and I am a real pizza lover, so naturally I had to try as many of the top rated Chicago Deep Dish pizzas as I could while I was there.  I was able try 3 personal size pizzas.  Giordano's was ok, Lou Malnati's was really good, but Pequod's was awesome.  By far, Pequod's was the best deep dish pizza I had in Chicago!  I just wish they shipped like Lou's does.

Came here with my friend for lunch to try another Chicago-style pizza place, since I had tried Lou Malnati's during my visit to Chicago last year. We were seated immediately upon entering. The interior is not huge; the restaurant is deep but not very wide. The atmosphere was very pub/bar like, which I did not expect. Service was friendly and our waitress was great. She said it would be about a 45-minute wait for deep dish pizza, so we tried to place our order quickly. I think the actual wait time ended up being just a little over thirty minutes though. I also ordered one slice of thin crust just to try, and added one of the "premium toppings" of Italian beef (apparently also very Chicago) to it. It was a big slice and not bad, but I prefer my thin crust even crunchier (think New York-style pizza, and yes, I realize that I shouldn't be expecting that while in Chicago). All of the deep dishes start off with just cheese and you customize your pie from that point after picking a size. Each additional topping costs extra, and the cost of each topping depends on the diameter of your pizza. You can also order half-toppings (I think it means it is only put on half of your pizza) and premium toppings. The deep dish was decent, but not particularly memorable in my opinion. I enjoyed the "caramelized edges" mentioned on the menu, but instead of the crunchy crust I was expecting, it was actually just darkened cheese which they must sprinkle along the pan's edge. I think I prefer a crunchier crust overall, which is why I usually get thin crust during the rare occasions that I eat pizza at all.I'm glad I tried Pequod's and their food is not bad, but I think Lou Malnati's better suits my tastes (just a personal opinion).

Not a big pizza person but the pizza here is unlike anything I've ever had. The caramelized cheese makes the pizza and it is supported by great crust and sauce. Don't be afraid to order randomly off the menu the quality of food shows through all their dishes. Service is always great and thorough even when they are extremely busy. Always worth the wait.
My favorite pizza in the city. Even great the next day. Open late and delivery too (though it's best if you get it in the restaurant)

Stuff me like the bread and beer processing machine I was meant to be. I've been sauced many times at this fine establishment not only from the vast beer selection but by the never ending flow of well spiced tomato gravy.
Best fuckin pizza I ever had in my life but I have yet to visit NYC just for the record.... Don't sleep on em

Visiting from San Diego I tried three places while in San Diego. Connies, Luminatis and this place. This place wins hands down.Ordered the deep dish with sausage jalapeño and onion. Shared a pizza with a friend for $30.Totally worth it!

Definitely do their "priority seating" thing online. Even with that, it took an hour and a half to get a table (we were quoted 30-1 hour) and then you have to wait an hour while your pizza cooks...Other than that everything about this place is amazing. The interior is cute and reminds you of any of the other Chicago pizza joints, and the waitress, while overwhelmed, was still friendly. The sausage pizza was absolutely AMAZING!!!!! I have been a die hard fan of Gino's (despite being told it's a tourist pizza, not the real deal) but I may have to change my allegiance...I had been told this was where true Chicagoans go for their deep dish, and now I totally get why. The pizza was easily some of the best I've ever had. Overall, come on an off night, cuz they aren't exactly the best with managing reservations. But no matter what the wait or price or whatever, the pizza is worth it.

I've ordered delivery from Peaquods a couple of times in the past and had I never been to the actual restaurant, this might be a 5 star review.I feel like the longer I live in Chicago, the more I hate deep dish, but of all the deep dish places, this is one of my more preferred...It's saucy, there's a hell of a lot of toppings (so you don't feel ripped off paying $30+ for a damn pizza), and though heavy - you don't feel as terrible as you do after eating Giordanos, per say.My visit to the actual Peaquods though (and I've been twice), was kind of disappointing. The actual pizza parlor is a little reminiscent of a dive bar (similar to the feel of Pizano's on State/Gold Coast). My complaint though has to do with the waitstaff. It really seemed like they were doing the minimum. "Can i take your order?" "here's your food" "Here's your bill." It just took away from the deep dish pizza experience.That all being said, I still recommend Peaquod's to all my out of town friends (vs. some of the other well known deep dish chains in Chicago).

My best advice is to stick with the classic toppings here: sausage, peppers, onion, tomato. I'm sure there are some other delicious variations but I haven't found anything that compares.And if you have the time and a car, I highly recommend going to the Morton Grove location instead. It's like going back in time -- totally chill and different experience and you can bowl off the calories nearby.
My favorite. Crust is unreal. Tend to overeat and say I'll never eat pizza again, but I eventually find myself coming back to Pequods.
Amazing Local deep dish with a tantalizing burnt cheese crust!  Solid sausage and sauce that's just right. This place really hits it home for me being from the Windy City. Best deep dish in Chicago
The wait time is absurd on a weekend evening - but if you eat the pepperoni deep dish, you understand why.
Big portions and delicious. We ordered a medium pizza and were so full! I had leftovers for days. I'd definitely come back here. Such a chill setting.

Yum! Long wait! Went at 12:45pm on a Sunday. It was packed, but we got a table for two within about 20 minutes. Our pizzas came about 45 mins after ordering (which was quicker than the expected 50-60 minutes). Got two deep dish personal pan pizzas, one pepperoni and one with pepperoni and veggies. The crust wasn't too massive (which is why I don't like Giordano's), but I didn't think it had much flavor either. The toppings were nicely cooked and there was a good ratio of sauce and cheese.Nice atmosphere, the front windows open, good selection of drinks and apps to keep you satisfied while waiting on the pizza. There must have been group seating upstairs, but the downstairs has a bar and two and four tops. Next time I'm going to pop over to the new nail place just across the street to get a quick mani while waiting!

Came here on a Saturday around 7:30pm and there was a two hour wait for a party of 2. Luckily the bar is open seating so my friend and I managed to find a seat in about 20minutes. We shared a small pan pizza with pepperoni and mushroom and it was delicious! They are generous with their toppings, which helps balance the thicker crust. I also really enjoyed their tomato sauce, which is surprising because I'm usually not a fan of super saucy pizzas, but the flavor was phenomenal.  I've been in Chicago a few years now and have been to all the major places. Pequod's pizza isn't what comes to mind when I think of "deep dish" due to the fact that it's not stuffed. Instead it's a thicker caramelized bread crust that's balanced with a generous portion of good quality ingredients. Regardless, it's a Chicago must! I really enjoyed the pizza and would definitely recommend it!

Excellent deep dish pizza in a dive-y setting. We had a small and it was plenty for the two of us with leftovers to take home. Loved the carmelized crust. We shared the half sized house salad and that was also plenty. It was about 5 miles away from downtown so nice to get out of the downtown area for a bit on our long weekend visit. This place is legit.

Can we talk about how, after living in Chicago for 8 years, this is still my favorite deep dish? Downside? The wait time for a table is LONG. Good thing they built a place to get drinks and bar snacks next door. It makes going here in the winter a possibility. But yes go. Great pizza!

During my short weekend trip to Chicago, I had the pleasure of trying 3 of (from my research) the top deep dish pizza joints in the city. Pequod's is ranked #2 for me.I highly recommend going to their website and making a reservation right away. They will text you a day before to confirm your ressie and you're set. When we walked in on a Saturday night at 7pm it was PACKKKED. The party of 2 ahead of us was given a 2.5 hour wait time. We were a party of 7 and we were seated right away. MAKE A RESERVATION.Loud, large dive bar feel. + bruschetta - Skip it. It's bland and not good at all here.+ ravioli pesto and marinara - Both were tasty, but nothing to brag about. If you're craving ravioli and want to order one, I'd say go with the pesto.+ PIZZAAAAAACRUST - their "caramelized crust" is their specialty and what separates them from the rest. It's basically burnt layers of cheese -- ok that doesn't sound too appetizing but trust me, it's so crunchy and SO good. TOPPINGS - You can choose your own toppings (from basic and premium lists). They say  not to pile too much on.-- Sausage and pepperoni - per our waiter's recommendation. Basic, but SO SOLID. I think would've been better with mushrooms and bell peppers.-- Bell peppers, mushrooms, and Italian beef - also per our waiter's recommendation. It was good, but the beef didn't really go well with the pizza overall. I wish we would've gotten more veggies and tried the meatballs instead.I think if we weren't starving and did more research on which toppings to choose, we would've enjoyed our pizza way more. Nonetheless, Pequod's is still a MUST on your hit-list for Chicago eateries and we're glad we got to enjoy it with little hassle/wait.
Pequods is my favorite deep dish in the city. Thinking about the crispy cheese on the crust makes my mouth water. It's pretty reasonably priced too.

We got there at 11:30! Thank goodness! Within in 15 minutes we would've had to wait 2 hours...we had a group of 10.In summary, excellent Chicago pizza!My family argues between Lou's and Giordanos... but we unanimously agree this is the best!The cheesy carmelized crust is to die for!My favorite is the pepperoni, then the sausage, then the cheese.I like mine saucy... so definitely the meat pizzas were the most saucy.Excellent sauce and high grade meats! The Pequod salad was also very good! Overall... worth the drive from downtown!
Probably best CHICAGO style pie I've had. I don't get it often so many experience has only been lous and giordanos
Best chitown deep dish pizza I have ever had... from the sauce, the freshness of toppings to the crispy crust and the flavor was absolutely unique and fantastic.
Chicago. Day 7. Pizza.Deep dish crust - 5/5Toppings (pepperoni + sausage) - 3/5Toppings (italian beef + ground beef) - 4/5Overall, best deep dish I've had. "As good as it gets."

I was super stoked to give this place a try--so much so that I decided to wait the 1hr20min wait on a Friday night to get a table for five (not to mention, the 50min it takes for pizzas to come out).Two hours and ten minutes after my arrival, my small pan pizza (w/ pineapple, mushrooms, and sausage) arrived before me. I took a bite, and it was great! ...The thing is, it was only great. It wasn't mind boggling-ly good. Honestly, I prefer Lou's to this. I was sorta let down. That said, I will say it is definitely filling, which is satisfying; also, the caramelized crust was a nice extra touch to the pizza. Yummy food, but there's no way I'd come here again if I have to wait an extended amount of time. It's simply not stellar enough for so long a wait. Maybe I'll come check it out on a weekday during the day, and score that sweet lunch special they have.

Don't go here on the weekend, the wait is ridiculous! Or plan on having four hours to hangout!If you've ever been to Detroit and enjoyed an amazing Detroit style pizza such as Loui's or Buddy's or for those that haven't made it there but may have had Jets! You know that it's all about the crust! This place has the crust dialed in! Its that Carmelized cheese baked to the edge crust that makes the whole slice worth it! This pizza was great it was like the best of both worlds Chicago meets Detroit and I loved it! I'll be back someday for 2nds!A little tip would be don't waste your time with veggies on these pizzas! Sausage maybe some pepperoni is the best way to enjoy! Get a salad too, very good!

We got delivery expecting it to be a little less than stellar for the travel. We were WRONG! The salad was so cold and crisp. We received a different dressing than requested (homemade Italian), but it was so good that I'm calling it a happy accident. The pizza itself _is_ really bready, especially in the center, but the intensely caramelized cheesy crust makes for such a lovely flavor and texture counterpoint--also the onions on our pie were a welcome bit of crunch and sweetness. Totally unique and totally delicious!

Unfortunately it's kind of easy to get tired of deep dish pizza sometimes as a Chicagoan, but this place never disappoints. The wait time can be a bit unbearable at times but if you have the patience, it's for sure worth it, and it's nice that even on a Sunday at like 11 p.m. it still feels busy, not like you're at a place where they're waiting to chase you out.Tips: go for the deep dish that has the full layer of sausage meat in it, and try the WINGS. You've been waiting to get a table for a while, and the food is going to take even longer once you're seated, and you won't be sad you ordered the wings while you're waiting.Delivery is pretty great, too, but don't order when you're hungry as it usually takes a while (90 min or more, sometimes 2 hours) even if you're close by. The food almost always still shows up hot though.
Hands down the best Pizza in Chicago! Burt perfected it at Pequod's! I would highly recommend if you only have one chance to try Chicago Pizza, you go here!

First time trying Chicago Deep Dish, definitely met my expectations. We ordered the a small and a medium for 5 people and it was the perfect amount. The pizza was perfectly cooked all the way through. Very heavy and filling. Had to wait 30 mins to get seated and around an hour for the pizza. Time expectations were given early and was on time. Food was 5/5 but service was 3/5. Good local feel! Would go again if I am in the area!

Probably the best deep dish in Chicago. Portions are great, atmosphere is casual, and the pizza is super flavorful. I tried some cold leftover pizza and it was bursting with flavor. Caramelized crust sets it apart from others and it's honestly fantastic. Prices are also incredibly reasonable. Highly recommend

It really is worth the wait. Really.We waited 50 minutes for a large pan pizza with extra cheese, sausage, mushrooms, and onions. It was divine. We also really enjoyed the fried zucchini appetizer.This is what deep dish should be.
Love Pequods it's the best deep dish pizza in Chicago!! I always get garlic, tomato and spinach on it!
Noisy, raucus, crowded--but with terrific pizza. Alas, the waitress forgot our salad, but who really needs salad when the pizza is this good?

Pequod's over Lou Malnati's or Giordano's.I found this place during my first year in Chicago, and having been to Lou Malnati's or Giordano's in and around the city, I recommend out of towners go here.When I'm bringing friends around town, I usually bring them here for the $4.95 lunch special, which includes a 7" personal cheese and a fountain drink. For a dollar more you can add a topping. I'm not sure if I'm misremembering, but they used to consider a beer (Miller Lite?) as a fountain drink, but they haven't continued that as of recent visits.The wait for the pan takes around 30-40 minutes, so I kill that time by hanging out with the friend(s) I've brought here. The pizza is enough to fill you up, and it's just a quality crust with the right amount of crunch, give, butteriness, and burn.I'm not particularly a follower of ball game or other sports, so take everything I say now with a grain of salt: the sports vibe here is as Chicago as it gets without having to go to Wrigleyville.Love this place.

Good deep dish pizza and wings. Crust on the pizza is what makes this pizza stand out from any other Chicago style deep dish. The sauce is a bit sweeter with ample amount of toppings, I got jalapeños and pineapple...jalapeños are very spicy so had to pick off a few of them as there were lots on the small personal size pizza. Bbq sauce on the wings was sweet and juicy. Good quick service. Would recommend!

This pizza really is as good as everyone says, but do yourself a favor, skip the thin crust and go straight for the deep dish.  The thick cheese crust is awesome and they don't skimp on the toppings.  To avoid the longer-than-you-can-believe-lines, call ahead and that should cut your wait in half.

Ali and I take family and friends here who've never had deep dish... It's our go-to, just as Johnnie's is our go-to for Italian beef. Pequod's is always always packed! When here with a group of five we waited one hour to get a seat and one hour to get our pizza, and it was the best!! I love the caramelized crust! You better not call it burnt or I will pull all my hair out right in front of you. Ali and I don't go to deep dish joints EVER, unless it is to entertain guests - and when we do go we always order the small pan with onion, mushroom, pineapple, and anchovy. Even the small is massive. One slice of this stuff is like three regular slices of pizza. This ish is definitely a casserole, and they don't skimp on the toppings. When here entertaining a friend most recently we only had to wait 20 minutes for a table, and 45 for our pizza. Not bad! They also sat us in the back booth with the comfy seats. Every single seat in the house was full and there was a huge crowd waiting for a spot when we left. If you can handle the crowd and the wait times you'll have the best deep dish in Chicago.

It has all the feel of a friendly neighborhood restaurant with my favorite deep dish pizza in town. The interior is cozy and warm and the building is multi-story.The signature of the deep dish here is the cheesy, caramelized crust. It looks blackened and burnt, but it tastes delicious! The crust is actually not all that thick or bready despite it being deep dish. The pizza sauce has a nice sweetness to it that's not too overwhelming and the cheese is delicious. As for toppings, we had Italian sausage and spinach. I would certainly recommend the sausage.

Pequod's serves up the quintessential Chicago deep dish experience. It's a fairly small restaurant in a residential neighborhood across the street from a movie theater. We got extremely lucky as there was practically no wait on a Sunday night. Our server was great, super friendly and willing to accommodate changes to our order. The pizza took about an hour to get ready, so definitely order some appetizers. Their cheesy garlic bread dipped in marinara is delicious and extremely hot, so give yourself a minute or two before you devour it. I highly recommend the wings as well. I personally prefer the barbecue wings over the buffalo, which has a nice kick if that's what you're feeling. As for the pizza, there's no doubt about the "deep dish" part. It's thicker than the ones served at Lou's. One slice can count as two slices of a normal pizzas. You get to pick your own toppings. We ordered a large and I'd say it would easily feed 5 hungry adults. Overall I was very happy with the experience and would come back!

This place exemplifies a great pizza experience. The pizza I get is what they are known for, Chicago Style! Yet the do it a little different the dough is so thick unlike other Chicago style pizzas the toppings are mostly on top. While it may not sound great it is because it makes the pepperoni always done perfectly! If you don't like it crunchy the pepperoni just underneath will suit you. I have tried other toppings and from the ground beef , mushrooms, peppers and sausage everything maintains it's flavor but yet doesn't over shadow the sauce that is great in its own right. Now the very edge of the pizza comes out burnt so don't be alarmed!! This is a must visit for anyone in the area! They usually have a 45min. Wait on the weekends so I am a fan over the personal pizza lunch special!!

I'm a New Yorker and swear by NYC pizza. NOTHING is better. However I will say Pequod is nothing to play with in the pizza game. I came here looking for the best deep dish. I didn't have time to experience all the deep disp spots so I looked at a few reviews and narrowed my search down to two places Lou Malnati's and Pequod. Don't waste your time, money and calories going anywhere else but Pequod for deep dish. 4 stars because it's not NYC pizza.
I don't even like deep dish or meat and I tried both and it was outstanding. This blows Lou's away, easily!

Look, you either love it or you think its nothing special. The ingredients are great. Sure, sometimes I wish it had a little more sauce, though I've got enough to go around ;) But what sets it apart from the rest is the crust. The caramelized crust makes eating it a delight. It might be the best part. At the other well known Deep Dish Pizza chains in Chicago, more often then not, people don't eat the crust, and that's just sad and wasteful. Shame on them for making dry, thick, no-fun crust. Stomach real-estate is scarce. Fill your core with good crust. "Pequod's .. it's crust-have pizza." - me

Each time i've been here, the quoted wait time has been longer than it actually has been to get a table. I really enjoyed the pizza. I would describe this pizza as more "bready" than some of the other pizza institutions around town, but it was quite good. The pizza is well assembled and if you were really bold you could even eat it with your hands because the sauce and toppings are not overflowing like other establishments. This is a solid pie, I would put it in its own league!

Best Chicago pizza! I'm in from Miami during hurricane Irma and I am coming to my pizza spot! This place never disappoints me! Start delivery to Bay Harbor Island, Florida! It's the crispy crust, the oozy cheese and the sweetness of the sauce and all the sausage, peppers and onions!

When I have friends come in from out of town they always want deep dish. Everyone will tell you to try this or that. Here's the thing. Pequod's is my favorite deep dish in the city. I don't usually eat deep dish, just because it is a lot to handle. But this is where I go when I do. The way they cook the pizza in the cast iron truly traps in the best flavoring. Just writing this is making me want to go back there again.
This is it. Real Chicago, not one of those tourist traps.If you don't want to wait 2 hr for done in call for pick up 1hr

Let's imagine you live 1500 miles away and you see this joint on TV and think 'that looks great, but I'll never be there'.  Then, just a week later you are in an Uber heading to this joint. What a treat this place was - the pie was just as it was on TV and maybe even a little better. It takes a while, but they tell you that up front and well worth the 40 minutes.  In that 40 minutes, we had a couple beers and a chicken wing appetizer. The wings were very well done with ample sauce. When the pizza arrived, I immediate regret ordering a medium for two people. It could feed 6. The browned cheese on the outside of the crust was the highlight. I coulda eaten just that. The place is great. Good atmosphere, only one moderately grumpy employee (who isn't at 10:30 on a Thursday night?), clean and great food. Eat here, you'll love it just like I did.

One of my favorite deep dish pizza spots in Chicago and I live above a Lou Malnoti's (ps I still love you Lou). Of you're from out of town this place is a must to complete your Chicago pizza experience. Bon appetite!

You definitely have to wait in order to get a table, esp.on weekends. We were 5 people and waited for 1.5h. They have a good selection of pizzas; generally, you choose all the ingredients and size. So we ordered medium size with all vegetables, and another with meat. Too much dough at the bottom in comparison with Giordano's pizza. I would rate their pizza 4/5, was not "wow" personally.

One of my favorite pizza places in Chicago. A little different with the burnt cheese crust but it's delicious. They always have a long wait if you go around lunch time or dinner time. I usually get the pepperoni with mushrooms or hot peppers. They do have some limited beer selections. I would recommend anything really on the menu. I also like my pizza well done which add a crisp taste to the crust.
I only managed to eat one slice because it was so filling. The wait is long but well worth it.
Pequod's is just the best. You know you're getting a quality pizza each time, and that you'll have to wait a long time to be seated. Favorite pan pizza in Chicago.

I'm a big fan of deep dish pizza and Pequod's is definitely one of my favorites. I'm used to the suburban location, which is a lot smaller, but this location was larger and much, much busier, which was expected. Went here on a Sunday night around 7:30p with a pretty large group (11 people).  There wasn't a problem getting seated, which was nice, but we were a bit crammed in a round booth table. The server was really nice and very patient as she took our drink orders right away as we waited for some of the others to get to the restaurant. There wasn't that big of a selection but they had a decent sized list. We ordered two orders of the appetizer platters which was just enough for our large group. I really liked the fried zuchinni, but wasn't that big of a fan of the jalepeno poppers. We ordered 2 large and 1 medium pan pizza. It took about maybe an hour to arrive but it was worth it!. We had one with Italian beef and giardenera, another with just sausage, and the last with mushroom and spinach. Everyone enjoyed all of them! The crust was crisp to perfection. Definitely enough for 10 people! There were some leftovers but not a lotFor first timers--I recommend ordering an appetizer since pizzas take a while to cook, and if you are ordering the deep dish pizzas, go no more than 2 toppings, as it might get a bit overwhelming.

I love, love, love their pizza here. I'm not a traditional Chicago style pizza person. This place gets packed on the weekends and during Blackhawks games so either be prepared to wait to eat in or order ahead of time to take out.Their pan style pizza (I recommend to order with extra sauce) is amazing. Haven't tried much else on their menu but it all looks good.

Pequod's was pretty busy around 7:30pm on a Sunday night. We had a party of 11 and we were seated right away which I think was pure luck lol because this place is always packed. We were able to sit in the corner booth by the fireplace which was a nice touch cause it was pretty cold on that side. We ordered 2 appetizer combos which had breaded mushrooms, fried zucchini, mozzarella sticks, and jalapeno poppers. I liked all the options and it was cooked perfectly. I would def order this again to have a taste of 4 appetizers. I also think it was around $10 for a platter which isn't bad. We got 3 pizzas. 1 large sausage pizza, 1 large veggie (mushroom and spinach), and 1 large half giardiniera and italian beef. There was a confusion when we ordered the last pizza because we wanted the full pizza to be italian beef but only half of it have giardiniera on top. All the pizzas were delicious and cooked great. It did take like 45-1 hour for the pizzas to come, but it was well worth it. I'm very loyal to Lou's, but Pequod's is pretty up there. If you're visiting Chicago, you should def check this place out.

So delicious! We came here for lunch on a Sunday around 2pm. There was no wait for a table for three of us. Or server was friendly. We ordered a thin crust and deep dish. They brought out the thin that was done just a few minutes before the deep dish so we could get started enjoying it. We got sausage pepperoni and both were very tasty!

Best Deep Dish Pizza in Chicago. That's my opinion, but you need to try this pizza before you disagree. Let me explain my stance:They get the ratio of ingredients right. Dough, there's a lot of it, but it's light and fluffy. It's the backbone of the pizza but it doesn't dominate. It's delicious and hot and bready, and it won't feel like cement in your stomach. The crust is still sturdy and crispy.Cheese, less cheese than the other deep dish slices, in the best way. You taste it, but you're not chomping through puddles of grease in a cheesy swamp. The burnt ends are a culinary treasure, chewy with sweet, intense flavor, makes the crust the best bite.Sauce, the best standalone sauce in the city. Sweet! You can taste the tomato. It's not too acidic. Thick and applied liberally. Toppings, so generous. If you order pepperoni (the best topping) you get a tight weave of pepperoni that covers the whole pie. There's no other pizza place that borderlines too much pepperoni, it's a wonderful problem to have. In summary, the construction of this pizza makes it the best in the city. It's okay to disagree with me, but not before you've tried it.Order in and out are both challenging experiences. There's usually a pretty heft wait if you're dining on the weekends. Navigating the crowded entrance way to pick up your takeout order is pretty frustrating. Whatever.

Delicious pizza, authentic and old school setting. The perfect experience for my first Chicago deep dish. Really enjoyed the pizza and ambiance here. Service was a bit slow, but to be expected as it was Saturday afternoon and the place was packed! Will definitely be back for another round of tasty pie.

This is easily one of the best pizza places in the country. I came here as a stop from business trip. I ordered the personal pan 10 inch pizza with sausage Canadian ham/baconAnd mushrooms. The crust of the pizza was probably one of the most unique features of food that I have ever tried. You could tell that a lot of thought and effort went behind perfecting the the sauce, don't get me started on the sauce. You could tell that it was authentic and homemade. The sausage was definitely something worth writing home about it looked like a quarter size the meatball but it tasted like a perfection  the textures of the meat to bread were excellent and blended very well with the homemade sauce of the Pizza. I think overall the most unique thing about the meal was the sauce and meats. I'm from Philly so take this with a grain of salt, the best cheesesteaks/Philadelphian food can be found at Hilton in Philly

If you are up by Wrigley, you need to stop in this pizza place! My favorite pizza in Chicago is Lou Malnati's but this is a very close second. We ordered a thin crust and a pan pizza and they were both awesome. The topping were free and the pizza had the perfect proportions of cheese, toppings and sauce. The service was excellent. We had a waitress that was training and she did a great job. As others have said, parking is difficult so we took an Uber.

This establishment made me feel like I was a local Chicagoan, especially after working up an appetite at Goose Island brewery right before!Their caramelized crust won me over & just had to put pepperoni, jalapeños & pineapple on it to seal the deal. I tried Lou Malnati's too & thought it was good, but I found that THIS is the Chicago pizza experience people talk about!

Best Chicago style pizza by a long shot (I will admit I am a fan of Giordano's as well, but this one takes the cake).  Great balance between topping,s cheese, and crust (which has caramelized cheese on it BTW!).  The only down side is it gets PACKED and is difficult to get into most times.....because it's so great.  I would definitely recommend ordering a pie to carry out if you don't want to deal with the hassle of waiting forever to get in.
Best pizza in Chicago, hands down. Only complaint is the long wait. But so worth it. I love the burnt cheesy crust. Apps are good too:)

Went to the restaurant on a busy Sunday night but it only took about 20 minutes for a friend and I to get a table. Ordered an order wings, cheese garlic bread, and pepperoni/sausage small pan. The wings were pretty good to me. The waitress accidentally brought us the half order instead of the whole order. The garlic bread came much later and it was only ok. It was mostly cheese and bread, I didn't taste much garlic. The pizza was great! I'm not usually a fan of pan because it's too much crust but I didn't feel that way at Pequod's. The pizza was loaded with toppings. The edges were crispy and cheesy. And the crust was not too overpowering. Sauce was good too.

Excellent Chicago style deep dish pizza, with their uniquely delicious sauce and 'burned' cheese crust! Make sure to ask for extra sauce either on your pizza, or even on the side. Vegetarian and meat options are both fantastic. There's a bit of a wait usually, even in the middle of the afternoon, so be prepared, or call ahead and get your table bumped to the top of the qu when you arrive! And you can put your order in while you wait, they just won't put the pizza in the oven until you're seated.

Love this pizza, one of my favorites in the city.  The wait is absolutely the worst thing about this place but they will usually take your pizza order while you're waiting for a table so it moves pretty quickly.  The lunch special used to be better but it's still pretty good.

Did someone say Chicago deep dish pizza? Obviously when visiting Chicago, you have to get pizza. SO my cousin and his friends took me here. We were able to get in right away. I heard it can get very busy. We started off with a salad because we were pretty hungry and knew it would a little bit for the pizza to cook. We got a deep dish pizza with olives, green peppers, pepperoni and I don't even remember what else. All I know is that it was amazing!Seriously one of the best slices of pizza I have had. So good. I wish I could go back now! Pizza is my jam and I wasn't disappointed.

First deep dish pie in Chitown. A line outside the door, but I was only one person, so got to quickly get a seat at the bar on a Saturday afternoon.Ordered the Cheesy Garlic Bread appetizer to start ($4ish) since the pizza takes forever to get in. Two large cylindrical slices of bread topped with gooey melted cheese and a strong taste of garlic. Probably not the best idea to order before trying to down an entire deep dish. Main course was a 10" with mushrooms ($13ish). Gobs of marinara sauce soaking thick bready goodness. Very filling pizza though I did not like the chewy burnt crust along the edges (marinara didn't help there). Could barely move after all said and done.Service here is friendly despite the hangry crowds. Great pizza though wouldn't wait forever for it.

I really want to give this place 5 stars because so many people say it is the best pizza in the city.  We tried this place twice and got thin crust as well as pan and it was just "meh".  I really don't see what the big deal is about this place but I live down the street and it is always packed with people outside.  Now, i am not saying this place is bad at all, I guess it just didn't hit my taste buds correctly.  But...... Living in the city as long as I have, I will tell you whenever anyone is asked about their favorite pizza in the city, they always say Pequod's.  So I will definitely give you props for that!!!!

I've only tried deep dish pizza twice (NorCal and LA) prior to Pequods. I normally prefer thin crust pizza, but Pequods definitely had me thinking twice! The restaurant looks small but tucked on the side is a staircase for additional seating upstairs. We came at an off time (around 3:30pm) and were seated immediately. By around 5pm, the place was completely packed with a wait to be seated. Appetizer Combo ($9.95): Deep fried zucchini, jalapeno poppers, mozzarella sticks, and mushrooms! 2 sauces accompany the plate of deep fried goodness: ranch and the most perfect cocktail sauce. I enjoyed all but the jalapeno poppers which had a tad too much cheese. Perfect appetizer to share.Medium Pan Pizza ($15.50): Toppings range from $1.45-$3.50 each for add on. We added sausage & pepperoni to our beautiful 6 slice deep dish pizza. I absolutely LOVE crust on a pizza and Pequods delivered. Crispy cheese crust on the edges and perfectly cooked crust on the bottom of the pizza. CRUST HEAVEN. I can't stop thinking about it.Pequods is out of the city for those who visit Chicago but it's worth the trip.

I wish I did not have to fly form California for the most delicious treat of my life. The pizza was recommended by a local. The two of us ate enough for 3 because we knew we could not come back and it was so good.

Been for the lunch special many times and convinced this is the best pizza deal and my favorite pizza experience in Chicago. I'm not a fan of "Chicago Deep Dish" but I love Pequods deep dish with caramelized crust!!!
The lines can be insane, it's more chill at their Morton Grove location.It's the caramelized crust, that's what it is.
Great pizza, solid vibe and a good beer selection! Takes a little while for the deep dish to come out, but they warn you right when you walk in. Solid place to come watch a game
Delicious pan-style pizza with a butter crispy crust. Lunch special is amazing for a pizza and a drink for cheap!

A Chicago staple for sure! Pizza is always delicious and hot, service is always great too! They also have a nice little bar with a good variety of beers on tap. Usually a long wait to dine in or carry out so don't wait till you're hangry.
Chicago's best pizza. Worth the wait, if you don't want to wait go early or carry out.
Nothing I can say that hasn't been said already. The crust is amazing. Great sausage, lots of cheese. Definitely an occasional treat.

If you're going to get deep dish in Chicago, you go to Pequod's. Sure, it's not in a tourist trap like Mag Mile or Navy Pier, but I think you should ask yourself at what lengths will to go to in order to obtain premium pizza. If your answer is a couple blocks. There's no hope for you. Just kidding, you'll be fine, but you're missing out. Grab an Uber, take the bus, idc just go to Pequod's.

My boyfriend and I were in town for spring break and came here for dinner on a Sunday night after seeing a movie. It was a little past 6pm and there was already a good crowd outdoors waiting to be seated. Thankfully as a party of two, we were seated immediately. I had read about Pequod's on a list of top spots for Chicago pizza, but eating here was completely unplanned, which made it all the better.We ordered a small pepperoni and sausage pizza with cheesy garlic bread as an appetizer. We didn't expect the garlic bread to literally be two slices of bread with cheese and garlic on top. We could have done without it, but since it takes an hour for the pizza to be made, it was nice to have something to chew on.My recommendation is to come hungry! A small pizza is more than enough for two in my opinion. The crust was super crispy and the sauce was sweeter than expected but still really great. They were very generous with the toppings. We ate half and took the other half to go and honestly we loved it even more the next morning after heating it up.

BEST PIZZA EVER.I genuinely don't know what else to say about this place other than the three words posted about. For the first time, I am speechless about what I ate. I got the deep dish pizza. It looks burnt at first but they actually line the baking sheet with cheese and so it's just cooked cheese. It's delightful and brilliant. Beware, it is also so so filling.
Best Deep Dish in Chicago!!! Bit of a wait which is what you want to see at a place like this.  The pizza was out of this world and reasonably priced

Best deep dish in Chicago, hands down.The wait is a little crazy (especially coupled with the fact that we didn't get to pre-order our pizza like we did at Lou Malnati's) and the space itself is a little too cozy for me (brushed elbows with more strangers than I cared to), but staff is friendly and the pizza is absolutely worth the wait.Everything about this pizza is life. From the crust to the sauce to the cheese to the toppings, everything balanced out perfectly. I found the sauce at Lou Malnati's to be a bit too acidic for my tastes, but that was not the case at Pequod's.Would 100% return for deep dish if I visit Chicago again.

One of the best deep dish pizzas in Chicago and it's worth the wait. It's usually about an hour or more wait but with good reason. Call ahead earlier in the day and get your name on the list. Once you check in you can wait it out over some great cocktails next door at the drinking bird. Cheers!

Great pizza! Had been hearing about it from other people so was curious to give it a try. I liked the option to add on so many different toppings - we were feeling particularly "adventurous" so we got anchovies on half of the pizza, and it was SO good. The deep dish here is definitely really yummy, although I must say that I'm not very good at telling similar foods part so I couldn't really tell you how it was different from Lou's. Maybe slightly less cheesier?? Idk. But regardless I would say it was definitely great!
Best pizza in Chicago.  When I have guests in from out of town, this is where we go for deep dish.  Eat here, you will be happy with your decision.
Love this place it's the "stuff" best deep dish ever!!!! Can't wait to get some again the la escarole is amazing as well. Call in an Day ahead of time!!!!!!

Getting deep dish in Chicago was a no brainer for me during my first trip to the city. With so many choices and opinions, it was hard to choose which one to try. After some recommendations and online reviews, we decided to try Pequod's. I was pretty much sold when I heard 'caramelized cheese crust' (a specialty of theirs). For appetizers, my friends and I got the cheesy garlic bread which is super cheesy (!!) with the right amount of garlic and butter, it was a great way to trigger our appetite while waiting for the pizza. I've been warned by locals that the pizza at Pequod's is delicious but not the best representation of a Chicago-style 'deep dish' pizza, and I can see why. The crust is best described as a thick crust and the pizza itself was not the "so deep you'll get lost in the ooey gooey layers of melted cheese and toppings" kind of deep dish. Because of this, my boyfriend was not too impressed. I, on the other hand, thought it was pretty good and would have no problem returning (but maybe after trying other deep dish spots). What made this pizza truly stand out and worth trying is the caramelized cheese crust. The cheese added a nice texture and salty/cheesy flavor to the dish. Overall, the pizza is a solid 4 and the crust, 5 -- I mean, who doesn't love burnt cheese?

So this was a pretty good deep dish. I found it very annoying that they don't call their pizzas what they are- calling it a pan pizza when it's clearly not. Anyway, the crust is probably the best I've ever had, but the filling left much to be desired, nothing special, at all. However, overall it was an enjoyable deep dish pizza.
Their pizza is famous in Chicago! Burnt caramel crust and delicious sauce. Their lunch specials are amazing too!

As a native New Yorker eating New York pizza in New York and obviously being a New Yorker I want to say this pizza was good but I most certainly cannot. This pizza was absolutely the worst,(a solid 4/5 because I'm a New Yorker) my ego cannot concur enough with my taste buds.  Original Deep dish was a solid 4/5, thin crust was clearly also a 4/5. Beer selection was great. Ambiance was very fun, family friendly and casual.  I enjoyed the garden salad as my appetizer.The Staff were friendly and accommodating.  I bothered them a lot for multiple beer runs, pizza slices and a plethora of odd request like their phone numbers and if they wanted to go out on any dates to no avail which left them to clearly give them 4 stars.In all honesty this place was awesome.  Food environment and everything was on point. Hope you guys enjoy your meal here.Still not better than NY pizza though.

Chicago deep dish pizza.  My first bit of advice is... to listen to your server.  We ordered 2 of the large special pizzas (for 7 people) and salad.  Way too much food, so we had the next mornings breakfast!  Very good deep dish pizza.  The atmosphere was fun, with TV's tuned into local sports.  We lucked out with a little round table for our party with room for a high chair for #7.  It was perfect.  The last bit of advice is....you can pre-order a deep dish pizza.  I wish I had know this information.

You know how Pizza hut was actually just deep fried pizza, but no one wanted to face that fact, so we just built them next to K Marts and stopped going? Well this crust is cheesey, and fried and delicious. The pizza is good. Solid pizza. But you go for the crust. Its a whole thing.

The deep dish here does not disappoint! Three of us went for an early dinner on a weekday to avoid the crowd. We arrived around 4/4:15pm and did not wait for a table, but tables seemed to run out by 4:45/5pm with a line forming at the door. The pizza is worth it though. We also ordered the appetizer sampler, which was good because we were starving and deep dish pizza can take some time to make. Overall a good meal!
So good. Love the carmelized crust. Can be a long wait on weekends and very long wait with delivery, but well worth it!

Pequod's certainly provides a unique style of pizza to Chicago, with a funky vibe. I hear nothing but great things but every time I've gone I get mediocre service and a pool of cheese that sits in a dough bowl. ‍

My personal favorite deep dish pizza in the city! The pizza is delicious, and I normally don't love deep dish pizza. I love the crispy pepperoni as well.The only negative thing I will say is that we ordered a Caesar salad as an appetizer and it was literally a bed of lettuce with about 4-5 croutons and that was it, and it wasn't even the right kind of lettuce for a Caesar. The dressing wasn't mixed in either, so it was not at ALL worth it to get the salad. However, take it for what it's worth--their specialty is deep dish pizza and not salads.If you've ever heard of Pequod's before then you probably know this, but expect to wait a LONG time for your table--but it's definitely worth the wait!
I got the personal pan sausage, it was excellent.  Had the famous crust, good beer. Recommend this place for sure.

This is hands down the best pizza in Chicago! The deep dish is the best in town! Crispy crust, moist pizza. So good you'll wonder why you hadn't  come here sooner cause I know I do! Pizza does take a little more time to cook but you won't regret it!
Pequod's is one of the best pizzas in the city and a most visit for all of my out of town guests.
Deep dish pizza at it's best. Been here many times and never disappointed. At busy times, there can be a wait, but it's always worth it.

My husband and I always stop here before or after a movie and it's delicious.The wait time is long but it's worth it.The staff has always been friendly, the food always good and we'll continue to go here.I'm more of a thin, cracker crust type of pizza lover but with that being said, this is the only place I'll eat a pan/deep dish pizza because the crust alone is pure perfection. It's a bit pricey but it's worth it.
The best deep dish in Chicago. The crust is the best part! I go hot peppers and pepperoni. It's worth the wait and a place you have to try.

Greatest Deep Dish Pizza in Chicago. Everyone else is tryin' to be Pequod's. The crust is incredible due to the pans they have been using for decades. There is no other crust like it with the caramelization and flavor. If there is a wait it's worth it, but there are also nights with no wait at all. Great in any season and any time of day!
There are numerous pizza styles and Pequod's has a cultish following for their crusts.  You should be one of them but all in all I like a little less bread.
The deep dish pizza was awesome! The location is a bit out of the downtown core but the pizza was well worth it! Huge portions and their butter crust was amazing
Classic yet unique. Pan pizza at the top of its game. You don't know Chicago Pizza if you haven't had Pequods.

Solid pizza experience. Pretty good Chicago deep dish pizza but not quite as good as Giordanos in my opinion. The sausage topping is great though. Medium easily serves 3 people (and that's if they have big appetites). Mozzarella sticks were extra cheesy, stringy, and crunch on the outside. There's an attempt to do a sports bar theme but it's not totally cohesive. The music choice is cliche radio hits but that's all negligible in my overall rating of the place.

This is probably the best deep dish pizza you can find in Chicago. It is absolutely delicious down to the last bite! The line/wait is usually incredibly long, which is the main turn off, but despite that the prices are great and the pizza is even better! If you are in Chicago for a weekend, a month, or a year, you have to come here at least once (if you can limit it to just one time). And if the line is long, just hold out because it is so worth it.

It's a joke that the rating for Pequod's is only 4 stars right now. Pequod's is the best pizza in Chicago. If you are in town for a few days and want to say you had Chicago's best pizza - this is the one. Go here, get the pan pizza, have a slice or three, and temporarily forget about how disappointing the bean was.

Great pizza!!It's a tough call... But their pan pizza might be better than Giordano's stuffed pizza.Attached is pan pizza with black olives and ground beef.Their thin pizza was ok, not the best... Pizano's or Pat's pizza might be better.
Great place for a pizza pie. A divey kind of place with dim lighting and ambiance for discerning pizza lovers. It's good for pizza night or date night.

Pequod's Pizzeria is the best place in all of Chicago to get incredible deep dish pizza. Even though we went when it was busy, we got our pizza in a very timely manner, and were overwhelmed by how good it was. We've tried different pizza all over Chicago, and all four of us who went agreed that Pequod's was the best, and that we'll be going back when we visit the city.
A delicious Chicago staple and must try place! Pequods never disappoints with its Chicago cheese pizza! The atmosphere really helps tie the whole experience together for a perfect night in Chicago!

I'm a huge NY style/thin crust pizza person. I feel like you get so much more of the flavor that way. But, obviously, coming to Chicago, I had to give the authentic deep dish a try. Many recommended Pequod's as one of the best deep dish pizzas. We planned it out right by going in the late afternoon. We were able to get seated right away, but it still takes 45 minutes once you are seated to get the pizza. Imagine if you had to wait in line for 2 hours and then 45 minutes after getting seated? That's the norm for a place like this. We went with the regular cheese and added some green peppers. Didn't want to compromise the authentic cheesy taste too much by adding too much. The pizza was delicious and one medium was perfect for 3 people. Boy is it cheesy and bready. But, not too much bread as I was expecting. I liked how the crust was crisp, giving it more flavor and helping it stay together well. I think the crust was pretty memorable - they flavor it very well, and it's the perfect amount of crisp.. The cheesiness was exceptional, as you could see it as you pulled apart each piece, which you want with pizza, am i rite? Glad we were recommended this spot when visiting. Hope to be back soon!
Not a fan of deep dish or pan pizza but the pan pizza here is pretty good! The atmosphere here is laid back and chill, great place to grab a beer and a bite.

We tried a few of the top-rated deep-dish pizza places on our first trip to Chicago. Pequod's was our absolute favorite by far. The crust was perfect and just the right amount of crispy. The toppings were on top of the sauce and cooked to perfection. It was the perfect taste of deep-dish that was expected. I am normally a thin-crust, NY style pizza lover and this deep dish was top notch for me. Would recommend this pizzeria to anyone visiting Chicago!

There are two floors! The first floor was super crowded when I walked in, but when we were seated on the second floor it wasn't as bad. We were seated quickly.  The waitress came quickly with waters and explained the menu to us. We ordered and the pizza came out in about 40 minutes! The toppings were great, but the crust on the other hand wasn't as impressive.  The crust seemed a bit overdone and was a tad too hard for me. Possibly was just a busy day and they rushed it or left it for too long. Would come back to try again!
Absolutely love pequods!!! It's a defendant authentic Chicago favorite!!! Less commercialized and among the best stuffed/deep dish pizzas!!

Simply AMAZING! We tried a couple of the most popular deep dish pizzas in Chicago, but Pequode's was simply the best. You're not there for the pricey sit down dinner experience, you're there for tons of flavor!
I have had the thin crust pizza here several times and it is always my favorite. It is a pretty busy place so be prepared to wait!
Omgosh, can you say scrumptious!! Seriously, this deep dish pizza is to die for. Great service, good ambiance, and deliciously tasting pizza. You absolutely must try it. I can't wait to be back!
Super good! Not my favorite Chicago pizza but top 5 for sure! Always busy too which is a great sign.
Best deep dish I've ever had.  Been to a lot of different places but this is the best.  Simply amazing.

Please don't eat here - simply put, I would like to keep this place all to myself, making it my very own deep dish Mecca. Pequod serves, beyond a shadow of a doubt, the best deep dish pizza you'll ever eat. Their vegetarian pizza sets the standard for all veggie pizzas.Go early. Go often. Just don't ruin it for me...

Pequod's pizza is LIFE!! I feel barbarically super basic admitting that I once thought Giordannos had the best deep dish pizza (this in comparison to Due, Connie's, and Lou's). In terms of pan pizza, Pequods sets the bar high. All other pan pizza in comparison is ok at best. If you've gone and didn't order a pan pizza, well done, and dislike Pequods, GO BACK!! You need to order that!!... You're welcome! :)
IMHO Pequods is the Best deep dish in Chicago, hands down! Always a great spot to take a visitor.
best deep dish in Chicago hands down. Make sure to be seated downstairs. Upstairs is cheap and lack luster.
