Ok so the way I explain this pizza is think of Beggars thick thin crust, but with seriously the best quality ingredients on the planet and cooked to a cheesy, crispy, crunchy state of perfection. The ingredients and the way they are cooked just make this pizza a new player. And it's fair to say it's the best thin crust, as it's totally different from deep dish. You have to try it.
My favorite location for Chicago style pizza. Whenever I have out of towners this spot is always on my list of recommendations. The long wait is definitely worth it.

I'm a Chicago native so you can bet I have tried just about all of the Chicago Deep Dish pizza's out there. This is definitely my favorite of them all!I have been coming here since the bar next door used to Flounders (currently called the Drinking Bird I believe?). When it was Flounders, the owners would let us bring the tasty goodness of their neighbor (if their kitchen was already closed) after drinking shenanigins with close friends. Which of course always tasted like heaven.Whether or not I have had an adult beverage or not, this my favorite of all deep dish pizza's. The caramelized crust is just mouth watering. The care they put into the ingredients and the customer service is apparent every time you come here!Funny story, the first time I brought my best friend and her husband to Pequods, he was like why's the crust burnt?! I said no, not burnt it's caramelized. Now when he was in Afghanistan he would tell her how much he missed his "burnt crust from Pequods!" I may not go into the restaurant very often, but I'm sure glad they deliver. You can't go wrong with what I refer to as "The Chicagoan Deep Dish" - because we all know that Giordano's (while tasty as well in its own right) is the tourist attraction.

I hate to leave a glowing review, because I'd like tourists to continue thinking Giordano's and Lou Malnati's are the deep dish gold standard. However, it's the best deep dish in the city, making it the best deep dish the United States. The wait can be long, yes, but with plenty of seating and a beer or two to pass the time, it's worth the wait.

Let the debate begin!  I had the deep dish with sausage because that's one of my favorites at Lou Malnati's which is at the top of my list.  I heard about Pequod's famous crust, and I have to say I did enjoy it.  There is definitely more crust to the pizza than other deep dish joints.  For example, Giordano's has got the thick layer of cheese making up most of their slice.  Malnati's has equal amount of cheese and sauce.  At Pequod's, it's crust.Don't get me wrong, there's sauce and cheese but not as much as the other places, so know that going into it.  Now the sauce was great.  Right up there with Malnati's.  At Giordano's the sauce has this kind of burnt/baked on feel to it which is still good.  The sauce here was very tomatoey like Malnati's and tasted fresh.  Now for the sausage.  It tasted great and I just wanted more.  Maybe it's because it was a personal sized pizza.Overall, really enjoyed it.  It was one I hadn't tried after living in Chicago for so long, and I'm glad I tried it.  However, it's behind Lou Malnati's and Giordano's for me.

Very good Chicago dish deep! The only issue I have is the pizza isn't the same if you order for pick up or take your leftovers home and eat it the next day.... It must be eaten straight out of the oven in the pan. If you do happen to have leftovers reheat in a cast iron pan, you'll enjoy it much more then in the microwave or oven.
Best Chicago style pizza in the city; the place you actually order from regularly as a Chicagoan.Pan - sausage and pepperoniAte there in person recently; ate upstairs and it was a fun change!

Best deep dish in Chicago! The crust in thinner. You tell yourself one slice but always eat 2 because it just melts in your mouth and isn't too heavy for a deep dish. Great for eating in or take out. Free parking on the side streets too!

Pequod's pizza is cheesy goodness. Thin crust or pan pizza, you really can't go wrong at Pequod's. Bonus: get the mozzarella sticks. For some reason, I think they're better here than anywhere else in the city.
Unquestionably the best pizza in Chicago.  Yeah, you may have to wait a bit, but it's soooooo worth it. So sad that I moved away to the southern burbs and can't get it as often.  They are magical!!!

Delicious everything and a kind staff that didn't mind this professor sitting and grading papers on a packed Saturday. Great service when your stomach us gnawing at your backbone. The staff did alot of kiddy flirting back and forth management may wish to address this so the staff is paying attention solely to clients as opposed to each other

WORTH THE WAIT!I'm pretty sure i visited Chicago about three or four times before finally getting a taste of a deep dish pizza. To my delight, my boyfriend's family knew exactly where to go!If you're going to go here on a weekend (which we did), be prepared to wait for and hour or two depending on the time you get there. Luckily, there are a lot of bars and other areas you can chill and have drink while you're waiting for them to buzz you (just make sure your buzzer is still within their radius)We waited about two hours until we were finally seated. They actually have a lot of space in their building. Our table was on the second floor which i preferred more. Plus! if you go to the bathroom, they have a lord of the rings wall decor- at least the women's bathroom did...i didn't check the men's haha ANYWAY, as for the food. we ordered drinks and the Pequod's salad, which was a great light start considering we were going to carb central with all the pizza. We ordered two medium sized deep dished pizza. There were five of us and each of us ate around two slices and still had leftovers! One pizza has mushrooms, garlic and sausage. The other pizza was a simple pepperoni and cheese, but we asked for anchovies on the side as well. The pizzas itself was amazing! The dough they use is lighter than i expected, almost like focaccia but not as soft. They carmelize the crust which gives a great crunch at the end. As for the toppings, the sausage was delicious but the garlic just made that one pizza. So DO put garlic! The pepperoni and cheese was an awesome classic as well, and the anchovies was a nice touch when you add it. Overall, I was very satisfied and glad I came here for my first ever experience of a Chicago deep dish pizza!

Cheese crusted deep dish. Bam. My first ever legit deep dish chicago style pizza in the city of chicago. I can't compare it to any other "best chicago style pizza" joints since I didn't have time to check those out but my foodie local friend took us here because, "once you have cheese crusted deep dish why would you ever go back?"to lighten it up, i got only veggies on mine and it was nothing short of blissful heavenly pizza. my husband had the meat heavy topping and he enjoyed both styles. con: the immensely long wait. we sat down and waited for an eternity (maybe 45 min?) to get our pizza. but, it was also during the nhl play offs so the place was packed (chicago vs la) so perhaps it was just due to overcapacity.great, now i'm dreaming of this place.

Definitely my favorite pan pizza place in Chicago! I would consider this more a pan pizza, but I can tell how it's a deep dish/pan mix. The crust looks burnt (but doesn't taste like it), and I think it's because of the deep dish pan they use. The crust is flakey and buttery, and holds up the slice just fine. I've always had the pizza cooked to perfection and taste amazing, they definitely don't cheap out on the toppings and load the pizza with what you want.They also have an amazing in-house lunch special. Just make sure you have an hour, because it probably takes minimum 20 minutes to get the pizza out (fresh cooked). I ended up getting pepperoni/jalapeno and it was simply amazing. I believe it's a 7" personal pizza, so kudos to you if you can finish it off. It comes with a free soda as well, so it's a pretty amazing deal all around.Check this place out if you love pizza and want to experience something different from the traditional thin crust/deep dish.
The best deep dish pizza in Chicago if you get it hot from the oven. Carryout is not as good because the steam from the box causes the crust to get soggy.

The pizza was good. Service was as well, the waitress was nice. I got the personal pan with pepperoni and it was the perfect amount! I asked for fresh basil after I placed the initial order. The server told me it would make it on the pizza, but it didn't. Other than that, everything went great! I arrived on a Monday at 10:00 pm, so there was no wait for a table. I don't know if I'd ever wait over 30 minutes for a seat like some of the other yelpers have indicated. The dining room/ambiance is nothing special, so I'd just get it to go at that point.

We got the deep dish pepperoni and sausage pizza and it was perfect! We had family in town and wanted to show them the best Chicago pizza and it definitely did not disappoint! Can't wait to come back again!

Amazing deep dish pizza! One can't go to Chicago and not try a deep dish pizza. The toppings are a bit pricey but well worth. The crust was crispy and not at all soggy. I recommend Pequod's to anyone interested in trying Chicago style deep dish pizza.
I think I just had a religious experience at this place and now worship all things with Giardiniera. A literal flavortown in my mouth rn.
Very delicious pizza with generous amount of cheese and perfectly seasoned. They crust is so crunchy and tasty. Absolutely one the bests in town. Only downside long time of service.

As a native South Sider we all have our pizza shop loyalties, but every so often you have to stray and find out if all he talk is just that or if you've found another place to add to the rotation.I'll start by telling you this place gets packed and there's almost no way around it, be prepared to get drinks at the bar and average an hour plus wait during peak times, also if you're not aware pan pizza will take anywhere from 45-130 depending on how busy it is, factor that into your plans.Now for the pizza, it was amazing, ordered sausage, pep, and peppers with extra sauce. Caramelized crust was spot on, cooked perfectly and dos not disappoint in any factor, crust, cheese or toppings. With a great tap list of craft and many TVs for the games it will be added to my list of highly rated Chicago pizza joints.

We got there right before dinner rush so we sat right down, pretty decent wait it appeared to be if you're not early!!! Food was great, we had a deep dish and thin crust pizza with salads.  Pizzas take about 40 minutes so don't come on starving, order a salad and wait!! It will be worth it! Servers are slammed but take good care of you.
Best pizza in Chicago .. Hello run here dont walk this is a must for every foodie ..
Favorite pizza! Even chose this as my meal after finishing the marathon. Go for the deep dish with sausage.
I bring my family and friends visiting Chicago to this famous hot spot for some genuine deep dish. Sitting at the bar is my favorite spot, but be aware of the amount of take out people order.

I love this place. This is my go to when out-of-town visitors want to truly experience Chicago deep dish pizza. The pizza here is way better than Lou Malnati's and Giodano's. Worth coming out here and waiting in line in order to get your fix of delicious pizza. I usually go with basil, mushroom, and sausage, and I would highly recommend that combination. You will need a medium to feed about 3 people (each get 2 slices) - and trust me, you will be plenty full. Note this is deep dish, I have not given their thin crust a try. I've converted so many people to Pequod's. It the true local Chicago deep dish pizza experience. My only complaint and the only thing that's holding Pequod's from getting a five star rating is the fact that the quality sadly is not consistent. There will be times when Pequod's completely knock the ball out of the park and give you an amazing pizza, but there are also other times when the crust is burnt or not fully cooked. They don't take real reservations - you can call ahead but what happens is that you get to jump to the top of list, which will still require some wait (unlike most other restaurants, where you will have a table ready as soon as you walk in). I have ordered for pick-up in the past (it took about 50 minutes), but the pizza experience is not the same. That same day, delivery was about 2 hours. So I would plan ahead if you would like to order a pizza and eat from your home. I would say to truly experience Pequods, you have to eat the pizza there. When it pops right out of the oven, it is amazing. The long wait is crazy. I have waited 2+ hours in the past. There is a Barnes and Nobles nearby and that's where I go to hang out while waiting. It's worth it and just do it!

Great experience, great pizza, great value! I had heard this was the place to go and it was. Nice, cozy, local neighborhood joint with friendly staff, totally took care of me and made me me feel welcome. The name is pronounced Pea-Quad and that's the name of the Chef from the book Moby Dick. They also have a bar next door called Whales Tales where patrons can go and enjoy a few drinks while waiting to get in, think you might even get a discount if they know you're waiting to get in for pizza. The lunch special was 4.95 for a seven inch pan pizza and a drink, for this quality that's insane! Really, perhaps the best pan pizza I've ever had and it was a thing of beauty to eat and look at. Such perfect sauce, caramelized cheese and pepperoni. I also had a very good appetizer of garlic sticks and marinara. My total bill was maybe 10.65 or so. I was worried about long lines, so I got there rift when they opened at 11am on a Wednesday morning and there were only two ahead of me. If anyone ever asks me where I think the best pizza in Chicago is, this is the place I'll send them!

BEST DEEP DISH PIZZA IN CHICAGO! Ok, that's all the yelling I'll do, but yes, just so you get this straight, you can't beat Pequods, it is the absolute best! If you want to have the warranty of getting seated, you have 2 options:1- get there before 6 on a week day2-  call ahead and he put in their list 24 hours before you want to dine  [they don't have reservations, but if you do this they cut your waiting time by half once you get there]If you like pepperoni pizza, go for it, they sprinkle that one with magical rainbow powder that really pairs very well with the cheese caramelization that happens on the cheese at the edge of all the crust.Service has always been great every time we went, and they have a good arrange of local brews.Please tourist, skip Giordanos, come here to get the real deal!

The pizza is totally worth the wait (even if you call in a "reservation" you are only given priority so may wait, especially if a bigger party).  That crust...people were not lying.  And actually their Pequod salad is pretty good and so is their vegable soup!

So many pizza choices in Chicago, and I'm sure there are a dozen good ones.  Pequods is unique for two reasons.  First off this location is more of a local hangout than a tourist spot, and there are $5.75 lunch deals to be had via Yelp for a pizza and a drink.  Secondly, their deep dish pizza is baked with some cheese on outside edge of crust so that it caramelizes into a semi-burnt dreamy nirvana of crisp cheese heaven.  A personal size is almost too much, especially when you add on a $2.50 salad.  Overall the best value for our dollar on our trip, and a casual, local hangout type atmosphere.  Would definitely recommend anybody visiting Chicago make the short Uber/Lyft trip up to north side to eat here.

Pequod's is, by far, my favorite deep dish pizza place in Chicago. Now...I know that this is a rather sensitive topic...given there are some hard-core Giordano's and Lou's supporters out here. But let me just say, I'm reviewing from the point of view of an "outsider" (Cali-girl) and that I actually prefer thin crust over deep dish. But I've come to really be able to appreciate a good deep dish pizza, and Pequod's is where it's at! I particularly love the carmelized crispy crust. My fav.If you're not sure, just try it for yourself and do the taste test. Either way, I'm pretty sure you'll enjoy it, if not completely agree with me that it's the best out of the main deep dish places here in Chi-town.

By far the best pizza in the city. They have accommodated big groups for me when needed. It can be a wait and even for pick up so be strategic when going or just know you are going to wait. They have an amazing lunch deal that I highly recommend. Whenever I have people come to Chicago that have never been we ALWAYS go here.
Good service, great pizza. Friendly staff, would definitely come back again. Parking can be a little complicated.
Love this place. Very Chicago. It is difficult to park yet it is worth it. Great pizza, great staff.

I had my FIRST Chicago deep dish pizza here after my Chicago-resident friend had recommended it. The staff was friendly and accommodating to our large party. We ordered several pies and tried them with different types of toppings. Everything was delicious and I finally gained some insight into people's love for deep dish pizza.
Would have gotten a 5 star if the cheese bread was better.  Great service. AMAZING CHEESY CRUST! Get extra sauce.  It has really fresh tasting tomatoes.

I'm surprised I haven't written a review for this place! One of the first places I checked out in Chicago for deep dish and I've now tried Gino's East and Lou Malnati's. I prefer this one because of the crust and the delicious toppings and sauce. I really enjoyed the caramelized crust with its yummy crunchiness. The sauce is also delicious and there is a good balance between dough and toppings/sauce. Some places have tooo much dough or too much sauce. I liked it here because it didn't feel like either was overwhelming. Pizza takes about 45 minutes to bake so be ready for that. We ordered appetizers which were just alright (chicken strips) but were delivered so speedily. Come here for the pizza!

I was only in Chicago for a day and wanted the best pizza in the whole city and I got what I wanted. They caramelize their crust and I read that they're the only people to do so. The pizza looks like it would be super heavy but surprisingly it was not. The sauce has really good flavor and the personal was definitely a good size to share if you want to continue eating at multiple places for the rest of the day. The cost of the pizza was really cheap too. The sausage was bigger than what I'm used to, they appear to be more like meatballs instead. Atmosphere was solid, they played good music but that's just my opinion.

Well worth the hour wait to get seated and 40 minutes for the deep dish pie to be baked. Loved loved loved. Told GM when he stopped by the table that he must open in Milwaukee. I'll be there daily. Mmmm.

Get involved, that's about all that I need to say about this place!  I had heard for weeks how great their pizza was.  I was told it was a deep dish sort of a dough, bread, sauce, garlic, seasoning, creation.  Umm, count me in!I went on a Friday night, carry out.  I came home, devoured basically the whole large pizza, felt imeediately ill because I ate too much, and wanted to eat more 7-minutes later.  I loved it!I think in person would be better, but overall I need more of Pequods in my life.
Hands down one of my favorite pizza spots in Chicago!! The caramelized crust is life!!! Staff is friendly as well although it can get packed on busier days!

It was my first visit to Chicago and my first time trying deep dish pizza. My bf had tried the big name deep dish pizza places so I suggested we try Pequods, a place he hadn't been before. Waiting for the pizza felt like forever because we were both so hungry we didn't have the energy to talk about anything except when the food would be out. Luckily we had came before the rush so it only took about 15-20 minutes which is standard btw. The pizza was amazing. They cook the crust with cheese so it's like a crispy cheese crust. Just imagine when you melt cheese in a frying pan and it turns that golden brown. Imagine a piece of that on the crust. Every bite is just the right amount of oozing cheese, pepperoni, sauce and crust. To make it better, the pizza wasn't as oily as some pizzas can be so you don't even feel guilty as you eat your second slice of deep dish and eye your third slice. :) My bf and I shared a small which was more than enough.

Amazing! Worth the wait for sure, not to mention you can go to the bar next door and have a drink while you are waiting.  This is the best Chicago has to offer no doubt. The Pep/sausage was to die for!  I can't wait to visit again.

It was time to try a new pizza place.  Previously a Lou Malnati's and Jet's Pizza only fan, but the last two carry-out experiences at both left me ready to explore other options.Pequod's product performed perfectly.  Totally worth the 1+ hour carry out time.  Totally worth waiting in the pickup line in the restaurant which was packed like the Red Line at rush hour.The pan pizza (their deep dish) was cooked perfectly, with the cheese just crisped just the way I like it around the edges.  The dough was appropriately cooked-through and crispy on the bottom, and offset by the heavenly layer of softness where it met the balanced sauce and toppings.  Ohh, the sauce.  Not too pasty, not too watery, with just the level saltiness and seasoning.  As with most pizza experiences, the sauce made the pizza.  Got my money's worth of toppings.  Cheese layer was thankfully just the right thickness.  The only thing I'd change would be to add the fresh basil later in the cooking process so that it didn't get so crispy too.Totally their own pizza recipe, but I might compare a little to the bumpiness, crispiness, and interest of NYC's Prince Street Pizza, and the dough recipe of Detroit's Pizza Papalis.Absolutely will be returning.

I had heard so many great things about this place and was super excited to try it. I had the deep dish pizza with mushroom and spinach and it was so delicious! We got the fries for an appetizer (the pizza takes about 45 minutes to make) and they were perfectly cooked and crunchy! The staff was super nice and friendly. Can't wait to go back!

Best deep dish pizza CRUST, by far. I'm a huge fan of the extra crispy crust with some burnt bits of cheese - I practically finish it before I've even worked on the pizza itself. So freaking delicious.Long, long lines, but definitely worth it. I've waited 2 hours on a Sunday night, and even in my hangry state, could not be unhappy with Pequods. You can call in to theoretically "shorten" your wait time, but when I called and later arrived, they just put my name down underneath everyone else... after confirming with me "Ah you called, we'll let you know." I'm doubtful of this system.NOTABLE:-Their lunch special is pretty ridiculous - I think it's like $5! - so hop on that if you can.-This one may be obvious but do not order the Pequod's Salad. One, who goes to a deep dish pizza place to order a salad? Two... It's lettuce with pizza toppings.

Ok...if I could eat here everyday I would.  Amazzzzing pizza. Best crust ever.  And if you don't believe my review just ask the thousand people that are there, every-time & anytime you try to go (that would be my only complaint). Seriously even at lunch, during the week this place is packed & it's huge.  But major bonus points to them for buying the bar next doors, so you can have a drink while you wait for a table.  I like their style of thinking.

Pequod's is in just the right location. It's near the Regal Cinema and other great businesses in the Chicago area. The pans they cook the pizza in caramelize the cheese and you'll find yourself abandoning your table manners and picking and pulling the ingredients off and nibbling ferociously. The items are cooked to order so it'll be at least 30 minutes for some hot and delicious memories. The staff are very nice and will try to seat you upstairs or downstairs based on your preference. Be forewarned, during peak times there can be a wait since many patrons will wait for a movie to start or watch sports as they dine. Parking is located in a nearby garage as street parking is a rarity.

Really great pizza and they give you huge portions. I especially like the crunch texture of the crust. The wait time is a little long for their signature pan pizza, approximately 45 minutes, but it's worth it! The staff is super friendly and accommodating. In fact, when we had some left over and wanted to go watch a movie across the street, they let us keep our pizza in their fridge till we were done with the movie. This is definitely a place I'd go to again if I'm in town. Fully recommended!

Heard of this place from coworkers, and I was interested in the carmelized cheese lining the crust. SO good - the pan pizzas take ~ 40min to come out, but the wait was clearly communicated and there are a lot of appetizers to choose from while you wait. The deep dish slices were surprisingly light and easy to eat. The sauce was really fresh, too. Wonderful experience!

This is hands down my favorite pizza restaurant in the city. I am so addicted to their handtoss, caramelized crust pizza. The wait to get a seating is something I'm not a fan of but that's the price I have to pay for getting the best pizza in the city.

Pequod's is the best of the best when it comes to Chicago style pizza! The toppings always taste super fresh. I only had to knock off a star because sometimes the hostesses and wait staff can seem really disinterested. But it's definitely nothing that would ever stop me from eating in or ordering delivery.

Have gone many times for dinner, but that lunch special is amazing! $4.95 for a personal size cheese pan pizza (toppings extra) and soda.  It's definitely the best pan pizza in the city (I don't consider it deep dish, like Lou's or Giordano's)

I came here after doing a little shopping in the area, and was pleasantly surprised. I have heard a lot of good things about this place, and the pizza exceeded all my expectations. Very highly recommended, I wish there was a Pequods near me!

Come during the weekday for their lunch special!!! Such a deal!!! 7" Pan Cheese Pizza and a fountain soda for $4.95 and each toppings for 80 cents more! It was so good!!! I'm not a big fan of pizza in general and I had deep dish before in California... but this was surprisingly good and you can't beat their lunch deal! Thanks for the great experience! They do not take reservations, but you can call ahead of time for them to put your name down and when you arrive, you will be moved up to the top of the waiting list! Seating is not guaranteed however!

Really, a forty minute wait to sit down for pizza?  Must be some really good pizza.And the eight of us waited outside, in the cold winter.  Argh.  Everyone insisted on waiting.  Fine.  We are all already there.Lemme tell you something.  This place is a grower, not a shower.  We walked through a lot, to get seated on the top floor, at the very back.  Took us bears and pandas maybe ten or fifteen minutes to get through it all.The waitress?  Got our complicated order just right.  She totally earned that $60 tip. How was the pizza, you ask?  Some of our group came from New York.  They were inspired to start a business based on the pizza they had here. Idk how feasible it would be to order from here and then deliver it to Manhattan or Brooklyn, and have it piping hot.I'm still in the group that says "Its just pizza, and no, if you think it's better than sex...you're not doing IT right."A suggestion for better business and flow:Give a menu to people waiting outside.  Especially during winter. You can even have them/us order and pay while outside.  We will do it.  Why?  Because we are already hungry.  And you'll have faster table turnover, so you can seat even more people in a night.And it gives us a reason not to leave before we even get to enter.

Went here because we wanted a late dinner after visiting the Art Institute one evening. My spouse has tried most of the other famous Chicago-style pizza places in the area. The pizza was delicious--good crust, though the cheese and sausage toppings were not well distributed. We enjoyed the meal, but spouse says it's not his favorite in the area. We called ahead and they said 30 min wait, but we were seated immediately.

Pizza is fantastic and always rated very highly in any post you'll see about the best Chicago pizza. ALWAYS call ahead/make a reservation - This will move you up on the list when you arrive, but you will still probably have about an hour wait.IT IS WORTH THE WAIT. You'll even have to wait for the pizza (deep dish), but trust me, it's worth it.
Unbelievable chicago pie! Asanty, I feel sorry for you. The fact that you would even consider Domino's as actual pizza. Your comments should be stricken from the records.
Great pizza!  Love the crust, sauce and everything in between!  Delicious!  Great vibe and fun place to hang out in a group or your significant other :-)

First off, any place that features a sperm whale with panties on his head maniacally riding a bike of some sort hawg is my kind of place. So after a $25 can ride,  I walk in the door and it's a neighborhood pizza place. Local all the way. Waitresses and hostess are polite, but not kissing your butt like you're some tourist. Beers are straight-forward. A few local selections, and the usual mass market stuff.So on to the pies: order thin or pan crust, toppings are extra, and there are lots of them.We got two pan pies: 1. Pepperoni, sausage, mushroom, fresh garlic awesomeness.2. Olives, and a bunch of other veggies for the vegetaters. After a few beers, while waiting for the pies:I watched chick ice skating on the Olympics. Gotta love that chick ice skating...The pizza: THICK crust. Burnt black at the top edges from the cast iron pan. HUGE toppings, like sausage the size of a half-dollar. Pepperoni? Yup it's on there, a lot of it. Every now and then, a sharp bit of garlic, and plenty of mushrooms goodness. Crisp bottom to the crust, but light interior. Quite a bit of dough. A lot of places do that thing where the toppings are in the middle and topped with sauce. Not here, it's definitely a pan pizza with the goodness on top.In short: This is one badass pie. I need a nap. A long one. I give it a solid 4.5 stars, and we'll see if they get that last half when I come back for the thinner crust pies.
So good.... I recommend this pizza to new comers to town;) call in your order the place is so popular it's grown past the holding capacity. Local fav!!! Get some pizza after the movie!

I'm not a Chicagoan.  I don't mind Deep Dish, I love cheese.  But to me, it's more of a casserole type of pizza.  I have tried about 5 different places deep dish here in the city and this one is far and above the best.  The pepperoni is so crispy and there's the yummy slightly crispy cheese parts around the edge.  And the crust isn't super sweet like all the other deep dish places!  That's a big one for me.  I would never wait the 2 hrs for my pizza again.  1 hr outside and then 1 hr at our table.  It was Saturday around 8 so our bad for the timing, but, it is way better to eat there than delivery.  Doesn't hold up well with delivery.  At least up to Lakeview area.  Anyhow, it's delicious.  Highly recommend for ppl that want deep dish but aren't huge deep dish fans.  In my opinion :)
Great pizza with a great environment too! It seems to always be busy but the wait is never as long as they say!

I've had Chicago Deep Dish Pizza before. My friend, a Chicago transplant for 10 years, stated this was a secret favorite of the neighborhood.  It is a bit crowded and loud, but that's a good thing, that means the food is good.We were told that it would be a 40-50 minute wait.  We ended up waiting less than 20 minutes.  The pizza takes a while, 40-50 minutes and it actually did take that long.  Bring conversation with you.We ended up getting the Large deep dish with: wait for it... Sausage + Spinach + Garlic!!!It was delicious. OVERALL IMPRESSION:I'd say the pizza is about par compared to other deep dishes I've had. But, it's surely better than the average pizza. I would go back.
Best deep dish in Chicago. Period. Good, relaxed atmosphere. Great beer selection. Probably only do once every 6 months as an incredibly calorific experience.

I've had so many deep dish pizzas in Chicago, and Pequod's does it the best. If you love a heavy focus on toppings, a crunchy crust, and less sauce, their pizza wins for sure! While getting a table for dinner on the weekend means waiting 2+ hours, we have found that carry out is the best option since the hole-in-the-wall, crowded atmosphere of the restaurant isn't for us. I prefer this deep dish pizza over the often-favored Giordanos because the crust is much tastier (and not soggy in the middle) and the pizza isn't just all sauce.
The best deep dish in Chicago!  Love the slices of cheese as the crust.  Hands down, best Chicago deep dish!
Literally the best Pepperoni Pizza money can buy. An institution! They never let me down at lunch or dinner or party size. Its always been good.

I'm not a fan of deep dish or red sauce but this place is fantastic. Crust is totally unique - crispy and flavorful outside but perfect soft dough inside. Delicious home made pizza sauce seasoned to perfection with excellent consistency. Peppers were full strips of vegtable and we had half Italian beef and half meatball- flavorful! Can't wait to come back - friendly/welcoming staff and clean establishment.

Pequod's is easily the best pan pizza in Chicago. The edge of the crust looks like burnt lace and tastes crispy, caramelized, and perfect, yet the crust itself is soft and pillowy.  They add a really nice amount of cheese and sauce and are not stingy with toppings.  The sauce has great flavor and a bit of spice!  The pizza is just so dang good - it's tasty, amazing, rich, and perfect.  There's also an awesome lunch special - you can get an individual pan pizza for 5! (Toppings are extra) If I am craving deep dish (though this is more pan than deep dish), this is absolutely where I want to go - if I can handle the two hour wait that usually accompanies dinner here.  I give four stars instead of five because the service is generally poor and slow.  I'm not complaining that the food takes too long to come - it's deep dish, of course it's gonna take an hour (and on busy nights, more than that).  It's that our servers aren't the most attentive and forget things that we ask for.  It happens every time I go.
I just cruised right in this piece with a friend of mine, and sat down.Our waitress was off the chain, and we definitely dug that.The pizza was so good that I wanted to like marinate in it all day.

My fiance and went here last night. We are foodies and try a new place every weekend. The places we try range from 5 star to total dives. The pizza is amazing. The pizza is totally cheesy and the crust is the best you can get. We also tried a Pequod salad. The toppings were plentiful and the house made Italian dressing is the best I've had. This place will not disappoint. Ive read some of the other reviews- you dont go to Pequod's for a 5 star atmosphere. You go for the food. If you want a 5 star atmosphere you choose a steak house, etc. This place is perfection and we are thrilled we chose Pequod's for our date night. We went to Distilled for drinks beforehand and also enjoyed ourselves
This place is always packed... but for a reason! Delicious pizza and they serve alcohol. Just give extra time to wait for a seat especially on a weekend. But once you are seated food comes quick :)

Want the city's best deep dish? Don't waste your time with the stuffed pizza "chains". This place is in a league of its own. Only downfall is that seating can be sparse on the weekends or during dinner rush hours. Great people run this place.
Tasty pizza. Unusual crust makes it worth a look.

On a recent visit to Chicago we were directed to Pequod's by a local rather than to more popular spots. We were not disappointed, the pizza was delicious and they have a great selection of beer as well.

very nice pan/deep dish pizza.  their sauce and caramelized crust makes it unique.  definitely a must try.  stay away from their thin... its a 2/10... nice beef... lot of other menu items just standard.

UPDATE: This place got featured on food network as one of AMERICA'S TOP FIVE PIZZA JOINTS! SO IF YOUR EVER IN THE AREA MAKE SURE TO TRY THIS PLACE OUT!!!So everyone knows that Chicago is known for their deep dish pizzas and there is a plethora of pizza joints running amok in Chitown. There's Lou Malnati's, Gino's East, Giordianios, and the list just goes on and on. Everybody has their opinion of what is the best and their favorite. The best pizza joints compete and some really might be better than each other by honestly the difference of what constitutes "better" is literally by a thin thread. That's why I was on the hunt for a deep dish pizza that was truly unique and I found it at Pequod's!Their service was horrible and the way hostess and managers run the business just lacked class and professionalism. You can tell they were flabergasted with the crowd of lines waiting to get this pizza. We decided to To GO our pizza and just eat it inside the hotel. No worries! The cheese was still gooey when we opened it.This pizza is truly unique and is baked in a black pan. The inside rim of the pan is sprinkled with mozzarella cheese and that is what makes their infamous caramelized crust. It might not be for everyone because my friend wasn't such a fan. She thought it just tasted burnt. (btw she doesnt really like food that much so her opinion is not valid). I, however, LOVED THE CRUST. It was chewy, salty, and flavorful. I liked the crust so much that when I was too full from my pizza, I took the crust off the other slices and just munched away on the crust.

I dislike most of the pizza in Chicago. I never seek it out and rarely enjoy it. The style is so, so hard to get right and most places aren't consistent at all. It makes pizza reviews rather ephemeral. Pequod's is my favorite of them all.

Burnt awesomeness! That burnt looking edge on your deep dish pizza slice? don't cut that off and throw it away. Pequod's secret to an intensely flavored crust is that the pizza masters apply a thin layer of cheese along the sides of the pan. While the resulting flavor is just decent, the texture is ahh-mazing! This caramelization gives a great contrast to the very thick and dense pie. By the time we arrived at Pequod's (after hitting THREE other pizza joints) I was quite full. So, I opted for the spinach version while the bf had the sausage/pepperoni pie. Being that the crust is pretty hefty, some might feel that you need more sauce or more cheese to balance it out, but it was perfect for me since I LOVE carbs. ;-)Located in the Lincoln Park neighborhood, it's a locals hangout but you'll spy the occasional tourists (us!) Definitely worth the train or car ride from tourist central Michigan ave. Go to Pequod's -- crispy cheese crust or bust.

I've grown up eating deep dish, but this was my first time at Pequod's and it was great! I expected a very long wait, but we went on a Sunday around 4:30/5 and were told the wait would be about 45 minutes. They have some seating outside while you wait, or you could go next door and get a free soft drink with your buzzer. I had just gotten my drink when the buzzer went off- our wait was only 20 minutes, which was a pleasant surprise. Being deep dish, there was also a wait after you order but the server said ordering just cheese may make the wait shorter. We got some salad and waited less than a half hour for pizza. The sauce was really good, and the crust wasn't as filling as other deep dish spots I've had. Overall, worth it to check out!

I grew up on pizza from the south side but I can't lie this place was very good. The thin pizza was alright but the pan pizza was delicious. I prefer my pizza well done and it came out just right. Wings were also a hit I really can't complain about this place besides the parking and wait to sit down.
Pequods....... Love love love your pizza!.The best in the city. Whats up with the service. Our pizza was cold, our bartender she didn't even care. Still love you!

4.5 stars, would need to visit more to see if it's 5 stars. Happy that they accept reservations. Really loud (we were seated upstairs). But the pizza, my goodness.sausage and pepperoni deep-dish ($19 for medium 12") - 4.5 stars. Caramelized cheese crust was f-ing incredible. It looks burnt, but without any of that bitter burnt taste. I approved of the toppings-to-bread ratio (I don't want foccaccio, yo!). Sausage, pepperoni, cheese, sauce, everything was on point. The crust and base had the crisp & softness of a pan pizza.I know in my heart of hearts that I will be back. That is a promise!
One of my favorite place for deep dish pizza. The crust is to die for. The line to dine in is usually long but worth the wait.

I love Pequods. But I have a few reasons for not giving 5 stars, even though I want to. I am a vegan so I was DELIGHTED to find that I could eat their deep dish pizza. The crust is one of my favorites and the sauce is so flavorful that it makes me salivate like crazy. That is all I can comment on since I usually just get a completely plain pizza, no cheese. I could add veggies I suppose. The price is okay, deep dish is usually more $$. I wish they offered vegan cheese! Also, be prepared to wait a good 40 minutes or more. It is worth it. OH and there are two levels, it is quite a cosy place.

Came here for dinner alone (lol) after a TON of people recommended it to me while being in Chicago. Arguably there is a bit of a competition between this + a couple of the other more popular pizza joints, but I decided to go with what I was hearing majority of people recommending.Ambiance is very "local." Nothing exquisite or decorated or curated or charming, but felt very Chicago. Don't really know how to describe that. It was packed - came around 8pm on a weekday, but luckily was seated pretty quickly since I was just 1. Most there were in families/bigger groups. I ordered the personal size deep dish cheese pizza. It was absolutely DELICIOUS. Caramelized butter crust (that is thick and chewy, but not overly so like some other deep dish pizza joints) and a solid amount of cheese (again... not too much cheese). Overall, loved my experience here and would definitely recommend. I easily scarfed down the personal size pizza for myself (but I also am a pretty big eater - probably would have been good to split this with 1 other person, or save 1 slice of pizza for the next day. But it was just too good!)Pretty affordable as well.Would highly recommend to someone wanting an authentic Chicago experience that doesn't feel too "done up." Great tasting pizza doesn't hurt either ;)
Delicious deep dish pizza. Always packed. The crust was crunchy and delicious and so was the rest of the pizza. Would recommend this place over other deep dish places.
First time at Pequod's last night, and I was very impressed. I don't usually toy with deep dish, but the crust was delicious, and the service was good.I will eat again.

I have eaten a lot of pizza in my days.  (My doctor would probably say way too much.)  But the thick crust pepperoni pizza at Pequod's is my absolute favorite.  Period.  The caramelized sauce and crust are done to perfection everytime.
One of the top five Chicago pizza joints. Love this place!

The best deal in Chicago: come during lunch during the weekdays for a personal deep dish pizza and a drink for $5. Pequod's is consistently ranked as one of the best deep dish places in Chicago and I have to say it is my absolute favorite.

I'm not from Chicago and I haven't tried the other popular pizza joints, but I am from San Francisco and we do have some pretty darn good deep dish. Actually, it's so good that my favorite deep dish by far is still Little Star in SF, but Pequad's is definitely the runner up on my list. It was definitely memorable, my favorite parts being the burnt edges, but it's not as addicting as I was expecting.JONASAPPROVED!

This stuff is flame! Don't sleep on this joint, you tourist will regret it! Mouth watering pizza and a really smooth atmosphere will make wish you were born in such a city. This place is where real headz come and chill and enjoy a slice or two. Don't come to Chicago and not come to this place! Located in the center of yuppie ville, no need to worry about the neighborhood, just watch out for their delivery guys!

Best deep dish pizza in Chicago! It's truly everything you assume it would be. Be aware of a long wait ahead- usually about 1.5 hours. Also the pizza usually takes 40-45 minutes to make as well. Great option is to sit at the bar and eat there for quicker pizza eating. :)

I daresay that Pequod's Pizzeria, which is located in the vicinity of Wrigley Field (Chicago's baseball stadium), rivals even Lou Malnati's Pizzeria itself for best Chicago-style deep dish pizza!  I absolutely LOVED my deep dish pan pizza from Pequod's - it was perfectly tender in the middle and crispy on the outside, just as I like my pizza.  The restaurant itself is big and we didn't need reservations at 7pm on a Wednesday night in mid-October.  We were initially seated at a high-top table but requested to be seated at a booth and they were quite accommodating, which I appreciated.  The service was good overall but the food was even better.  I highly recommend the 7" personal pan pizza - I got cheese only and it was perfect!
The pizza here is pretty good.  Not sure about all the hype, but I liked it a lot.   Takes a crazy long time, so plan accordingly.

The service was nice... pizza took about 20 mins... the wait is worth it though probably one of the best pizzas in Chicago if not the best I've ever had... I'll have to come back for the $4.95 lunch special personal pan pizza and a drink

It was super busy when we came in for our reservation on Sunday. We still had to wait a little which was no big deal. For an appetizer we had the cheese bread and a salad, both were decent. Our table ordered three personal deep dish pizza's which took over an hour before we were served and each one was missing a topping. In fact, the table of four that was seated after us got their pizza's first. I'm guessing our server put our order in late and even wrong. Despite all that, the pizza's were full of fresh toppings and the crust is amazing! The sauce just soaked into the bread, but it wasn't soggy. And it was even better the next day, you don't even need to heat it up. I would definitely come back for another pie. Hopefully I won't have to wait so long to get my pizza next time.

EAT HERE! The appetizers are hit or miss but lets face it you come here for the deep dish pizza with caramelized crust. I am more of the stuffed pizza fan but Pequod's is a front runner on the deep dish pizza side of Chicago pizza places! If someone offers to take me here I except without hesitation and have introduced several people to their pizza. Its worth it so go!!...be careful if seated upstairs, the stairway is a bit steep!
The best pizza in the city! Every time my family comes in from out of town, this is a must try. No one does deep dish like Pequod's

Best deep dish I've had during my visit in Chicago! I def prefer it over Giordano's. The crust is crispy on the rim and bottom which makes a big difference for me. You have the option of toppings and size. The personal pizza was more than enough to fill my appetite! The bartender was super friendly, the vibe and atmosphere was chill and enjoyable. Def felt the Chicago spirit here. Sit at the bar for the ultimate experience!

Be aware that like most deep dish places out takes a while for your pizza to be made, but luckily here the appetizers are pretty good. The cheese garlic bread was just okay, but the jalapeno peppers, mushrooms, and mozzarella sticks were on point. Pizza uses a lighter crust than other deep dish places which I think is a plus.
Loved this deep dish pizza. Takes a while. Comes out on cast iron skillet, but flavor of crust, sauce, and toppings are legit.
Bomb pizza, great beer.  Staff was awesome, so was the dessert.  What more do you need?

I was drawn to Pequod's because of its $4.95 lunch special. The lunch special is a personal one-topping deep dish pizza and a drink of your choice. What a deal. The pizza is enough for 2 people, and the drink comes with free refills. I ordered the deep dish with giardiniera peppers, and this was the perfect combination of mozzarella cheese baked into the pizza "crust" shell. The peppers and sauce are on top of the pizza, and there was a good ratio of peppers to sauce. The sauce is well-seasoned, and not overly sweet or spicy. Pequod's is located in a line of businesses on a busy street. There is street parking nearby. The establishment itself is dimly lit, which gives it a bar-like feel. There is a full service bar and flat screen TVs showing sports games above the bar. The space itself is small, but I would recommend it for a meeting with friends as many people were doing or just a solo lunch. The service is fast and friendly, and your pizza arrives in 20 minutes with no wait.

I fly out from Los Angeles and come straight here. Best pie I've ever found in Chicago. There's lots of infamous spots, but this is the one. Not just this location, but any one of the Pequods you'll have the best pie; period love is an understatement. Best of the best is close.

Usually not a fan of Chicago style pizza, but Pequod's pan pizza is oh so good.  As others have stated, its the crust that makes this stuff so crack-like good.  If, you know, you're into crack and all.  The crust is flakey and buttery on the bottom, but the prize is the burnt cheese crust on the edges.  Seriously, you need to monitor your fellow diners to make sure they're not stealing the burnt cheese crust edges of pieces that do not belong to them.  I know from experience.Ok, ok...its not all about the crust, 'bout the crust....   In addition, Pequod's is generous with the toppings and their sauce is good, too.  I've only had the pan pizza, and only delivery, so I can't comment on the other food items or dining in.  And the delivery can take up to 2 hrs on a Friday evening.  And yes, it was worth every darn minute of the wait.  Like crack, you gotta wait for your fix!

Personally, I don't love deep dish pizza, pizza in general is never my go to but Pequod's is a great compromise for me and my boyfriend who loves deep dish pizza!I've been here a few times and the pizza is great if you prefer more dough over cheese. They're usually pretty busy so i definitely recommend preparing to wait an hour or so on the weekends. Also really appreciated them delivering to me when I lived on Adams St (which was one block south of their delivery area). I called on a Saturday night and asked, they had extra drivers that night, we had pizza delivered to us an hour later!

Now just a disclaimer that I'm not a fan of deep dish pizza. I'm much more of a thin crust person, but even I like this pizza. I guess it's kind of more a pan pizza than true deep dish but I don't care, it's deep dish enough for me. They cook it to have this crispy halo of cheese around the crust which is amazing!! I've found that Giordanos has too much cheese and not enough tomato sauce, and I don't like the buttery crust of Lous so this is my perfect deep dish pie. Perfect ratios of all the pizza elements with a cheesy halo, what more could you ask for? It's a bit of a wait and it's just street parking but it's worth it.
Their pan pizza is good. I wouldn't get thin crust as it's not the same and here are better options, but their pan pizza is bueno.

I came here based on word of mouth, having heard about it for so long.  If I was just judging the pizza,  I would give it another star, as it was very good.  The service, not so much.We came in on a weekday afternoon and there were about 4 other tables being served.  We waited about 15 minutes before anyone came over, and then after ordering drinks, about another 15 minutes before they arrived.  This was draft beer, by the way, and the bartender was about... 7 feet away from our table.  This is a very small place, so it really starts to feel purposeful when you are being ignored for that long.We would have liked to order more beer but we never got the chance to.  We placed our food order and the waitress left, at which point I'm assuming she was abducted or went into a coma in the back of the restaurant.  After about 30 minutes of staring into empty beer glasses, our pizza came.  We asked the bus boy to send our waitress back and he nodded, but she never appeared.The pizza was really good, super crispy, melty, and I really like the personal pizza size.  The sauce was also very flavorful.  Two thumbs way up!When we were done eating though, we had to ask the hostess for the check, as the waitress had never come back, and at that point I would have even just wanted a glass of water to wash my meal down with... so I'm not sure if I'll go back.  I'll probably try delivery instead!

Pequods - this is what Chicago natives will tell you when they ask if you ever had a good Deep dish, I mean really deep dish pizza before.Having lived and worked in many different cities before I have had pizzas, normal and the exceptionally thin crusted ones as well. But not the deep dish pizza where you need to navigate through this deep dish pizza with a knife and a fork. Yes this is deep dish, not possible to do it with your bare hands, well yes you can but it will be a mess!The deep dish pizza is good but it makes you bloated after a second piece. Apart from Pequods there is also Giordano's in Central Chicago near to the Willis Tower. Nice but you have to wait for your order, about 20-25 minutes for the deep dish pizza to arrive.Try it! It's an experience.

Oh my goodness. This is my favorite deep dish pizza place of all time. You can't go wrong with any type of pizza here.  I always get extra sauce on my pizzas here which makes them ten times better. You HAVE to go here if you are in Chicago and love pizza.

For the people who give this place a bad review due to "burnt crust" are idiots. That is caramelized parmesan cheese baked into the dough as it cooks. Due a little homework if your visiting or ask about it at the time you get the pizza.  So if your looking for a great deep dish pizza then this place is top 3 in Chicago   Suggest getting the sausage. All the sausage is specially made with their recipe from a local meet place in Chicago. It will take some time to get the food so be patient. Staff is great and efficient. Keep in mind it's hard to just walk in during the dinner time or weekend evening and get a seat. It can take 2 hours if you don't have a reservation. The pizza is top notch. I cannot speak to the rest of the menu, but who goes here and orders anything else anyway.
It's one of the three top pizzas for sure. You're doing this for a chicago tradition. Not for the taste Giordanos is my go-to
The pan pizza had an excellent buttery crust that complemented the loads of toppings well!
If you get it delivered, make sure it is uncut and you reheat in the oven for a few minutes. Arrives soggy a lot or the time.

Let me preface this review by saying that I'm not a super big fan of pizza, no matter it's shape or form, but I can appreciate a good deal when I see it. My wife and I wanted to experience the Chicago Deep Dish pizza and found this place to be well loved by the Yelp community. First of all, if you are relying on public transportation, be willing to go on a mini hike across the LePaul campus to get to this little gem. We came here on a weekday, just barely making it to the lunch specials, which was a personal 7" cheese pizza for less than $5. That is freaking amazing! Of course, we splurged a little bit more, added numerous toppings, and got a small side salad for $2 and a local, honey infused root beer. Alright, I wasn't a big fan of the salad or the root beer, but it wasn't that bad either. You can see from the menu that Pequod makes each pizza individually, with a minimum wait of 30 minutes to accommodate for the toppings. I initially thought we'd be safe from that wait time since the restaurant was fairly empty (which is unusual, based on the reviews), but I guess the wait time is unique to a deep dish pizza. MY biggest disappointment, aside from the pizza being salty, was that it was served on a regular plate, instead of a deep dish. Ok, so 7" pizza may not have needed it, but it would have given an unique illusion of a deep dish pizza. We eagerly scarfed down the pizza and found it to be perfect sufficient for the two of us. Unfortunately, I got incredibly nauseous a few hours after lunch, so I had to dock a point for that. Food: 3 starsPrice: 4 starsAmbiance: 3 starsService: 3.5 stars.
The best deep dish in Chicago, hands down. Took my cousin from New York, he is now flipped!

I was in Chicago for a business trip and wanted to try some Chicago style pizza.  Our Uber driver told us Pequod's was the place and he was right.  I love good pizza and this may have actually been the best Pizza I have ever had.  If you are in Chicago and have the time (45 min wait for us) it is worth it!
Best deep dish in Chicago that I have eaten at!!
hands down chicago's best. the sausage is amazing, the crust is killa! love, love, love.

I'm not a native Chicagoan, but to me this is the best pizza in Chicago. I'm not a fan of deep dish so Pequod's pan pizza is my go-to. Whenever friends or family come to visit we love having an excuse to get Pequod's. The dough has a great bite and the edges get caramelized to crunchy cheesy perfection.  I'm pretty sure it's understood in our house that stealing the amazing cheesy bit of crust from someone's slice is unforgivable. We always get their sausage as a topping. I think they make it themselves and it has so much fennel. Yum! Also - the salad! They cut the cheese into little whales. Love it. The only advice I would give on this place is that the pizza is so much better if you go have it in the restaurant vs. delivery.

Really casual atmosphere, plenty of room inside, but expect a wait due to this places popularity.Service was great and the prices were reasonable. Came here as part of a bachelor party weekend, and 9 dudes definitely grubbed down. They're thick deep dished pizzas. 4 large pizzas were more than enough for us all, not to mention we also got wings.I'll be honest, I'm not a huge deep dish pizza fan, but won't hold that against the specialty of this place! Be sure to make reservations for a large party!

THAT CARMELIZED CRUST THO. If you love Chicago and love pizza do yourself a favor and get here. The toppings are delicious and plentiful, the beer menu is great, the service is good and the ambience, is, well, just ok. Not a deal breaker. It's definitely worth ordering a large and taking the rest home with you.

Wow! Pequods! Finally!! After a very long time of anticipating Pequod's pizza and taking our out of town guests, I would say Pequods should not be rated as a deep dish pizza because it is not a deep dish pizza. It's like compare apples to oranges.  The pizza is delicious and one of the best pan pizzas, had a little resemblance to Pizza Hut's pan date I say, but it does.  My favorite Chicago deep dish is still definitely Lou Manalti's and Giordianno's! Will I go to Pequods again?? Of course!!! It was a great pizza. If we were to just talk about pizza's, Pequods is in my top 3. Yum!

I'm going to say something blasphemous here and say this is the best Chicago pizza out there. I definitely take folks from out of town here more often than their more famous counterparts. Can't go wrong at Pequod's, especially before catching a movie or heading over to B&N to browse some books.

I don't like deep dish pizza.  Sorry.  I said it.  But THIS deep dish pizza... I love.So delicious!   Best deep dish I've had, and I've tried all the classics (Giordano's, Lou Malnati's, Gino's East, Pizzeria Uno).  I don't know what it is, but it didn't feel overly heavy to me.. The crust was delicious, and the filling was gooey yumminess.  The four of us split a large (way too big for us), and we split the pizza in half.  Half was Italian Beef + Giardiniera, and the other was Spinach, fresh garlic, and mushrooms.  Both sides were amazing.  Thinking about it makes me hungry, and I wish I could have some now. :(  Come to Dallas, Pequod's!!!

BEST PIZZA IVE EVER HAD!!!!!!!Hands down best pizza I have everrrrrrrr had!!!!!!!Pizza: The crust was amazing like non other, every bite had a crunch to it, and best part was even though it was deep dish I did not feel like I was eathing something that was really heavy.Atmosphere: Place is huge, two floors of pizza heaven, I suggest you call ahead if time and make reservations.Service: All of the staff was friendly EXCEPT for the girl taking our order, from the second I sat down she was giving my group an attitude, it was obvious she did not want to be there. After asking for her opinion on a few items and getting such a salty response all I wanted was to have her leave our table and stop ruining the happy vibe we had that night. Its a shame because there are a lot of people who would love to have a job these days....If the owners are reading my review put the server with the attitude in check....server number AZ010 on my receipt

Pan pizza like you dreamed of. Lots of toppings. Mine had peppers onions meatballs and sausage. Started with a Caesar salad. Followed it with the crispy crust deep dish. Be ready to wait an hour but worth the wait. Trust me when I tell you there's very little that believe is worth a long wait. I'm an instant gratification kind of guy. This was worth it. Parking is on street and a challenge. Find a way to get there.

If you are in the mood for deep dish, Pequod's is hands down the best in Chicago. That burnt crust is one of a kind. However, you will need to work to get your pie with waits frequently over an hour. Love the pizza...hate the wait.
Crust is absolutely amazing. The actual pizza has too much sauce, and too little cheese. Overall, really good!
Chicago city staple. Not the traditional deep dish but still amazing. Has been featured on many food channels.

This is the best of the best of the best... provided you order it fresh, at the restaurant. I dislike bar atmospheres, which this place definitely has, but I more than tolerate the dark, the noise, the raucousness for the sheer sublimity of this perfect expression of Chicago Pizza. The platonic ideal, to wax philosophical. It's also more than worth the long wait/the long prep time if you call ahead (recommended). It's a chain, but *barely,* with just one other location--the original, in the suburbs. Nothing like the tourist-friendly polish of Giordano's/Lou's, with a freezer in the front for tourists to ship "authentic Chicago"!!!! pizza souvenirs to their buddy Joe in Montana. Now, it's well-known that the mere fact of being geographically served within Chicago's city limits does not a true Chicago Pizza make. There are four or five valid choices, in order of my personal preference: Pequod's, Giordano's, Uno's, Lou Malnati's, Gino's. The final four in that list are pretty close in ranking, and reasonable people can quibble about the order. Pequod's is in the #1 slot by leaps and bounds. Be prepared for a thick, doughy, bready crust which caramelizes to crisp perfection. It's not "burnt" and won't give you cancer. Just exquisitely cooked cheese and tomato sauce. The deepest pan of all deep-dish joints. Fresh ingredients (I usually order with double mushroom, broccoli, and garlic). And the most FILLING pizza you've ever had. Two or three slices are all most people can handle.As I said at the start, this pizza is really best eaten fresh. Ordered as delivery or takeout and reheated at home still results in an excellent, exceptional pie... but a good chunk of the magic is lost and it becomes more in-line with the others.

Came here in the middle of December for what my Chicago friends said is very good deep dish. Actually their exact words were "this is where Chicagoans go" Was not expecting this at all. Pizza was very good but it is not deep dish....I know shocking right? It's a stuffed pie not deep dish, and yes there is a difference. Nevertheless it's still a really interesting take on a classic, one that I wasn't aware of til that fateful winter night. Go, be happy and enjoy "stuffing" your face.
Best deep dish pizza on the planet! Seriously. Takes a little while to cook, restaurant is usually packed, but it's worth it.

When I am craving pizza and happen to be in the city, I always head to Pequods! Located on the corner of Webster and Clybourn in LP, it is the perfect spot for Chicago style pizza. My favorite thing to order is the pan pizza with extra sauce and tomatoes. The sauce is on the sweeter side, which I love! The appetizers are pretty good as well. The chicken wings and fried mushrooms are my favorite though. Every time I've been there, the service is great. Friendly and fast!  I think Chicago wins with all the pizza choices, but Pequods is by far on top of the list!

I hosted my birthday here last night and requested a table for 10 a few days prior to the day at 7pm on a Saturday (a very busy time). I received a confirmation within 20 mins. I then wanted to increase the reservation by 2 and also received a quick confirmation.Upon arriving with many people waiting, we were seated right on time. It made my birthday experience great and is much appreciated. I highly recommend this place and also utilizing the prioritized seating request. Lastly, the pizza and service was great as always! Thank you!

I'm a big fan of Lou Malnati's for deep dish and it's my go to place but I kept hearing great things about Pequois and wanted to give it a try. The wait on a Saturday was pretty long (we were quotes 2 hours but it ended up being 1 hour). There's a Barnes and Nobles across the street so you can pass the time there. The restaurant/bar is pretty small although there is an upstairs I didn't see. We got down to business and ordered a small sausage along with a Pequod salad. The salad was standard and the whale cheese was a cute touch. The deep dish was generous and delicious. That infamous caramelized crust lived up to the hype, the crust is lighter than Lou's, and the sauce is bright and flavorful. I was bummed the sausage wasn't an entire layer like at Lou's but that might be personal preference. Overall, really good deep dish that I think will win over devotees and first timers alike. A fun atmosphere that is a great place to grab a few drinks and eat some pizza.

Love the pizza and wings!!!  Service is okay. Wait for delivery is usually 1:45 minutes so I end up picking it up which isn't ideal because It's usually a mad house in there. If they could improve the delivery service I'd give five stars for sure.

If I were to come down from a mountaintop and found a religion, I would never be more certain of anything in my life than I am of the unassailable quality of this pizza. The crust is Dante's Paradiso in cheese and bread, and the sauce and toppings are the east, the sun. Truly cannot recommend higher to any lover of deep dish. Pequod's Pizza is truly the still point of a turning world. It reminds Chicago of what it should be, and indeed all that it COULD be, on a daily basis. Service was pretty good

This deep dish pizza is amazing, from the toppings to the caramelized crust. I recently came to the Pequod's on Clybourn on a trip to Chicago and felt at home in the restaurant. It smells great, and there's a great atmosphere. If you like eating pizza and watching sports, this is the restaurant for you.
The best pizza in the city! The service was lackluster on our second visit but the pizza is fantastic

Me and my BF decided to get carry out from this place as a Saturday night treat. I called to order and was told it would be an hour and 15minute wait for a carry out pizza. I was a little shocked but said it was fine since neither of us were starving. We arrived to pick it up at exactly the 1 hour 15mins mark and were treated by hoards of people crowding the entrance and spilling out onto the street. Once inside, it made sense. It was a Saturday night and this place is a little on the smaller side, so lots of people were waiting to be seated. I over heard the hostess saying it was a 1.5-2hour wait for a table, wow.We ended up waiting in a slow-moving line to pick up our pizza. It was a little annoying how long it took to simply pick up a carry out pizza. And, we were lucky out order was actually ready when we got there. Some people had to wait even longer after paying for their order to be ready. Also, this place isn't super expensive, which I like. I'm pretty sure a medium pan pizza is only $16. The only outrageous thing is that each extra topping adds like $2.50, which adds up quickly. We paid $23 for a medium pepperoni and sausage pizza.Once we finally got the pizza, it was good! I really really love the crust on this pizza. It's the best pan pizza crust I've ever had--nice and dark, but not burnt, and super crispy. I also loved the quality of the ingredients: nice, huge chunks of tasty Italian sausage and literally the entire pizza was covered in pepperoni which was awesome. The sauce was also good. My only complaint is that I felt the pizza was super skimpy on cheese at some points I was like, does this pizza even have cheese on it!? But seriously, this pizza is damn good.Overall, I'd avoid this place on the weekend unless you're willing to wait 1-2+hours for your meal! But definitely check it out on a week night, this pizza isbomb!!

Got a large pan pizza, half pepperoni, half mushrooms and green peppers. It's appropriately filled up 4 people, and compared to the other major pizza spots around town it was actually a little bit cheaper(large pizza w/2 toppings $24.65). The first bites were actually pretty amazing; the cheese by then was still very gooey and, being a pan pizza, the crust was crisp but also incredibly fluffy. It's not like the buttercrust at Lou's where you have something of a more pot-pie consistency, this is straight up large pan pizza. Also, was a little skeptical about the caramelized cheese crust at first, but after trying it I'm a fan. Not as incredibly amazing as most people say it is(I mean, at that point you can't really even taste that it's cheese), but the texture is great and I think I'd prefer it to other deep dish pizzas in that regard(after all, you're still getting plenty of the thicky doughy goodness on the base of the pizza...no need to have more on the sides). The pepperoni were nothing special, and would opt for the sausage next time.One dangerous downside...after initially amazing first few slices, once it cools down a little bit you actually realize how much of it is actually dough compared to filling. Whereas with say giordano's you really have a ton of sauce and toppings and the pizza dough is maybe 1/3 the width of the entire pizza, here it's the opposite; the dough actually accounts for like 75% of the height. Once it cools down this becomes very apparent, as you notice the thin layer of cheese and toppings compared to the dough. That said it's all super fluffy so it doesn't feel as if there is that ratio upon eating it, but it does take its toll after a while.So final deep dish verdict? Actually a fan, and would say this hits the right price point too. Only major cons are that I didn't get the sausage(not their fault), and that there is a lot of (albeit very fluffy) dough which makes the ratio seem a bit off.

Pequods has been on my bucketlist for a while now and today I finally got to experience the deep dish and it did not disappoint! First off this restaurant has 2 floors, the bottom floor was really busy so we were asked if we would like to sit upstairs and so we did. There were TVs to keep us busy while we were waiting for the personal deep dish pizza. The lunch special of $4.95 a personal cheese pizza with a fountain drink is an absolute steal and I really enjoyed it. The crust is the best deep dish crust I have tasted to date, it is soft and it melts in your mouth. Everything about the deep dish is delicious from the cheese to the sauce to the crust. It is also very filling! I will definitely be coming back here.

What's the all the hype about Pequod's? It's not even deep dish - it's a pan pizza. Seriously, check the menu. It's a pan pizza than a traditional Chicago deep dish so there is a lot of dough - kind of like focaccia bread. There are two things going for their pizza - the burnt cheese/crust and the tomato sauce. Yes, burnt food can lead to cancer but it tastes so good. Why can't things like cheese and butter be good for you? The pizza is generously drenched in the tomato sauce but I didn't mind because it was thick, robust, and zesty. I would eat a bowl of pasta topped with the sauce since it was that good. If DePaul students weren't spoiled enough, the Lincoln Park location is open until 2am on the weekends vs. the 10pm hour at the Morton Grove location. Pequod's - not quite a true Chicago deep dish pizza but still good.

This place is legitimately one of my favorite places to get deep dish pizza. Their crust is light and buttery, but the burnt cheese crust that you save for last is the best part. Also, their service is great. Everyone is nice and friendly; they do their part to make you feel at home.

Best deep dish pizza I've had. The sauce and the crust were equally delicious. One of the toppings we ordered was with garlic and it was a lot of garlic! We ordered their buffalo and bbq wings and the bbq sauce was amazing!

Who doesn't love Pequod's pizza?  Was in before a movie at Webster and enjoyed the classic pan pizza with burnt crust. Yum!!  Just head's up the service is (still?) touch and go. Are they all just spacy or just always really busy? I don't know...they are nice enough and the pizza is delicious.

BEST PIZZA PLACE HANDS DOWN. I have lived in Chicago my whole life, and this is the best!! Awesome atmosphere and when you call ahead they will put you first on the waiting list.I'd recommend calling a few hours before you get there- don't just show up, the wait is usually over an hour!

Really is as good as it gets. No specialty pizza needed. Classic cheese, sausage or pepperoni is enough to make anyone believe that the pan pizza is the perfect style pizza there is. And Pequod's sizzles. The cheese is puffy and stringy. When you bite in, you keep biting for a hot second. There's a lot of pizza there.I'd eat it at least once a week if it was more conveniently located!!

Holy cow. I finally tried Pequods pizza after living in Chicago almost my whole life. What took me so long. My 21 year old daughter and i had the day together today and she wanted to try it. It was amazing. The burnt cheese crust was something amazing and absolutely delicious. Perfectly cooked. The restaurant is really cool inside. Ambiance is terrific. It looks small when you walk in but they have multiple seating areas. Parking is a challenge but well worth it. Service was a little slow as our server wasn't as attentive as you would like, but the food really made up for it. Prepare to wait to be seated at peak times. Go on off hours to get in and out faster. I can't wait to go back again...

My first experience with  Chicago deep dish turned out to be enjoyable. I shared a sausage onion pizza with a friend. The sauce was very good, the crust was deliciously crispy and the dough was what I expected - a bit soggy but I guess that's Chicago right? Still doesn't beat New York though!

Hands down best deep dish in Chicago! Worth the 2 hour delivery. The pepperoni pizza is a must order when ever I have friends in from out of town. The burnt cheese crust sets it in a class of its own.

Wow, more like eating a casserole with bread underneath but very tasty, fresh and light and rich, somehow simultaneously. I was good for a slice and a half and called it quits before things got out of hand. Amazed that the place was jammed at 1pm Sunday. They sure have it going on.

We got pizza to-go, and it was fantastic.  There really isn't a place to stand and wait, so make sure that you are not 20 minutes early like I was.Pizza was fantastic, and the staff was really on top if taking care of me the entire time I was there.  Offering me water while I wait, and checking on my pizza every couple of minutes.  I'm pretty sure that my pizza was in my hands less than a minute from leaving the oven.Overall it was a fantastic experience.

Hipster atmosphere. Crowded most times we go. Decent crafts beers. Great deep dish pizza with primo ingredients. Could argue that this is the best pizza joint in Chicago. Expect about a 45-60 minute wait once you order your pizza. I usually get a deep dish [pan pizza] w/ extra cheese, sausage and pepperoni. The ingredients are huge too. Not those little sausage balls at Pizza Hut. I don't order extra cheese at any other pizza spot but here i think it's necessary. Just don't think it's enough cheese on their pan pizzas. Pizzas come out great every time. The only downside is that once you wait an hour for your pizza by the time it gets there is still too hot to eat so you end up waiting longer to eat it.  Fml. But with great conversation and a few drinks you'll be eating in no time. Really enjoy this spot. Would recommend a few more beer selections but that's just being picky. Definitely  a must go to  spot in Chicago.Almost forgot to mention the cheese melted to edge of the cast iron cooking pan. Cheese gradually goes from cheesy to burnt. Sounds weird but it give the crust a nice carmelized taste. Loves it!!!

Ordered pizza for the first time as we like the thinner crust vs the traditional deep dish here in Chgo. Prepared perfectly and tasty. Delivery timing was also great. I highly recommend. Trying Pizanno's soon as a comparison .

Hands down,  the best pan pizza in Chicago.  The pans are so old and seasoned from repeat use, the flavor is out of this world.Order wait is like any pizza place, it takes a while, the place is a bit crmped but always busy because it rocks.

this is the deep dish place--excellent without being a soggy gooey mess. Also, since it is so filling, the price per head is very good. Second to none for deep dish and a pretty decent thin pizza too, a good bargain.

I've heard that real Chicagoan's don't like deep dish. Whatever. This place was backed and decked to the walls with Blackhawks stuff. The best part of the meal, but also kind of the gripe about it, was our pizza. We ordered a spinach and tomato pie, but they told us it was a mushroom pie? (It wasn't--just spinach only, no tomato). Not sure how this all got bungled up but at the end of it a $27 medium pie was more than enough for the three of us for dinner. The pies take a while, especially since it was busy, but it is well worth the wait--just get a pitcher and put in an app order. When the crispy edged, gooey pizza finally arrived, we demolished it.
