The large size is pretty generous, and being 8 girls, most people ate 1.5 slices each.The price is affordable too - we paid $25 a piece which included beer, appetizers, salad, and 2 large pizzas (split between 8 people). Would highly recommend over Lou Malnati's and Giordano's and I'm looking forward to coming back here again for more!

I like it, very distinctive. (Full-disclosure: I had takeout, not dine-in, so maybe fresher pizza would have given me a better experience). The burned crust wasn't quite for me, but the sauce was incredible. If you like this and live on the far north side, try Gulliver's on Howard (a very similar deep dish concept).

My favorite deep dish in Chicago - largely due to the crust.  There are other places closer, but when I have a craving for deep dish this beats all others.  The restaurant itself can be a little crowded, but the service is good and it's a good place to watch a game or eat before a movie.  One note is that delivery takes a while (I believe because the pies take longer than most places), but the food comes hot.

Freaking amazing pizza. Open late night for when we roll out of Joe's, it's the perfect beer and 'za spot. Dare I say it rivals my homegrown favorite Beggars Pizza?! Their pan/deep dish is ridiculous. Pequod's is an automatic stop when we make the neighborhood.

I went on a Saturday during a Cubs game so it wasn't packed at all and we were seated immediately. We ordered the garlic cheesy bread as an appetizer which has now become a requirement prior to the pizza. You have to order the pan pizza unless you'll be missing out. From the crispy crust to the caramelized halo of cheesy goodness!! Hands down the best pizza I've had in a while. I'm glad it's far away from my residence because if not, I'd seriously be in trouble.

I lived in Chicago for 30ish years and not a huge fan of the chain pizza places (Giordanos, Gino's East, etc.)  Well...they're a bit overrated and these types of places serve up the fabulous Chicago Pizza.I was turned onto this place years ago and I'd have to say I frequented the Morton Grove location a few times a month, maybe every other Friday or so.  I cannot say enough AWESOME things about the pan pizza here.  Once we tried the thin crust and it just wasn't the same...it wasn't horrible, but not the same.  Reason it's not the same, being the crust that you get with the pan pizza.  You just have to try it because it's pretty much indescribable.As for this particular location, I've been here less times than the Morton Grove location but if I'm in the city, or in the area I always like to hit up this place.  It's probably a good thing I'm not so close anymore as my waistline won't take so much of a hit :)My last visit to this place was right before the lunch hour on a nice sunny Saturday afternoon...most of the place was empty when we got there and we were seated upstairs.  When we left, the place was packed full with a crowd waiting outside.  Yes...this place is that good!!!  The service and food was great as usual and I will keep coming back to this place when I'm in the area.
The best deep dish pizza I have had. It is a local "hole-in-the-wall" place in Lincoln park Chicago but well worth it. If anyone wants to taste authentic deep dish pizza then this is the spot!

If you are looking for that old school "pizza hut" pan pizza experience, look no further! I kept it pretty simple and ordered the personal pepperoni pan pizza and it was pretty damn good! When it comes to pizza I am all about the crust and Pequod's crust was delicious!  It was crunchy and golden/slightly burnt which is exactly how I like it!  We also ordered fries, which were just fries, but the pizza will have me coming back.Only downside...the first time we tried to go, we made the mistake of hitting this spot up on a Friday night and the wait was 2 PLUS hours! No way, not happening, so we left.  On my second attempt we went mid-week at around 5:00 and that was much better, no wait.

As a life-long, hardcore Lou's devotee, it's hard for me to admit that this is Chicago's best pizza. Malnati's is great, but this is truly unique and truly amazing. Service was a little off the night I went in, and the wine list is pretty bad, hence the four stars, but the crust on the pizza, the crust, man! The delicious crust is to die for.
This is great deep dish.  Pasta meat balls were average.  But for Chicago pizza this place is on the short list.  Our medium had a burnt bottom and they gladly replaced it.  We will be back!

This pizza is absolutely to die for.  The only downfall is that there is only one Pequods.  The dining in experience is a must at least once although the wait can be very long.  I usually order for pick up anytime I am in the area (I live downtown).
Well worth the wait for dining in or delivery. Their crust is perfect, I'm not a big fan of deep dish so the fact that it is a bit thinner being a pan crust its just delish!

Hands down the best pizza place in the entire city - and in the entire world in my opinion. The deep dish pepperoni pizza is absolutely to die for. When I bring people to Chicago this is the pizza place I take them to. Be prepared to wait a while for the pizza to come out.

Meatball, garlic and basil...  The best!!!    Another pizza at the table had sausage and I tried a chunk on our way back to the metro... the big chucks were so good I was tempted to go back and get one to-go...  It takes45 mins to cook but as thick as it is, I understand..  The best pizza I have ever eaten... And I have eaten many!!!  Sauce is not overpowering like many places...  Lots on it, but very mild...

OMG that caramelized cheese! This pizza has all the makings of the familiar Chicago speciality deep dish, yet manages to be unique in a sea of ordinary. I recommend sausage and giardiniera. Expect to wait, but it is totally worth it.

Best Deep Dish in Chicago!  If you're from STL try their ranch as your new favorite dipping sauce!  Their delivery time of 1hr/45 minutes always seems standard & to be expected, however patience is a virtue & it's 100% worth the wait!  I love getting Sausage, Spinach & Garlic Deep Dish with the slightly burnt crust it comes with & it's delicious dipped in ranch ;)
It's worth the wait. I try to steer people here over the other well known deep dish places. Blackhawks games are usually on the TVs with the sound on.

I am somewhat surprised that I've never tried Pequod's before...being a Chicago girl who loves pizza.  However, since I was such a stubborn Gino's East fan, I hadn't ventured over to Pequod's.  However, I visited this past weekend for a party and had such a fun time.First of all, I never would have guessed that this spot was so large.  From the outside, it looks tiny!  Don't get me wrong, considering the place was totally packed, it does still seem a bit small, but there's quite a bit of space and I would imagine if you come at an off-time, there is probably plenty of room to sit.Anyway, we had a reservation for a large crowd and we were seated in the back of the upstairs.  While I wish we had had a larger table instead of a bunch of small round ones, it turned out to be pretty comfortable for us.  Service was attentive and great and we didn't really wait for anything.  Considering we had such a large group, I was impressed with their success at managing our drinks and food orders.We had some fried appetizers and salads.  Everything was delicious and nicely made and fresh.  And on to the pizza....I thought it was great.  Being a devotee of other Chicago pizzas, I wasn't prepared to like this one so much.  I was quite happy with the sausage deep dish.  While I love crust, and this didn't have quite as much as I would have liked, the flavor was really great - crispy and definitely held up well to the cheese/sausage/sauce quantities.  The sauce was great, not too sweet and nice and hot!  Sausage was delicious and there was a nice sauce to cheese ratio.Overall, a great spot.  I would definitely return for the good food and service.  Food - 5Service - 4Atmosphere - 3Bathrooms - 3Value - 5
Unique pizza. Not always predictable, particularly if doing delivery, but usually pretty delicious no matter.
Chicago deep dish is the same everywhere, load it with bunch of cheese and tomato sauce. But this place has great value when compared to Lous or Giardinos

Excellent Pizza. The crust is not what I associate with "authentic" Chicago deepdish pizza but it its very good. Surpise good places get busy and require a wait....... and deepdish pizza takes a while to cook! Be patient its worth the wait.
Top 2 pizza places in Chicago. They don't skimp on toppings unlike some of the other pizza places. Definitely worth the price and wait every time.

Came to Chi-town for vacation so naturally we needed to get some deep dish pizza! Pequod's Pizza was recommended to us by our Uber & it was INCREDIBLE. Noel had awesome recommendations & really took the experience to 11. James Dirt was also super accommodating & helpful. 10/10 overall! Next time I am in Chicago I will be back!!

This pizza is nothing short of amazing!My friend and I were shopping in the area and decided to stop in for an early dinner one night.  Luckily, because it was around 4PM we were seated right away.  My friend had been there before so she recommended the deep dish and the fried zucchini.  We ended up getting 1 personal deep dish pizza, 1 personal thin crust pizza and fried zucchini for an appetizer.  The service was quick-- even when the restaurant started to get very busy around 5PM.  The fried zucchini was very good and held us over until the deep dish pizza was done!  When the pizza did come out it was cooked to perfection.  It's important to note that the deep dish takes significantly longer to cook so make sure to time it right when you order.I'll definitely be back.  If you don't want to have to wait I would recommend making a reservation, or calling for take-out as the restaurant itself is not very big and there is always a line by the door.

Ridiculously amazing lunch special -personal pizza with a fountain drink for 4.95!  The cheesy and crunchy crust and generous toppings (of course at an extra charge) make the pizza one of the better pan pizzas I've ever had. The only turn offs I had related to the iced tea - it was pretty awful -super watery and just didn't taste good period. And the bathroom was very dated (small stalls, good luck to the ladies who are a little bigger boned or have bigger booties like myself) and dirty.  Otherwise, great place to eat...you may just want to hold your pee until you get home so you can avoid the bathroom!

Pequods's is hands down my favorite Chicago deep dish! We order take out on a semi-regular basis. The caramelized cheese crust really makes the flavor! If you're ordering peak times or weekend, expect a 90 minute wait for take out...it's worth it!

Was seated immediately and the staff was great and got us our beverages quick. We ordered 2 personal pan pizzas which was more than enough.Be prepared to wait around 40 minutes to get your pizza, you will understand why it took so long once you see it. I got pepperoni, hamburger and extra cheese and It was delicious. The cheese was caramelized golden brown on the sides and that's why the crust was my favorite part. The hamburger was literally a burger they cooked then cut up in big chunks and put on the pizza.Great environment and made us feel like we were where the locals were in Chicago. BEST PIZZA I HAVE EVER HAD.

Best deep dish pizza in the city of Chicago!  Buzzing and energetic atmosphere with a great staff and service.  Splitting a deep dish with another person is ideal so it's a great date spot (especially if it's a first date because its a fun, casual spot).  Also not a bad spot to go with a group of friends to watch the Cubs or Hawks.  If you haven't been here yet, you have to give it a try.

I'm a ny pizza snob and I still loved this place.   Great service, good beer and incredible deep dish pizza with fresh toppings.    Loved it.   For two people just get the small pie.  It's more than enough.

I went to Riot Fest 2016 and I wanted to have chicago pizza before I went home. After doing some research, I saved this place on my phone and on my last day in Chicago, I went here and it was the best pizza I've ever had in my life. I still dream about it! I can't wait to go back to Chicago and have pequods.

Amazing pizza! Lou Malnati's and Pequod's take my picks as the best pizza in town. My sister and I called in for reservations, and we were seated in two minutes when we arrived. We ordered a medium deep dish pizza with sausage, onions, and jalapeños. Everything was so flavorful: the toppings, the tomato sauce, etc. The caramelized crust won't be for all (more burnt than caramelized), but I still thoroughly enjoyed it. People always try to make the argument for best pizza, etc. I'll tell you straight up: neither Lou Malnati's nor Pequod's ever blew my mind, but it's still well worth the visit. Comparing Lou Malnati's and Pequod's is a different story. If you want a nice sit-down restaurant, go to Lou Malnati's in the Loop. If you want a bar to watch a sports game in a nice college-feel area, go to Pequod's. The pizza in both places is fantastic.
Deep-crust-pizza-is-not-real-pizza-but-god-damn-this-pizza-is-good!Aww man that was difficult to say :/New Yorkers gon' hate
I love this pizza. It is different from deep dish and thin crust. Very good and well deserved to be on best pizza of Chicago list.

Excellent Chicago style pizza. Better than the other I've had while visiting here. The way the crust is caramelized onto the iron skillet is so crunchy and delicious and they've got it down to a science. I was here with another couple and of course the men chose sausage, and the gals chose basil. I'm so glad we tried the sausage, as it was truly amazing. As they say "you can't beat our meat" and boy are they right.
The BEST pizza in Chicago. Don't go to the tourist traps. Go here. Get a thin crust pizza. Trust me.
Was told to come here from a friend while visiting Chicago! wow this pizza is amazing!!!!!!!! Def go here if you want REAL Chicago style deep dish pizza

Let me start off with stating that this place would have gotten 5 stars if it wasn't for the ridiculous prices to add on simple items like mushrooms. I always go here when I'm in Chicago. Yes it is hyped up, but I find that the quality of the toppings and cheese are much better than Lou's IMO.The crust is a bit softer, but that's how I like my pizza....I mean, pie. It's a PIE. I think that's important to note. But yes, I added 5 toppings? Maybe 6. Basically made ours a supreme and it was $50!!!! WHAT? But knowing myself, I'll be back again regardless. It really is something you just have to try. You may like it, you may not. But what I can guarantee is that you'll be impressed with the serving size. No one can beat that 1 inch + deep dish slice.

Mouthgasm. They aren't bragging when they speak highly of their crust--it's the damn truth. Crispy and seasoned in all the right places (even in the deepest depths of the bottom of the pizza), it was hands down the most favorite part of the entire pie.However, the sauce and meats did not disappoint either. They, too, were incredibly flavored in their own aspects, and both upheld the overall complex flavors of the pizza throughout its entirety.We came in on a Friday evening, Valentine's Day nonetheless, expecting a ridiculous wait. Surprise! The girls in the party were greeted with roses and we were escorted upstairs, down the hall, and into a nice private booth in the corner almost immediately. Service was a bit far and few in between, but our appetizers and pizza came out in a reasonable amount of time.The appetizer combo had an assortment of various fried & breaded items, adequate for our party of 5, but because we were starving, we had wished it came with a few more items than it did. It came with mozzarella sticks, jalapeño poppers, zucchini slices and mushrooms.We shared a large pie amongst the 5 of us, and slices themselves are decently large. I ate 1.5 slices myself. I could've eaten 2, but was feeling shy and lady-like. The only other complaint I heard within our table was that we wished there had been more cheese in the pizza. Regardless, a very minor complaint, and overall, Pequod's was a winner.
My number one spot for deep dish pizza in town. About 15 min drive from downtown Chicago but definitely worth the drive.

I've only eaten in once for lunch and the experience was sub par.The dozen or so time's I've ordered take out, the pizza has been worth the 20 minute drive.  It's my favorite Chicago pizza even if the staff is a bit young and under trained.

I'm not sure I can put into words... just how amazing this place is. The crazy part is, this wasn't going to be our stop for the day. We were trying a different pizza place... they said the wait was 3 hours, and we just couldn't wait that long. Pequod's got us seated in under 20 minutes and what followed was possibly the best pizza experience I've ever had. The pizza was fabulous. Pan pizza, caramelized cheese around the crust, and the flavor was out of this world. We will be returning to eat here again, wouldn't think twice about it. Also, the staff was very friendly.

Have to admit that this place knows what it is doing when it comes to pizza! I've had the big name deep dish pizzas around Chicago and none of them compare! Do yourself a favor and treat yourself to this amazing pizza!!!!

Very good pizza if you like caramelized crust (it is a bit different from the normal deep dish). Only reason for the 4 star is because I thought it was too much bread for me compared to more cheese you get and the other deep dish pizzerias

Probably my favorite Chicago pizza place!Not exactly deep dish, but it certainly different from any ordinary pizza place. What makes Pequod's pizza awesome is their crust, which is buttery, garlicky and perfectly crisped/caramelized... yum! The pizza ingredients are also always so fresh too!This place has two stories, first floor seems small, but once you go to the second floor, there's a lot of tables, the three times I've been, I never had to wait for more than 15 minutes.Located in Lincoln Park, so if you're visiting the city, just know that this isn't located in the loop so you'll most likely have to drive or take the El(subway). This place is a must for Chicago style pizza!

Deep dish and thin crust are both still the best in Chicago! And everyone knows Chicago has the best pizza in the U.S.  I've been coming here for more than a decade and the quality has been consistent throughout.  Always made with plenty of fresh toppings and a perfectly baked snappy crust.  I wish I lived closer so I could go more often.

Delicious Chicago pizza, tied for my favorite Deep Dish. The caramelized crust is heavenly. Sometimes there's a horrendous wait on weekends so come early. The buffalo wings are yummy too. And Pequod's delivers!

Let's start with the good stuff, and most important part of the review. The pizza - always delicious, so tasty, and the crust is unbeatable. For the occasional craving for deep dish, this is a definitely a favorite. Be warned you'll be salivating and impatiently waiting while your pizza is cooked to perfection.Minus one star for service - Placing your order for pizza doesn't necessarily ensure they actually place the order. We ended up waiting for about an hour for a pie, half an hour of which could have been avoided if they had started baking when we placed the order. Also, our server never asked if we wanted appetizers, drinks, etc, or came by our table during our wait. Very disorganized in that sense. I understand it's a busy place but not checking on a table for almost an hour is no bueno. That being said, the staff was friendly.

I'm always reluctant to leave five star reviews for my favorite restaurants because I'd still like to be able to get a table when I visit - but Pequod's is already a madhouse on most nights so I doubt one more glowing review is going to change much. I love eating here - the atmosphere is old-school pizzeria and the food is amazing. I was on the Gino's East bandwagon for the first few years I lived in the city, but I always direct people to Pequod's now when they are looking for what I consider Chicago's best deep dish. I wish I liked sports so I had more of a reason to stay in here longer than my meal warrants (and possibly order another meal eventually) but all the screens with hockey, football or whatever really doesn't distract from the meal. They can accommodate very large groups - but make sure to give them a heads up. Also we love the giardiniera as a pizza topping. Burnt cheese on the crust?! So good!!
Very delicious pizza, very reasonably priced, good service.Beer selection was so-so but overall it was a great Chicago deep dish pizza experience.

For my money, this is the best "Chicago style" pizza in the city. Caramelized crust, great sauce and toppings, gooey melty cheese. This place is nostalgic for me. While visiting Chicago before I lived here, I heard Pequad's was the best deep dish around. I was staying in Bridgeport and had no idea how to use Chicago public transportation, so it took forever to get to Lincoln Park, and it was raining. It was all worth it when we ordered a pizza and a pitcher of beer. That weekend I decided to move to Chicago and put down roots. Every time I've come back since it's been easier to get here but the pizza has been just as good. If I could change anything, I would expand the beer list.

Damn, do I love pizza!Pequods is so amazing! Get their pan, otherwise you're wasting your time. Everything is delish, I drool thinking about their pizza. There is usually a wait for delivery, but rest assured it's worth it! If you're dining in get some cheesy bread and wings (also great when delivered!). You don't come here for atmosphere, you come for 'za. But damn, is it good! Worth the wait!!
Awesome pizza!!! My family out of town goes everytime and loves it. The staff is great! Its always very packed and long wait but very worth it. You want great pizza a much visit.

What! The pizza is what makes a spot. And this spot is done correctly. I am one of those "deep dish pizza super snobs who really only eats traditional deep dish and from other competitors and now I am a believer that there is way more out there than I thought. Oh wow, are you really going to tell me that this is heaven? I was floored with the place, but the pizza took me to another level with its crispy edges of cheese. Oh was I going to HELL for enjoying this way too much. I started off of course with a salad, that actually had cheese in the shape of a whale, my friend told me that it is the whale from one of the books, I forget which one. I am hearing that it is hard to get a seat on Fridays and Saturdays, but we came on a Sunday afternoon and it was really not bad. I am one to admit, this pizza really took me there. To the moon and back! Check them and you tell me if I was wrong.

This is hands down the best pizza in Chicago!... Quite honestly the best pan pizza I've ever had. Let's start with, this pizza can blow your mind! It's not like any other crust. The crust is most def what makes it unique. It's a Caramelized crust, or basically pizza baked in an old seasoned black pan and burns the cheese on top. Whatever way you put it, it's delicious! Simple is def better, pepperoni is where it's at!If you want a good appetizer, try the Jalapeño poppers. They are pretty good! The reason for only 4 stars is a few things, all of which is to be expected with such a high traffic/ crazy busy restaurant but still worth noting! It is so inconsistent there! I am a frequent carry out customer (at least every other Sunday-hey like I said, it's my favorite!) Sometimes the pizza is hot hot hot, sometimes It's not! (not not!) Sometimes it's super cheesy, sometimes it's super saucey and other days, it's dry! You just don't really know. You may walk in on time and it's done or sometimes you end up waiting an additional 20 minutes. It's a guessing game for sure!Overall, just go! Order it simple, extra saucey and enjoy the deliciousness!
BEST DEEP DISH IN CHICAGO.Seriously, don't go anywhere else, only to Pequod's.

We checked out 4 deep dish pizza places during our visit to Chicago for the weekend... Peqoud's, Giordano's,  and Lou Malnati's...  i can honestly say that Peqoud's had the best crust out of all of them... it definitely separated from the rest. The pizza was really good... but the only reason ibdidnt five them 5 stars was because if the appetizers and the presentation of the appetizers. My wife and i got the Jalapeño poppers... wow, such a small serving and just thrown into a plate with the dipping sauce. Embarrassing.

Hard to top this place when it comes to deep dish.  Had it for game 7 of the 2016 World Series- so maybe its just referred joy...In all truth, Pequod's is worth the wait if you are in the mood for deep dish.
I've never been to this location but the original up north is one of the best pizzas I've ever had   (on a side street off of dempster)
Fantastic place great lunch specials. Christmas Ale is great!  Didn't know they had an upstairs sitting area!!! Food came quick love the pan pizza. Servers were nice too!!

It all depends on my mood, I guess, but between this place and AoP (get it?) I have trouble deciding which is the best in this neck of my woods.  I like alot of sauce so I'll always order extra since I don't think they put enough on it for my taste.
Caramelized crust is what sets this place apart from the others. It's the bomb!

After living in Chicago my whole life I have a good idea of what Deep dish pizza is supposed to be.......This is it! The caramelized crust was to die for. The pizza was very good was it the best no but definitely one of the best! The place had a cozy atmosphere with minimal deco but I liked it. Average service and wait time for a pizza joint. But if your in the city and you looking for that quintessential Chicago Pizza Place this is it.
Best deep dish in Chicago ask for extra cheese and sauce and you will not be disappointed!

I absolutely loved this place! I love deep dish pizza and compared to other restaurants like Lou Malnatis and Giordanos, Pequods definitely wins. The place was pretty packed, probably because of the bears game or the fact that it was Halloween, but we called ahead to make sure they had a table and were seated immediately! The service was quick! I was really impressed! Can't wait to go back again. Definitely recommend this place!

First off, I love pizza just as much as the next man and Pequods is no different. The crust is good, the sauce is good, the pizza is good. The portions are good, the apps are good, the beer is good. Most of all I like the place with the Chicago sports vibe all over and even on the workers uniform.Everytime I frequent Pequods I leave in a pizza coma and that's a good problem. They would really win my heart over and the fifth star if they had bacon. Canadian bacon? Wheretheydothat@?

This review is for a recent visit on 7/8/16 at 12:30am. The restaurant was quite busy for a late Thursday / early Friday but the service definitely met expectations. Our waitress was extremely friendly and assertive while taking our orders. She seemed exhausted since it was near closing, but her customer service wasn't interfered by her exhaustion. As always, the food came out to be delicious and just as expected. The appetizer sampler is a must have for anyone that wants to try a variety of items. To top it off, our deep dish pizza did a great job of satisfying our cravings. Will be returning soon!

I'm obsessed with their deep dish. The best I've tried so far!I traveled from the south side of Chicago just to try it out and I'm extremely impressed. Will most definitely be back sometime soon. Worth it

I went to Chicago to experience deep dish pizza and while it is good, it is not anywhere near as good as NYC pizza.  In terms of deep dish for Chicago, two locations stood out to me; this and Lou Malnati's.  This is hands down better than Lou's but both are good.  If you are staying in the loop, Malnati's would be a great alternative, but if you don't mind traveling, go to Pequod's.  Pequod's had a much better vibe to it and I didn't feel like I was at a chain restaurant.  The service was a little slower here, but it was worth the wait.

Tied for my favorite pizza place in Chicago. Fighting with Coalfire for #1. But they couldn't be more different, so I think it's okay to have two favorites.Why do I love Pequod's? 1-They do take reservations!2-One piece generally fills me up so I have leftovers for the next few days3-The crispy edge on the pizza! Sooooo good!4-Cheese! They totally get this right!I've only had dine-in pizza from here, so I can't review their deliveries.The staff is always super friendly and on top of refills. I love that this place is a good family restaurant. Almost seems suburban!

Admittedly biased since I love deep dish...The place was packed and we were ushered to a stairway in the back of the building. Much to my surprise there was a second level which was also packed.  I loved every type of pizza they offered here.

This place has been on my "Pizza Wish List" for years.  Finally had a chance to try one of their deep dish pizzas yesterday.The crust is similar to Lou Malnati's.  The sauce is much sweeter, you can really taste the basil in the sauce  The cheese is nice and smooth.Overall, a decent pie.Warning: "caramelized crust" = blackened/charred/burned on the edges.

Went on a busy Saturday night last weekend and the wait was ridiculous. We ended up squeezing in at the bar and ordered drinks and our pizzas. The drinks were delicious; definitely some of the best Patron margaritas I've ever had. After about 40 minutes our pizzas came out and they were huge, hot and fresh. We had deep dish sausage and pepperoni. They were very bread-y, but the sauce and cheese was plentiful and flavorful. After two slices I was stuffed and satisfied. It didn't take the top spot on my list for Chicago deep dish, but it's a pretty close second.

Like any other normal American visiting Chicago, I wanted some pizza. I wanted some good pizza. I wanted what the locals eat, and I wanted a lot of it. This is my experience at Pequod's... it's a bit of a read, but it should give an idea of what you can expect. Hey, I don't eff around with Yelp reviews like other goons who say, "Mm. Tasty. Go here." and call it a review... nuh-uh. Here's a tale, my friends...First of all, if it weren't for the big fat five star rating above this review, you'd probably think I absolutely hated Pequod's until the end of it. On a Saturday night at around 7:30 or so, I came with a party of four and made a reservation: "Your wait will be about forty-five minutes to an hour." After walking back outside and seeing about twenty people sitting around, I knew that was probably a lie, but whatever. I'll wait.Forty-five minutes go by and I decide it'd be best to order my pizza before getting our table -- done and done: a large pan pizza with sausage and pepperoni. Another twenty minutes later, I go back in after noticing a party of six that got there way after us got a table. I was about to freak my shit, but then I figured they had a reservation. Still, a little while longer, there was a group of four that got to Pequod's soon after we did that got seated. At that point, I went inside and asked how much longer, and they said "There are about four tables in front of you, so maybe about twenty minutes?" I was so hungry at this point that I wasn't even mad ... and I get mega cranky when I'm hungry. After walking outside and telling my group that the wait would be even *longer*, they started walking away. After they got about a block away (I was still in line. No way in hell was I going to just leave after already waiting over an hour), we got buzzed in. Fucking FINALLY. I assume that the reservation people dun goofed their shit and overlooked my party, and got us a table ASAP before we left.We got sat down in the far back corner in the right of the restaurant, which worked well with me. Pequod's is a pretty tiny place, so being away from all the elbows is probably for the best. To get some food in our stomachs, we got the mozerella sticks, which were said to be a "must buy" from some reviewers here. I will say, I would definitely agree with that had the cheese been more melted. The breading on them is great, and the marinara dipping sauce is perfect.After about ten to fifteen minutes of MORE waiting, our pre-ordered pizza came. What a work of art. Huge pieces of sausage basically gave the equivalent of one full link per slice, and there was a generous amount of pepperoni. Pequod's doesn't skimp like some other places -- there's nothing worse than paying over $2 for an additional topping and getting only a few pieces.This may be the best pizza I've ever had... as good as the toppings and sauce were, the crust truly makes Pequod's stand out. Chewy, crispy, burnt (well, they call it caramelized)... damn, I could eat this just about any day. It's rare that I, or anybody that I talk to, can excuse such an excessive wait time no matter how awesome the food is, but this is an exception.Altogether, I probably waited about 90 minutes until I got in and ate my pizza. If I hadn't ordered my pizza beforehand, it would probably have been two full hours. In the future, I'll *have* to call ahead and make a reservation, because as unbelievably delicious as this pizza is, I have a hard time waiting over an hour at a restaurant.Pequod's doesn't exactly have what many people associate as "deep dish", "Chicago-style" pizza, but it does have an unreal pan pizza that will satisfy your tastebuds... legendary.

Best freaking deep dish around. The crust itself is airy and awesome and Carmelized (what they are known for)! Not a bit soggy. Layered with the perfect amount of cheese with your choice in toppings and probably some of the best marinara on top. The breaded mushrooms with the homemade ranch was also amazing and the zucchini slices weren't bad either. But prepare yourself, the wait is long but you can call ahead and do a seat reserve to move your name ahead on the list. You'll still have to wait but they just bought fillipos two doors down and will give you 10% off at pequods. Get the personal pizzas with a group - more crust!

Hands down the best for thicker crust pizza.  Make no mistake, this IS NOT deep dish.  It's pan pizza with a perfectly caramelized cheese melted on the crust.  Great toppings and sauce as well.  My fave in the city.  Lines can get crazy so call ahead and order take out.
Best pizza in Chicago. I want to rub it all over my body but instead I just end up putting It into my mouth. The wait can be long sometimes but it's worth it

Very good stuff.  Sauce was a little sweeter than I prefer, but heavy cheese makes you forget about it.  I'm not a fan of Chicago style pie honestly, but this was very representative in my opinion.  A bit heavy on the crust.  I had been warned to be prepared to wait, but we waltzed in at 6 pm on a Wednesday and went straight to a table.
So damn good.  Best Chicago style pizza in town. Their traditional style is really good too.  The staff is friendly but not intrusive too.  A must have every time I'm in Chicago.

This place is pizza heaven. My college buddies who live in Chicago told me to eat there and they didn't steer me wrong. The crust was phenomenal. It's NOT your Chicago Deep Dish but that might make it more special. It's a tall darkened and caramelized crust that tastes great. I had sausage, pepperoni, and jalapeños and the meats were tender as could be. This is hands down one of the best and affordable pizza places I've visited, ever. You can't beat their small pizza special. I'll be back more times to come when I visit Chicago.

First time trying Hawaiian pizza and also this new place. I'm a stuff pizza kinda girl my goto place is Lou's but let me tell you this changed my world the crust is amazing just the way i like it brunt and crispy it's not as buttery as Lou's but it's amaze balls. I will def goo again and get a large deep dish instead of a personal size and re do the Hawaiian  pizza . And lets not talk about the sausage it was so good not your typically you find are you local pizza place. Can't wait to go back also the bartender JACK was great host also tried beer we never did before.

Whether you live in Chicago or are just visiting this is by far and away the best pizza in the city.  Make sure you get the carmelized crust.  You cannot go wrong.  Service is good, apps are just OK but you are there for the pizza.
Tessa served us a thick pan pizza. The.best  it was huge it was phenomenal it was the greatest!!! The pizza was fresh and delicious  Chitown favorite!!!!

SUPERB pan pizza.  I always order half mushroom/onion and half mushroom/onion sausage and it really is the best.  I also love the parmesan cheese baked into the crust.  This place does tend to get crowded if dining in, so make sure you get there early (or even carry out) to beat the rush.
I would wait 5 hours for this pizza it's that good. Give me all the caramelized onion goodness you have. #carbsforlife

Deep Dish Pepperoni, Sausage, mushrooms, bell pepper, garlic, and basilThe pizza was awesome. Good flavor and the toppings were very fresh. Other deep dishes I have had are always loaded with to much tomato sauce over the topping. The amount Pequod's had was perfect. The wait to get seated for 1 hour and then 45 mins for the pizza was a little more than we expected.

Visited from California, this place was recommended  by two different people! It was definitely worth the trek out of downtown for amazing deep dish! Sausage and pepperoni! The crust suprising.. but  might be some of the best pizza in my life. Takes a little while depending on how busy it is for the pizza, but a beer and a appetizer  will  make for one magic meal

Pequod's was literally the first stop on our weekend Chicago trip and the absolute perfect way to kick it off. We came at the suggestion of a knowledgeable foodie friend who encouraged us to try an alternative to the tourist-y Giordano's and other larger brands. We arrived ~12pm on a Sat, and there was ample seating available. From reading reviews, I feared that it would take a long time for our pizzas to cook, but it took maybe 30 minutes max for the main features to arrive. We passed some of the wait time with the Pequod's salad--I thought it turned out to be amusingly like a pizza salad because it has cheese and pepperoni on it. We ordered two medium deep dish pizzas, one with pepperoni and onion, and one with spinach and mushroom, the latter I had a heavy hand in designing since those are the best veggies paired with ooey gooey cheese. I think I need to expand my vocabulary because "yummy" doesn't quite do the flavors justice. Pequod's signature caramelized cheese is a winner, especially if you like burn in a good toasty way. One interesting aspect of their pizzas is that the crust is more crunchy, or crouton-like rather than bread-like. While we chatted animatedly while waiting for the pies, we became quieter upon encountering their deliciousness firsthand and focusing our energies on gobbling slice after slice. Soon our party of five (including three guys with large appetites) were satiated, plus we had a slice leftover. Best of all, it was quite an inexpensive meal at ~$12 per person, considering we got a salad in addition to pizza and that we were in a big city, where I automatically assume everything is pricier. By the time we left the two floors of the restaurant were pretty full, so I believe Pequod's serves excellent true Chicago deep dish pizza more appealing to locals. The only problem with the experience is that now I crave Pequod's when I'm back at home. But I might just make the four hour drive to get it.

This is Chicago best pizza...get the Pan Pizza, it's worth the wait.  Forget about Lou's, and Uno, and Giordano's... if you're coming to Chicago this is the place to check out.I've been coming here for years and it's always good. I've never been disappointed. Beer selection ranges from the basics to good enough number of premium options, although not many. The wine offerings are actually pretty decent given the ambience which emotes the expectation of Sutter Home or Beringer-only.While the decor could use some updating, I think keeping things the way they have been since the beginning gives the restaurant a certain classic charm. At first glance you think you're walking into a dive bar that's going to smell old and musty, but they keep things clean and fresh.Try a house or Pequod's salad as an appetizer too.Overall 5 stars for food, service ambience and overall experience with a True Chicago Pizzeria.

Anton Ego from Ratatouille: "If I don't love it, I don't swallow."That was me with Chicago deep dish. At least until my last visit to the windy city. For Ego it was Remy's ratatouille. For me it was Pequod's.When Pequod's was first recommended by local friends, I hmmed and hawwed. They said "no no, this ain't Uno's or Gino's East, this one packs a punch." They mentioned the hour-long line of locals. Then they mentioned the caramelized cheese crust ring. Caramelized cheese crust ring?Pequod's delivered that punch. Pequod's delivered that hour-long line. It delivered rich sauce and flavorful crust with enough crunch at the bottom. Equally doughy, this pan pizza's crust is dense and puffy and way richer than regular deep dish, no stale airy dryness. The sausage is great, spicy and hearty. Pepperoni and onion hold up well. The cheese is there but expect less than other Chi pies. And then came that caramelized cheese crust. Everyone used a different method but we all had the same goal: JAM! IT! IN! And when we did, it was the end of Ratatouille for me.. 1st grade book-it pins and the TMNT arcade game's in the corner!"Not every Chicago place can cook great pie. But great pie does come from Chicago.."
Some of the best deep dish EVER! One of our favorite spots for pizza over Lou's, over gino's, giordanos, you name it. The crust is best part.
Ordered take out with my friends. The wait is always very long but was worth it. They could just sell the crust and it would still be amazing.

My first deep dish experience... decent enough. The pizza wasn't bad in any way and I was satisfied, but was in no way blown away. Our server did her job only that- didn't attend to us right away and wasn't particularly friendly.

THIS is what I think of when I want Chicago deep dish pizza! On my first visit, my friends took us here for pizza. I left VERY satisfied with the choice and VERY full. Service was excellent with our party of (15ish?). When they took us in, I noticed how small the dining floor was while the hostess escorted us to our table. I thought, "Uh.. I don't see any tables available." Then she took us up stairs where there was a lot more seating. Ah. So there is room for a big party.Fast forward, I came back to visit again 9months later. This time we asked my girlfriend's local friends where they eat pizza. Three of us went on this visit. Three of us were not very pleased with the suggestion. I decided that we HAD to do Chicago deep dish pizza properly & came here the next night. Case in point. If you want deep dish pizza, go to Pequod's. Hands down. No questions asked. Just do it!

Pequod's was phenomenal from the start. We came here during lunch hour and despite the time of day we were able to be seated in 15 min. I'm a huge hockey fan, so I loved the primarily Blackhawks themed bar (among other sports) The waitress was satisfactory. Now as for the pizza.....lets start from the top. The prices here are reasonably priced if you share a pie with someone. You won't be breaking your wallet unlike some of the other deep dish restaurants in town. Unlike other deep dish pizza joints, Pequods toppings are actually on the top rather than deep under the sauce and/or cheese. This was great for my girlfriend who is a vegetarian since she was able to see what was on top of the pizza. In the past, we split pizza's and she would get a piece of pepperoni on her side which at times, unsettled her. However since we saw what was on top of the pizza, it made for a more pleasant experience. The sauce struck a perfect balance of being sweet with just enough tomatoey sourness, for a nice balance. Very hot. The cheese was decent mozzarella, nothing that stands out but FAR from bad. It was good. The toppings were also high quality and tasted as they should. Now for the crust....I think most people who visit Pequods know about their signature crust, and I must say its just aa delicious, crunchy, greasy, oily, salty, and tasty as it looks in pictures. SO GOOD. What the pictures show really are accurate for what you think it would taste like. This is a good winter pizza (though anytime is good) because it is doughy, but in a stomach warming hearty sort of way that fits cold weather. It's also a cold-weather pizza because it'd taste good with a pitcher of beer and Hawks game on tv. I can't wait to come back here next time I'm in Chicago. Five stars.
Bomb pizza! Kinda reminds of pizza huts pan pizza the way the crust is. Highly recommend!
Enjoy their take on pizza. I prefer the Morton grove location because of parking easiness but both sites provide quality tasting pizza.Great time and great food.
Amazing! Came from my friend's (who is a local) recommendation and truly the best deep dish I have ever had. Coming from California it was also quite affordable for what you get!
Pequod's Pizza is my favorite place for PAN pizza. It is so delicious and worth the wait every time. You won't regret a visit to Pequod's!
One of the best pizza joints in the city. May not be the healthiest, but hey , it's pizza. Want healthy ? Go someplace & get a salad.

This review is so long over due... I was visiting Chicago with some friends and we just had to try the signature deep dish pizza a few hours prior to our flight. Otherwise, how would the trip be considered complete!? The service was wonderful. I found the waitress to be very welcoming and helpful when it came to deciding what to order. When the pizza came, I was very impressed by the size of the pizza and amount of cheese and topping that sat on top. The pizza was fresh and hot out of the oven. I remember watching in awe with the bubbling cheese and hearing the satisfying sizzling coming from the pan. The waitress sliced the pie and the rest is history. I had left overs at the airport with the intention of bringing this back home to eat but all that was left was crumbs by the time my flight landed back in New York...

-IMPORTANT NOTE: avoid the temptation to order an appetizer to fill the 45 minute cook time.  It's worth the anticipatory wait!! -  Amazing pizza, long waits (for a table and at the table), and one of the top pies in Chicago.  Not sure if it's a "deep dish" in the traditional sense, certainly not "stuffed" (though you will be), maybe more of a "pan pizza" on steroids.  The edge of the crust is magically caramelized, which is awesome on the first piece, from there it loses its structure.  Massive amounts of toppings.  Seriously, you need to try this place.

Yes, the wait can be insanely long, between getting seated and then the pizza actually arriving. But basically any deep dish pizza takes awhile (45 mins at least) so that's to be expected. I guess if you're used to "regular" pizza cook time, this would be a bit of a shock. So...don't come here if you're in a hurry. They bought the bar next door and you can get 10% off your Pequod's order with your bar receipt, so there's a perfect place to wait to be seated. Take advantage! The pizza itself is delicious. I love the carmelized crust; definitely sets Pequod's apart from the other Chicago pizza places. It's a small place that has a friendly, neighborhood feel to it, even though it's insanely popular, and I enjoy that vibe. A visit here is a must for any deep dish fan!

Deep dish and deeply in love!I have no clue how I have not been here yet but I made my arrival!! The pizza my friend and I ordered was a veggie lovers delight! We asked for green peppers, onions, mushrooms and jalapeno peppers.  The sauce was perfect! Not too tangy or sweet and the toppings were toppling over perfectly!  The best part of the pizza was the crispy carmelized cheesy crust!I wish there could be a whole pizza made just of that crispy crust!It seems the place is crowded any day of the week since I was there on a random Tuesday night and word to the wise preorder your pizza before arrival to avoid the torturous wait for that mouthwatering slice of pie!I absolutely love love love this place and can't wait to go back for the lunch special!
Great pizza! Had it at 2:00am and thought it was way better than Giordano's! Pequod's is great!

This place is a bit of a trek from downtown Chicago but it is totally worth it! This was our first stop in Chicago and we were not disappointed by their deep dish pizza. We got the special which includes a pint of beer and a personal sized deep dish pizza for $4.95.Note: The personal sized pizza is enough for 2 people.Hands down the best bang for your buck.
As far as all the big-name deep-dish pizza places that go, Pequod's is the my favorite. Sauce - on point.Crust - perfect level of crispy.Everything else - thebomb.com

Visiting from Seattle- and told to go here by both locals and tourists. Pequod's is exactly what I was hoping it would be- delish classic deep dish pizza!WOWEE!!! Worth every calorific bite! Come hungry, but be prepared for wait. Tables usually have a waitlist and the pizza itself takes about 45min to cook up.But if you are patient the reward it high!Well worth finding our way from our Magnificent Mile hotel out to the burbs for this awesome pizza and some local Chitown beers.
Wow! Great pizza! Highly recommend if you are in the Chicago area, it's a bit far to get to from downtown but definately worth an uber ride for this deep dish style pizza.

Pequod's is great Chicago pizza.  Tasty pizza with seemingly fresh ingredients.  Lively, fun atmosphere.  Attentive, friendly service.  It is more of a pan pizza though than full-out deep dish.  Really the only drawback is the wait for a table. I wouldn't suggest sitting at the bar because that area gets so crazily packed, it's like a Wal-Mart on Black Friday. People are throwing 'bows and jostling for position like there's no tomorrow.  But if you come prepared to wait for a table, there's no worries.Bottom line, Pequod's is amazing. If you live in the area, this should be a regular haunt. If you're visiting, it's a nice alternative change-up to the bigger deep dish players.

Out of towner review*Came here with my friend who lives in the Lincoln park area. She said this is her favorite pizza place. I thought the crowd was due to it being the weekend of the Chicago marathon, but my friend said its always pretty crowded. We were a group of 6 but we were seated right away with reservations. The burnt crust was really good to me, but my sister was not a fan. My boyfriend also said the pizza was too heavy for him and he had major food coma afterwards.Overall, I would say its delicious :) I would come back if I am ever back in Chicago.

Great pizza, this is my go to place for out of town visitors that want to try Chicago deep dish. I like thats its outside of downtown area and visitors can see how chicago looks outside of the hustle and bustle downtown

Deep thoughts are better but is deep pizza dish really better? Alas may be ill equipped or unwilling to submit my answer to this, but Pequod's really helps promote the case for deep-dish. Walk in and it is what one expects a bar, booth tables and a bit dim so one could try to pass it as romantic. Deep dish pizza's come in Small Medium and Large. A Large cheese starts at 15.99 and toppings are a bit steep at $2.50 each. After a decent wait it came, caramelized cheese at the ends, sauce on top and laden with cheese and toppings. What impressed me was the use of spinach as a moisture barrier between the crust and the sauce and cheese. However the sauce was a bit bland, luckily the red pepper, oregano and cheese on the table helped remedy this issue. Garlic powder would have been nice. Overall for Chi town pizza this is my choice.

We were seated promptly in the open-window restaurant.We ordered drinks. The mixed drinks were so-so.Food: Deep Dish sausage, black olive, & giardinera.The red sauce is sweet but tasty.Toppings are fresh and the sausage is awesome.The crust is fluffy and crisp all at the same time.The caramelized crust on the edge is fantastic.We were served by three different people.Servers were friendly and responded to our needs in a timely fashion.I recommend the deep dish here. I am not really a deep dish kind of girl, but this deep dish is a must.Bike parking out front.

If you have not put Peaquod's pan pizza & their delectable warm, flaky, buttery crust into your mouth yet & you live in Chicago: you should be ashamed of yourself! Even if they don't deliver to your area, make the trip to the scary north side, and eat at Peaquod's. It will change your life forever! So, what's on your agenda?

OMG I AM OBSESSED! BEST DEEP DISH IN CHICAGO!!!!!!!!!It's seriously so amazing! Every time I go there it's super packed, but let me tell you it is definitely worth waiting for!! Everyone in Chicago must go here at least once!
THE CRUST.Tourists should avoid Giordano's and have the best deep dish pizza at Pequod's.

Tremendous pizza long wait but well worth it. U need to plan on spending along time waiting but the pizza is off the charts. Caramelized crust is something u must experience because words will never explain the true eating experience. Garlic is a must get with your other toppings. Can't wait to go back.
Not a deep dish fan, but this place has amazing burnt crust deep dish pizza. A little pricey and delivery waits could be long but worth the wait.

Simply the best pan-ish style pizza hands down. The pie is so full of flavor with the right combination of cheese and toppings along with the traditional cheese/baked outer crust. Remember - while thin crust is on the menu - do not order it - always go for their famous Pan

Pequods is not a competitor to Malnatti's, Gino's, uno's.  Pequods has their own thing going.  It's not exactly that different from the aforementioned kings of chicago deep dish, but it is.  It's unique, and qualitatively very good.In your deep dish quests, pequods is a must try, as for some it will be the best, others will never like any more than Malnatti's.Also, please don't even mention giordano's.
No pizza I ever ate can match up to the deep dish here. Don't bother trying any other deep dish in Chicago or the world.

Qtr slice, half a slice, whole slice ay!!! Yeahhh (Gucci mane voice). Seriously the best pizza in chicago. Deep dish is slap your momma good. I usually go with the classic. Great thing is if you call ahead they can put your name on the list and start your pizza. It's worth the wait and they have alcohol. Nice little movie and dinner spot. Pepperoni and sausage is Brackin!!! Eat up its delicious and yummy. Really great for Netflix and food coma.

Okay, I'm one of the biggest pizza fans I know. I don't discriminate against crusts, I love all types, despite the people that love to hate on the Chicago deep dish. So when my sister suggested Pequod's I was ready to go. I heard the wait was pretty long, but we went at 5 and we had no wait. Our party of 5 was put in a pretty tiny half-circle booth, that was my main complaint, we barely had any elbow room. However, this place is pretty good. The crust is the best part in my opinion, it's basically coated with this baked, crispy, caramelized cheese, which I adore. The sauce was really good as well, though I think slightly more bland than some of the Chicago-style competitors. Overall, I really enjoyed this place. The service was great, the pizza was great, though I'm torn over whether it gets best Chicago-style for me. You have to give it a try though, if not for the crust alone!

I've been eating great pizza for over 40 years, so I can safely say that I've had most styles and pizzas all around - Chicago, NYC, central IL, Boston, New England, Jersey, Brooklyn, California (), Italy.... And THIS is literally the BEST pan pizza I have ever had. Wow.
The Best in Chicago! Pizza made perfect . The garlic salad dressing amazing . Fried Zucchini perfect crunchy outside ! I recommend this to all my friends
The crust is the ish! So good Best deep dish in Chicago.

Probably a favorite for deep dish. Crust is the best--crusty, thick, and very flavorful. Good idea to get a salad while you wait...even if you call ahead (unless you specify pick-up and pay in advance but let them know you'll eat in the restaurant), it will be 40 minutes. But worth the wait.

Anyone giving this place less than 4 stars is probably either 1) not a fan of deep dish pizza or 2) irritated by the long wait. Absolutely nothing wrong with the pizza - some of the best deep dish I've had, and I'm a really old fart who's eaten a lot of pizza over the years! Our server was very nice and relatively attentive. The 15 minute wait turned out to be more than 45 minutes - it seems the standard reply at mid-afternoon was "15 minutes" and at least one group next to us said they had been waiting more than an hour after being told that. Once seated, we got everything we asked for, refills etc. But the food took a while. So it's definitely not somewhere you're going to go in for a quick bite. Well, maybe a quick bite once you have your food!If you have some time and like deep dish pizza and you're near Chicago, this is a must-visit place.

I'm generally not a deep-dish fan, but good lord this is one scrumptious pie!  Nice, casual sports bar vibe.  Lots of families and def kid friendly.  Great service, phenomenal pan pizza, and a great value. Have been once with a group of four for dinner, and once solo for the $4.95 lunch special.  The lunch special is a crazy good deal by any standards.  Huge 7" pan pizza with one topping, includes a beer or soda.  Can I have a beer with lunch?  Hmmm.

Pequods...I love you. Easily one of the best pizzas I've had anywhere, and I'm a huge pizza snob. If you are an out-of-towner, skip the Gino's East and Unos and come here for the caramelized cheese crust deep dish pizza. You won't regret it. The thin crust here is amazing too. They make a nice, braided crust and is very substantial for a "thin" crust. I'm salivating just writing this review!

Yes. Yes. Yes. Yes. Yes.You want legit Chicago deep dish? Come here.  Take it from me, a hot babe with 30 years of deep dish experience.  Bypass any and all appetizers/salads/pointless fillers. You don't need them.  Pequods did not gain fame from spaghetti or hot wings.  You should save room for their delicious, piping hot, physics defying pizza.  HOW they get the bottom so perfectly crispy and the inside so delectably tender is beyond calculation.  It's perfect.  Here's the real key though: limit yourself on toppings.  You don't need a 5-thing pizza.  Keep it to 3 added ingredients, tops.  Even better?  Keep it simpler.  Chicago pizza is not meant to have 10,000 toppings.  1-2 keeps it simple, keeps it perfect.  I'm very sad I didn't have one of the tasty looking cookies though.  Trying to watch my carbs.
I got a deep dish with sausage and pepperoni.I loved every bite I had. Garlic bread was meh for me but my husband loved it.The chocolate cake and cookies so freaking great can't wait to be back!!!

Within an hour of my poor review, the manager put a credit on my account, havent checked to see if it is actually there, but giving him credit for the fast response. I still love their pizza no matter what.

Best Chicago style pizza I ever had, but I'm not a local, so my experience is quite limited.  Staff was friendly and attentive and the pizza was outstanding!  I don't think they do reservations, but you can call ahead and try your luck.

Great deep dish pizza. On a Saturday night, 1 hour wait to get the pizza (the hostess informed the estimated time, so there was no surprise). Caramelized crust and flavorful toppings. Great service too and good beer selection
It was very good. I'm more of a "stuffed pie" guy than a "thick crust" guy, but better than Malnati's.
Always delicious even though it takes 50 years for a pizza. But how else are they going to get the crust so perfectly crispy?? Love Pedquod's.

I won't be calling it my favorite pizza... I prefer the stuffed "more cheese less dough" pizza, but that being said it was stupid good pizza. So glad we took up the guy from the apple store's recommendation to give it a try.  Be prepared to wait 50 minutes for your pizza, but when it comes out you will know why.  We loved the caramelized crust!

You will not taste anything else like the crust. Cripsy, buttery, and thick with carmerlized cheese... it may make you faint. If you go to Chicago, you have to come here. Even if you don't like thick crust pizza, this place will turn you into a believer. No brainer 5 star.Also- if you are staying downtown, it is really easy to take the redline down to this part of town and walk there.

By far the BEST pizza in Chicago!!!  Thick caramelized crust, choose your toppings.  It does not get any better.  This pizza place was recommended to us by a local so we went there.  It's north of most of the  downtown activities but so worth the extra time it takes to get there.  We went twice during out time there it was sooooo good!!!!

This place is always packed and there are always people waiting to be seated. It's up to you to decide if that's a good thing or bad thing. I love the pizza here both pan and thin crust. There is a reason they are so busy.

Many call this the best deep dish in Chicago. I have only had 2 or 3 different ones so I can't say for sure, but Pequod's is absolutely amazing. Beware, we came on a Monday after 1pm and had to wait over 2 hours to get seated and get pizza. We were very hungry so I cannot give this place 5 stars for time of service alone.

Amazing deep dish pizza! Always the freshest veggies (and LOTS of them). The carmelized crust is so unique! ...I actually look forward to eating the crust when we order from here! Pricey but worth it! LOVE

Wow, I've always heard people say good things about Chicago deep dish pizza, and finally I've experienced it for myself! So just what did I think? Well.... (**channeling Antoine Dodson**), what they say is definitely the truth--Chicago deep dish pizza does indeed rule!  So why did I choose to try Pequod's instead of one of the cliché Chicago pizza joints like Pizzeria Du, Pizzeria Uno, Lou Nalnati's, or Gioradano's on my first visit to the windy city? Well, my boyfriend lived in Chicago for a year and swore up and down that Pequod's was the best. So, being the good partner I am, I took his word for it.  And, he was right-- Pequod's did not fail me... it was awesome! Their deep dish pizza was everything I hoped Chicago pizza would taste like!  Thick, soft-on-the-inside and crunchy-on-the-outside pizza crust.... abundant creamy & bubbly mozzarella cheese... tangy, delicious pizza sauce... and fresh toppings!  Heavenly indeed!As for the atmosphere at Pequod's, it was nice, too! The restaurant is housed in an older building that's been cleverly updated to have a modern industrial look and feel. So, you know immediately that the place is casual, but it's still warm and inviting.
Food: 4Decor: 3Ambiance: 4Service: 3Value: 4An hour wait for a table. An hour wait for the pie. Why can't they combine those two waits? Otherwise, great food at a good price.
A friend of mine introduced me to the spot. Good pizza place! I absolutely loveeee deep dish pizza, but I prefer their thin crust over their deep dish.

This place turned out to be amazing,  I have never been here before but the deep dish pizza was without a doubt one of the best pizzas I tasted in Chicago so far,  the somehow burned crusted made it so special and tasty,  and the serves was very attentive... My new hangout place for pizza

I love this place. We have ordered from Pequod's many times, but this time we actually went to the pizzeria. Our reservation was lost (I think our main guy was late and they gave it away), but we eventually were sat upstairs. It took a while for our pitchers of beer to come to the table, but the place was packed so it was understandable. We know the drill with Pequod's that it takes a while to cook the deep dish pizzas, so we placed an order of apps along with the pizza. The combo appetizer plates were delicious and just what we needed to hold us over. Again the server took his sweet time checking on drinks and filling our waters, but we didn't come here for the service. We did, however, decide ordering out was the best way to go when it comes to Pequod's. Pizza was standard delicious and we were on our way! Tip: Get it delivered.
Newcastle on tap in a frozen mug and the best pizza in the area!

Best deep dish in Chicago I think. Everyone has a preference but the carmelized crust sets this one on top for me. I love a pepperoni, mushroom, basil version and limit myself to 1 every month or so.The crust is so delicious it literally melts in your mouth. Toppings always fresh and did I mention the crust yet?AWESOME!

If you're like me, you won't even read this review because it's more fun to read a 1 or 2 star novel length review from someone who broke up with a significant other whilst on a date at (insert establishment name here). Those type of reviews make me feel like I'm an alright and easy going person, you know?This pizza is delicious. Deep dish is not everyone's favorite, but if you like it, try this place. Best I've had in Chicago after 15 years. And if you can't take a complete stranger's recommendation, perhaps Yelp is not your thing.Do your visiting friends and family a favor and bring them to the local's pizza joint.

This place was an outstanding deep-dish pizza place that scored well all round.It's a neat old place that has character and thankfully plenty of room since it has upstairs and downstairs.  The deep dish pizza was outstanding, hot with a crispy crust, lots of flavour, cheese, sauce, etc., and the crust was rather caramelized on the edge.  Salads and appetizers were good.  Mozzarella sticks and fried zucchini were great, too.  Pasta (ordered for the one kid who does not like pizza) was good.  Beer selection had some great beers on it but unfortunately lacked darker/red/amber beers that I find to be best with pizza.  Service was great.

Amazing Chicago style pan pizza!! Perfect cheese, perfect sauce, cooked just right. I wanted to keep eating more but I was so full, couldn't even finish the small size. A little far out of the downtown area but worth it to avoid the chains

Loved the pizza here! The burnt cheese edges make the pizza. I'm not a huge fan of a "burnt" taste, but this is more like caramelized. Loved both the sausage pizza (looked homemade) and the cheese. It does take quite a while for them to make it (one hour for us) but we just called ahead and picked it up. So happy we followed the advice of our friend from Chicago!

Unique spin on deep dish. As others have said, it's true the crust is thicker than some other interpretations, but it is fresh, soft and very chewy. I can understand why some feel cheated that they're paying so much for what is essentially focaccia bread, but it has great texture. I think you get plenty of food for the money, so I don't get complaints about price; a large slice (essentially one serving) probably comes in at between three and four dollars and is definitely a meal's worth. Two slices and you'll be stuffed for the rest of the day. Three slices and you'd better be ready to commit to a food coma.On the plus side, they pile the cheese and sauce all the way to the edge and there's barely any sort of crust handle, so that thick bottom is offset by the fact that there isn't much crust at the outside edge of the slice.The trademark "caramelized" crust is really more of a char, giving it a nice smoky flavor like something that came off the grille, a pretty distinctive signature that sets them apart and adds a nice finishing touch to the slice.The sauce tends toward sweet as opposed to savory, however their toppings leave just a bit to be desired. I'm a sucker for Italian sausage, but their sausage seems pretty tame to me. Honestly reminded me more of Italian meatballs and despite the fact it has fennel in it, it doesn't seem to have that distinctive punch I'm used to in authentic Italian sausage. I think it needs a little more zip.You can't go wrong here and I would never turn down Pequod's, but the overall flavor profile just seems a bit simple in contrast to some others I've had. That isn't a dealbreaker, but if you're looking for a more complex mingling of flavors in your tomato pie, there are certainly other options around town. If they amped up the flavors in their sauce and toppings just slightly to give it a little more pizzazz, I'd probably give them a solid five stars.
We just threw a surprise party and this place pulled it off perfectly. Such a great experience and of course, the pizza is incredible.

Only 5 years in Chicago and I had not heard of this place. Upon arriving early for a movie (across the street), we decided to give it a try. Thought it was just a little pub that had pizza.It's much larger than it appears (multiple levels). While walking to our table, we notice that every single table had deep dish (normally not a fan), so, we chose to fall in line. WOWWWW. Holy cow. Do not miss this pizza. Insanely good.

Was staying at the dana hotel on a business trip, which happened to be within the delivery zone of this number-one-friend-recommended deep dish pizza place in Chicago. Fortunately, I remembered that deep dish takes MUCH longer than the quick-fires that I'm used to, so I ordered about an hour ahead, which was perfect because, with delivery, it took 1 hr 10 min. WORTH IT!! I ordered the personal size (7") with meatballs, mushrooms, and pineapple (toppings are charged per, btw), and man was it delicious!! Their cheese and toppings are so yummy, and that caramelized crust is omgtodiefor. I are the whole thing. It's probably enough for two people of my size (5'6" 125 lbs) to eat, but there was just no way I wasn't going to down every bite of that scrumptiousness. Seriously, I don't care how small you are, get at least a medium if you're sharing or tell whoever you're with to get their own! nom nom nom!!

We have been to many pizza places in Chicago. This is by far the best of the best. It's the crispy, cheesy crust that makes this pizza so unique. Every time we visit, we order a large to go, and freeze when we get home. Heats up very well.
Incredible pizza. All that needs to be said. Call ahead and they'll get your order started because deep dish/pan pizza takes a while.
Their pizza is unique and heavenly.  We had good service and nice facility.  They are always busy but with good reason
By far the best deep dish pizza in Chicago. This IS THE PLACE to go if a local, tourist please ignore this .

This pizza is the bomb. I'm not a fan of deep dish, but this pizza is an exception. It. Was. Fantastic. They're famous for their "caramelized cheese crust" and for good reason- it was amazing. They have an awesome lunch deal- for $5 you get a fountain drink and a personal sized cheese pizza (you can add extra toppings for an extra charge, but they recommend sticking with cheese only for the best flavor). I got half cheese and half sausage. The sausage was great but I actually enjoyed the cheese half the bestOf note: the pizza takes a solid 30-45 minutes to come out, so don't come here if you're in a hurry

Second favorite pizza in the city (Lou's is #1) but is very close to the best.  The downfall for me is that there aren't many peaquods and its a haul from the south loop.  Their crust is amazing and I'm a big fan of their sauce.  Prices are extremely reasonable.

For my money, this is the best deep dish pizza in Chicago.The sauce and caramelized crust set it apart from the stiff competition in town. Also, definitely get the sausage!As good as the pizza is, it is a bit bready compared to other options around town. I'm totally fine with that, but if that's not your thing, take note. Also, their salads and appetizers are not at the same level as Lou Malnati's and Giordanos. But I like the pizza better - it just barely beats Lou's in my book - which is why you come here anyways.Pro tip - THE LUNCH SPECIAL.

I really do not like deep dish Pizza of any kind. I don't want to hear about how Chicago it is to have deep dish. i don't know how that even started but i guess nowadays you have to be into deep dish to be ChicagoanPequods changed my life forever as far as deep dish goes. it is literally the only Deep dish ill eat and every time i have feasted there (over 5 a t least) i have cleared the plate.Not to mention the staff was awesome, crowd was loud and TVs had sports on. so all in all Pequods is the Bomb!!!!Cant wait to go back!

this is definitely a chicago staple.  I live not too far from here so I go a bit. It takes about an hour n some change for a pie when its busy (evenings and sunday nights) so plan ahead. Honestly get the much reccomended pan pie, their thin crust is lacking
SO GOOD, pricey though thats the only thing keeping me away.
Hands down best pizza in Chicago.  It's what I recommend to every out of towner.  Forget Lou Malnatis, forget Giordanos, forget Gino's East.  If there is one place to eat pizza here, it's Pequod's.

I'm in love. I always hated deep dish pizza but now I realize how wrong I was! The combination of their crust, sauce, and overflow of toppings makes this place delicious.The only thing that kinda stinks is the wait. This place is poppin and gets busy right at 11. I got a little anxious waiting for my heavenly personal pizza.

One of the top places to get Chicago-style pizza in Chicago.  For me the only hard question is whether Pequods is merely "one of the top," or is "the best."  The ring of carmelized cheese and the crunch crust are both trademarks and in my view they are both excellent touches.  My only complaint is that the bottom crust is sufficiently thick that there's a slightly higher ratio of bread to toppings on this pie than there is in some of Pequod's competitors.  For some people this last factor is not a complaint at all, and in any event Pequod's is in the very top tier.

We went on a Friday night and this place was SUPER packed. The doorbell from people leaving and entering was literally going off every minute or so -- that's how popular this place is! The wait wasn't too long though,  we waited for 30 minutes to get a seat. We got a medium deep dish with spinach on the whole pizza, pepperoni on one half and sausage on the other. We've tried our fair share of deep dish pizzas and this one was quite delicious. And the crust is amazing! Price-wise, it's interesting because all their default pizzas are only cheese and you have to pay ~$2 for each topping. So it's cheaper if you only get cheese, but if you end up getting toppings like us, it comes out to about the same as other deep dish pizza places.

So great going here every time I'm in this city. I always manage to take home 3 personal pies for the flight home. BEST deep dish around, don't be fooled by all the advertisement and billboards throughout the city.

When a friend of mine mentioned Pequod's as her favorite deep dish in Chicago, my curiosity was definitely piqued.I'm here all night, folks.Eating at Pequod's is a great experience.  The place is just an unassuming bar with a good amount of TVs to just hang out and wait for a delicious pizza to be brought to your table, served right in the pan, no less.Not gonna lie, I miss early 90's Pizza Hut so bad.The service is attentive; two of us at the table were having coffee for lunch (it was a long night) and they kept the pot filled for basically just the two of us.  So onto the pizza.  We got a sausage/mushroom/spinach pizza and a meatball/peppers pizza.  You got big hunky pieces of topping with a yummy sauce and a nice crisp crust to go with it.  Our two pies varied pretty greatly in crust thickness, but either way, both were great.  The biggest negative, however, is that they fall into the trap of soggy veges.  If you have too many veges in your pie, it's just leaving a ton of moisture on there leaving everything a slippery mess and even worse when reheating it.  There are definitely a couple different things they could do to avoid this, like chopping them into smaller pieces, ensuring that they're on the top to let moisture escape, using a salad spinner after chopping, etc.We had some leftovers and because of said sogginess a lot of that cheese just oozed off, which is unfortunate.  Also, the crust got pretty saturated too, so even with a pizza stone, the dough was still pretty soggy.So yeah, for now I would say avoid having too many veges on your pie and avoid taking it home.  It's just not a very good experience.However, despite all of that, I might like this better than the big three...
The carmelized crust is as good as they say... but the rest of the pizza is only good.  For my money, I prefer their thin crust.Beware LOOOOOOOOONNNNNGGGG lines to get in

For the last three weeks I have been in Chicago working, during that time I have been on an amateur food tour of the city. This place is the only review I have made, it's absolutely incredible. Best deep dish I have ever had, the Carmelized crust is out of this world. Sauce is homemade and wonderful. Can't wait to come back
Easily the best deep dish in Chicago. I don't recommend the sausage on their pizza, though.

It's the CRUST!!!! and all the stuff on top of it. I love this place. I always take out of town visitors here. Pick your toppings, and go for it. The downside is for some reason here I always go for that extra slice that puts me over the edge of fullness. So good!

Really great. My first Chicago pizza, and it did not disappoint. Service is a bit slow, but I hear that's typical of the Midwest, and totally understandable for a deep dish. I'd go back again and recommend it to anyone who visits.

I have just found my new favorite Chicago-style pizza place. The winner goes to Pequod's Pizzeria.This place has the most variety in terms of appetizer selections. I believe appetizers are important for deep dish pizza-serving restaurants largely due to the expectation that these pizzas take longer to make than thin crust ones. In addition, the Pequod's salad is pretty decent (the creamy garlic sauce is clutch). As for the pizza itself, I was astonished. The crust, including the bottom, was crispy and solid. This is difficult to come by. I've always experienced softer/soggier bottom crusts due the way that deep dish pizzas are made in general. In addition, I'm a huge fan of their sausage topping. I definitely think they use a better grade of sausage than other pizza places. The most impressive thing I noticed at Pequod's is the relatively short amount of time it takes to bake the pizzas. I daresay it was the fastest I've seen a Chicago-style deep dish pizza come out. Service is great, the pizza is superior, and prices are relatively cheaper than those at similar restaurants.
