I haven't taken advantage of this special yet, but if you dine in for lunch (Mon-Fri 11AM-3PM) at Pequod's, you can get a 7" pan pizza with a soda or beer for $4.95.

We often go to Pequod's with another couple prior to going to see a movie at the Webster 11 across the street.  This is one of our favorite pies in the city.The Good:The pizza.  Both the deep dish and the thin crust are exemplary.  The other item we really enjoy are the Jalapeno Poppers; they are filled with cheddar cheese instead of the typical cream cheese and it makes for a very delicious appetizer.  I would encourage anyone to try the sampler as well.  This place also has some great beer selections; I'm personally a big fan of the Half Acre Lead Feather.The Bad:Occasionally they will overcook the pizza, usually the pan.  A couple times I've had mine come out with a burnt bottom, which doesn't ruin the meal but is rather disappointing.Also, if you order a Pan Pizza it will take over an hour... not necessarily a bad thing but definitely something to keep in mind.The Ugly:Make sure you call ahead for seating, the host stand is a hot nightmare.  Everything is done old school with pen and paper and everything is very disorganized.  My wife and I once had to eat at the bar because we had been told we had an hour and a half wait after having waited for an hour and a half already (I think the host got his sheets of paper out of order and was seating people who had just showed up while we continued to wait).  I understand it's not easy to deal with a restaurant when it is as small as Pequod's and gets as busy as Pequod's does, but the people at the host stand are often overwhelmed and nowhere near up to the task.That said, this place is a Chicago staple for a reason, and a definite must-eat for anyone trying to sample the city's best pizza.

I have had many, many deep dish pizzas in my time and then I moved to Chicago from the suburbs and heard about the secret known as Pequods. I had to try it for myself. The virdict... one of the best pies in the City. The toppings are fresh and largely cut, the crust is a blackened delicious Joy. This is a must visit restaurant hands down. You must try this out.

Best deep dish in Chicago. Hands town. Got introduced to this pizza by my college gf and fell in love and haven't looked back. I like to call it cake pizza though - I can eat for about five days afterward if I order a large. Sooooo worth it though.Also - would argue that the actual place is far better then ordering out though. Great beer, good vibes, great service.

5 star pizza- 3 star service. Really good pizza. Went on pizza tour and fell in love with the pizza. Went back our next trip to Chicago and the pizza was great again but the service wasn't the best. Didn't mind waiting an hour for pizza but the waitress seemed like they could care less if they we were there or not. Constantly had to wait for soft drink refills. Will come back for the pizza but wishing for a five star experience next time.

A friend asked me for a recommendation for Chicago pizza last week. I would have sent him to Burts Place, but he was just driving through the city. Pequods is the first joint that came to mind. Being back in SoCal, I really miss the Chicago deep dish pizza.

Holy Deep Dish, this place is amazing! I'm from out of town, and I've had the usual suspects for "famous" Chicago style pizza. They were good, but nothing like Pequod's. There is something about the crust; it's light and crispy and flavorful. We just did pepperoni and sausage. We were warned not to overdo it. Between the two of us, we got a small pizza (two pieces each), fried zucchini, and a pitcher of beer, and it was perfect. Totally worth the wait.
So delicious! Chicago style pizza at its finest. Delicious tomato sauce, super crispy and flavorful crust. Great beer options as well, several local craft brews.

When coming to Chicago with 4 other friends, one thing was decided. We must stop for deep dish pizza. Off a recommendation from a friends brother, we ended up stopping at Pequod"s.The place has two floors and i like the upstairs a bit more. They have a fair selection of pizzas but since 5 people couldn't agree on any 2 toppings, we decided to go with personal one. I had the mushroom and meatball. I thought it was pretty good, for Chicago pizza. Doesn't compare to the pizza parlor i eat at, at home. Where the guy is from Italy with a heavy accent but i still liked it. Also if they ask you for appetizers because it take 5 minutes to make, you heard them wrong. It takes 35 minutes to make. Our waitress said it right but we just didn't hear it. Get an app if your hungry. While i prefer my normal pizza to deep dish, if you have never had it, Pequod's is an awesome place to go. Also the upstairs bathroom has a big Gandolf face painted on the wall that watches you pee, Kinda freak but worth seeing in itself. From second had information the woman's bathroom has something with arewn.
This is THE best Chicago style pizza.  The pan pizza is just the best, I think it would win next to any other Chicago style pizza.

I have been going to Pequod's from about 15 years. I don''t lie in the area, but try to make it out there every now-and-then.They char the edge of the pizza crust topped with cheese making their already delicious pizza so much better. It is truly unique and really tasty. The location is your standard pizza joint, nothing fancy, but last I was there they were quite family-friendly. The staff is also diner-friendly, some friendlier than others.
My favorite pizza in Chicago.  The pan pizza crust reminds me of Quatro's back in Carbondale.  Pequod's can be pretty busy, so be prepared!

Just a couple hours after wolfing down that burger at Aria, I was off on a group pizza tour of Chicago that my company was hosting for our clients. First up was Pequod's. This was my favorite pizza of the night but not my all-time favorite Chicago pizza (see Lou M's). The sauce was a touch on the sweeter side and the cheese was very sparse. yelp.com/biz_photos/pequ…There were however two standout qualities of this pizza that stuck in my head; 1) the meats were above par, especially the sausage and 2) the outer crust was phenomenal. It had a nice crisp layer of baked on cheese that was just incomparable. Toward the end of the meal I was just picking at the crust, all while knowing I had a lot more pizza to eat. yelp.com/biz_photos/pequ…Overall, not bad at all and I would not mind going back.

FINALLY made it out here - let me preface this by saying I don't normally like deep dish pizza. I know, I know - I'm a Chicago traitor.  I usually find deep dish to be too clunky and heavy, when I get pizza I want to eat four or five slices at least, and you just can't do that when you're eating deep dish.. unless you have the appetite and stomach capacity of a sumo wrestler.We split a medium deep dish pizza topped with sausage, giardiniera, and onions.  While it does take a bit of time to bake (they need time to make that great crispy crust) - the wait is well worth it.  I've never had such a flavorful and well cooked deep dish crust.  The balance of sauce, toppings, and cheese was also on point.  Will definitely be coming back when I'm having substantial pizza cravings.Check out my full review and pictures at thehungrynoodle.weebly.c…
Can't beat that crust on the pan pizza! And the sausage is top notch! Try adding garlic for the final kick.
This is seriously the best deep dish pizza I have ever eaten.  Blows Ginos East out of the water.Great service, great atmosphere.

Yeah, this is pretty great pizza. Unique to their deep dish is the bit of burnt/carmelized cheese around the edges. It sounds crazy to describe something burnt as good, but it is. The sauce is so rich in flavor, the sausage is homemade to perfection, and the crust is crispy at the bottom while the insides are cooked just right. Because it takes a long time to cook (30-40 min.) give them your pizza order as soon as you can. Their onion rings are out of this world but the Pequod house salad is unremarkable. They are always packed so come early. They don't take reservations but you can get priority seating if you call ahead. I want to withhold a star because it is nuts to go there on the weekend and with tons of people it gets really loud but the pizza is just so good.
The wait is awful, but all is forgiven when the pizza arrives. Amazing pizza and the crust is super yummy!

Best Pizza in Chicago. We recommend eating a late  lunch and then walking to Wrigleyville for some baseball or shopping, the walk shows off the great qualities of Chicago Neighborhoods. Takes just under an hour. Do the Deep Dish with sausage and then go from there!

Always excellent pizza. We just booked the private party room upstairs for our wedding rehearsal and are so excited! Sean is the best and the space is great. He gets right to the point in the emails when responding to book the private room and no time is wasted. Very flexible. Good draft beer list also included in the package. We can't wait!

Saw this of the food network and made it one of my must go to places when I visited Chicago. Waited 50 mins for medium deep dish pie which was perfectly fine with me and it was worth the wait. This pie is beautiful and a work of art. Oh yeah, it Tate's good too. Love the cheesy crust. It is also really good while cold for breakfast since this pie a huge even for 2 people.
Amazing, amazing, amazing. True Chicago-style deep dish pizza. Crust is filling, but not dense. Sauce is light and and very tasty. Stellar pizza.

Best Chicago style pizza! Skip all of the other touristy places and head up to Pequod's. They have the best lunch deal! For less than $5 you can get a personal cheese deep dish and a drink. Don't miss this!You know this a good place when Chicago PD is eating there.
4.5. Loved the sauce and the sausage. Good pepperoni too. A small was enough to be comfortably full. Could have eaten another slice but would have hated myself.

My husband and I love this place so much!!! Yesterday we went to get our favorite pizza and of course there was a huge line like always but, we were happy to wait! Luckily across the street this wonderful book bar just opened a few months ago called The Kibbitznest and we were able to have a nice drink there while we waited with our clicker. We even got a discount on beer and wine because we had a clicker!! It was fantastic! The bar tenders at the Kibbitznest held onto our clicker while we explored the beautiful place and came to get us when it buzzed to eat our favorite pizza!!! Couldn't have asked for a better night that began at the Kibbitznest and ended at Pequods!

Initially I was planning on going to another pizzeria, but everyone in the office (ALL FROM CHICAGO) began telling me about this place... Truly the best pizza I've tried in Chicago.  A solid #2 overall.  I'm sure there's enough people telling you about the details, but if you're going for pizza in Chicago, skip the tourist attractions, go for this place and get the pan pizza.
Best pizza in Chicago hands down. Crust is perfect, toppings are great and they use real tomatoes instead of some canned sauce for toppings. Absolutely delicious.

Been here a few times and love the place. This offers something a little different to Lou's. The atmosphere, the drinks and the sports bar feeling. This place can fill up quickly on weekends and get a little noisy but its worth the wait.I'm torn between Lou and Pequod's as to my favorite all time Pizza. However, I do love the rustic pans, caramelized base and crust. Service is with a smile. This place is dang cheap and services great food

I eat A LOT of pizza.  In my world, there is no such thing as bad pizza.  Hands down, this is the best pizza I have ever put into my body.  And there has been a lot of pizza in this body.I had it 11 hours ago, and I'm considering a trip up there for lunch.

Food: Love, love, love this place! This is the best deep dish pizza in Chicago and I don't care if I have to wait for it. Love the crunchy cheesy crust and the sauce is amazing! Try the meatball, pepperoni and green pepper combo. Yummmmm! Oh but I tried the salad once and it was just okay but hey, you come here for the pizza right?Service: Always on point! The waitresses are cheerful and fast. That's saying a lot considering how busy and how tightly packed it is on the first floor.My husband and I have decided that Pequod's will be our last meal should we ever move away from Chicago.

Awesome spot with great food and beer, as the wait times for a table during peak hours can attest. I've had both the thin crust and the deep dish pizza and both are amazing - although I'm a bigger fan of the deep dish pizza. The crust is perfectly crispy, thick, and buttery. Pequod's definitely doesn't skimp on toppings, either, so each bite of pizza is the perfect combination of crust, sauce, cheese, and toppings. Definitely one of my favorite pizza joints here in Chicago. If you come without a reservation, don't let the long wait time turn you away - the pizza is definitely worth the wait!

I visited the Morton grove location which is the original and it is no comparison to the Clybourn location. It was still good but it was no match for Clybourn. The Clybourn location has more and bigger toppings and even the cheese is cheesier. This will always be my favorite pizza place.

My family and I stumbled upon this great pizza place by accident. My dad and I signed up for a 5 mile race down town and had to pick up our packet at Running Away Multisport that is a few doors down. Being from the suburbs we were unfamiliar with the area and decided to walk down the street to find something to eat for dinner. As we walked past Pequod's the smell of their great pizza literally stopped us in our tracks. The Pizza smelled so good we did not look any farther and went in.When we walked in the place was very busy and we were greeted by the hostess who informed us that we would have a fairly long wait ahead of us. It was a Friday night so we expected a wait. She said if we would like we could wait at the bar area. The bartender took our orders and told us that if we like we could look at a menu and place our order ahead of time or wait till we go to our table. We opted to wait till we got to our table and they had no problem with that. For being as busy as they seemed I expect to be rushed but this was not the case. Restaurants make money through a high turn over but our waitress didn't mind letting us take our time to enjoy the experience.Since this first experience we have braved the weather and Chicago traffic from the suburbs several times to go back for their awesome pizza. If you are in the area and looking for some deep dish pizza with crust you probably haven't had before (caramelized) give Pequod's a try.

I was new in town this past weekend trying to compare NY style to Chicago style. Went to 4 different places, the names everyone mention, and was not impressed. A cashier from the Laguanitas Brewery on W 17th St really recommended this place. The last night I was in town I had to give deep dish another try before knocking it and I have to say this is the absolute best deep dish I could find.

Great deep dish pizza for a steal. Service was good, pizza (pepperoni) was tasty, and there wasn't much of a wait (granted we did get there kind of early for a Friday night). Their pizza is a bit more doughy than cheesy, so although we did feel like fat kids afterwards we weren't in a food coma as can sometimes happen. Definitely would come back.

In my humble opinion, best pizza in town. Not going to get into the debate on deep dish vs. pan vs. whatever-the-fuck but have a couple slices of this and tell me that crust isn't the standard bearer for deliciousness. Fun, noisy atmosphere. Great for a bite before the movie or with a group for a birthday. Grab a cocktail at Drinking Bird while you wait!

I am not a huge fan of deep dish BUT I am a huge fan of Pequod's deep dish!!! That has to mean something right?! Don't get sucked into the hype with Lou Malnati's because Pequod's is significantly tastier, and it's so much more well made! I never thought I'd see the day when I would be craving deep dish. :) Thank you so much Pequod's!!

The carmelized deep dish pizza here is second to none in the Second City! Great for take out if you live nearby and keep the pizza hot and ready for eating! So many different toppings to create mouth-watering pizzas. I particularly like having pineapple with bacon on mine.The location in Morton Grove is great and very handy for north suburban residents off of I-94. It is located in a charming little woodsy building that is intimate and fun. If you haven't tasted Pequod's, check it out. It is a top-notch Chicago deep-dish pizza experience.

They have thin and thick crust and a range of apps, so there's something for everyone (who's not a vegan or health nut, I'd say). The thick crust was good, probably as good as any I've had. It took a good while to come. The restaurant feels like a local place. It's a bit dark inside. The staff is friendly, although not super attentive.

Oh, Pequod's. I travel to Chicago quite a bit, and each time I need to either make a stop here or have them deliver, that's how obsessed I am (and I've had them all-- Giordano's, Malnati's, Uno's, Pizanos)!In a nutshell, it's the best deep dish you'll find in the city-- the blackened crust is amazing, and the fillings are always incredible. The pizza is always on point, but their delivery service is something that lives much to be desired; the couple of times I ordered it delivered, they delivered it without pre-slicing it, and even though I requested paper plates and napkins and they said they would bring them, the driver never brought them with our order (something that made eating the pizza a bit of a challenge).Also, be wary of asking them to deliver to hotel rooms-- the last driver we had called repeatedly to complain about having to deliver to the room and asked us to meet him down the street. An hour of phone tag later and we finally got our pizza. Dude, next time just park in front of the hotel!!Five stars for the food, two and a half for delivery.

Pequod's is consistently delicious!  When I moved to my condo, it took at least a year and a meeting in the elevator with the delivery driver to learn that Pequod's delivers to my building!  What a pleasant surprise! Delivery is speedy and hot!  The restaurant is a very nice little spot with an upstairs and comfortable seating.  Staff is always pleasant, even during high capacity times and it's always a pleasant experience.

After hearing a lot about this place from friends, my wife and I decided to finally give it a try. And what do you know: it's now one of our favorite pizza spots. Located in a good area with lots of shopping and even a movie theater across the street, this place starts off great. You walk in, there is always a line up so you put your name down and stand with the crowd with a pager in your hand. In the mean time, you can order your pizza so that when it's time for you to be seated, the pizza won't be too long. Since this is a sports bar as well, it is very crowded but lively. Don't let the place fool you because there is another floor upstairs with lots of seating room. We sat upstairs both times that we visited. The appetizers are also fresh and tasty. But let's talk about the thick crust pizza: it's NOT like pizza UNO, like Giordano's, or any other deep dish pizza you might think of. This is in a class of its own. The deep dish pizza is covered with the toppings you want which is one thing I like to see...more toppings than cheese. As you bite into, or cut into the pizza, you notice that even though it is thick crust, it's not too soft or too hard or full of dough. Somehow, the thick crust isn't as dough-like as you would think and therefore, not as filling as you would think. It's perfect! The outer crust area on top has their special touch to it: it is burnt cheese all around the top which gives it more of a different flavor when added to the pizza takes the whole experience to another level. Overall: one of our favorite pizzas in Chicago. For a regular pizza outing, I would choose Pequod's over any other "deep-dish" Chicago pizza.

My review might be colored by the fact that the pizza at Pequod's was the very first deep dish I'd had, but I absolutely loved it!I was in Chicago for the holidays, to visit friends, and someone suggested Pequod's for proximity reasons. Although I did get to have deep dish pizza again during my stay, and from a different place, there's no way I can compare that and Pequod's.How do you describe deep dish pizza? Let me just say that I understand why it's called a "pie" now. In fact, that's how I can best describe it - a very tomatoey, very cheesy, very meaty pie, with a hot, crisp crust!We went for a medium sausage pizza to be shared by 4, and underestimated how large and heavy it will be. It took 45-50 minutes to prepare, but two slices, and I was done!Don't get there when you're extremely hungry, because in all likelihood, there's gonna be a line when you get there, and then the wait for the pizza. But MAN the pizza is amazing!

I always just get mine to go, so I can't say anything of the service here. However, the pizza is always fantastic! It's also great that they're open so late. Definitely a must try for anyone looking for something new!

Best pizza place in the city, they don't do standard chicago deep dish. I think that's a good thing because nothing kills the night faster than a stomach full of cheese and sausage. The caramelized crust is something unique, the toppings are plentiful and service prompt.
One of my fav Chicago deep dish pizza places. Sometimes hard to get a seat as there are long lines but worth it!

Had to check out this historic spot. Great atmosphere. Long wait on a Friday at 1 for a table.  We opted for the bar and had no wait. It's first come first serve.  Pizza was great picture is of a small pizza for two. Staff was nice.

Standard LP faire with great pizza and a bar vibe.  The pizza is what you go for, not the ambiance (which is like a college bar), not the location (on a boring intersection on Clybourn).I love their lunch specials and the place is not crowded at that time either.  Try it and you will love it.
This is the best deep dish pizza I have had. If you got a taste for pizza try this place it will be worth it.

This is MY FAVORITE pizza in Chicago when it comes to deep dish. There is nothing like it and it's worth the wait if you come during dinner. All of my experiences with staff have been extremely pleasant and the pizza, drinks and appetizers are always what I expect-DELICIOUS! I want Pequods now! Soooooo gooooood! Keep up the excellent work!!
The pizza is bomb. Theres something about sausages on chicago pizzas... its way better than the sausages on pizza in california. They have alcoholic root beer here. I was a happy camper.

My beloved Pequod's, how I miss thee. I still fantasize about your delicious, cheesy, caramelized crust and your crispy, spicy pepperonis. Oh, and your amazing, flavorful sauce. When my husband asks me what I want for dinner, I still answer Pequod's, even though that is a long lost dream.  I miss being able to order your deliciousness until the wee hours of the night when the craving would hit.  I miss the excitement I would feel when the buzzer in my apartment would go off and how my husband and I would get the Pequod's shrieks when we knew you were coming up the steps.  I miss how I would open the box and say every single time, "Ohhhhhh, this is a good one!  Check out that caramelization!"  I miss drafting pizza slices based on the amount of crust carmelization with my husband.  Pequod's, you have ruined all pizza for me.  I can't eat other pizza without thinking of you.  Nothing will ever come close to comparing with your greatness and nothing will ever replace you in my heart.   I can only hope that we will meet again soon.   Fondly yours,Kristy
Sauce is just a tad too sweet for me personally, but this is still really good pie.It does get busy so if you plan to dine in, get here early!

HOLY HELL!I think I have died and gone to Pizza heaven.For serious.It seems my fellow yelpers are again correct in saying this is the BEST pizza in Chicago! WOW! Here's the breakdown:P = Popular beyond belief...and now I know why! It's the perfect place to grab a bit & a brew while watching Sunday night football :) Thankfully, they have 3 whole stories to accommodate all of their fans! E= Exceptional beers! Tapping into my inner local [pun intended!] we sampled various IPA's, Pale Ale's and various cocktails on the menu! They have everything :)Q = Quantity is massive! Being newbies, our party ordered apps, and 2 pizza's leaving us with hands full of to-go boxes and full bellies the next day! perfect!U = Undoubtedly the best crust ever!! Not only do they douse your pizza in cheese, but they add some extra on the crust for a nice crunch! mmmm!O = Orgasm to the mouth. Not even kidding.D = Drains the wallet a bit, but 100% worth it! :)'S = a STAPLE of Chicago!!

Bartender was cool, and for my first deep-dish experience, pizza was awesome.  The sauce was a little on the tangy side, which I wasn't a HUGE fan of, but everything else was great.  I got the small sausage & pepperoni and had half a pizza left to give to a homeless guy on my way to the train.  I would've kept it for later, but I felt guilty not sharing.Will return when I'm back in Chicago, but admittedly have not tried Malnati's, Giordano's or others yet.

I LOVE PEQUODS! This is my favorite pizza place and I always have had an amazing time there. great food and my family will forever order from this place. This is great Chicago pizza and I think that this is some of the coolest food we have in the city.

5 stars without hesitation. My chicagonian friends recommend this as THE best in town, so we stopped in to cap off the weekend. It's definitely the best deep dish pizza I've ever had. Ill also add that I'm not easy to please. You should just come. That is all.

"Call me Ishmael" - First line of Moby Dick The restaurant is named after Captain Ahabs ship in the novel. The place is huge and it was packed when we went. There was a sign that pizzas were running 50 minutes. That is a long time. You might as well read Moby Dick while you wait for your pizza. Good thing I didn't have to be anywhere and I was with great companyWhen the pizza finally came out it looked and smelled delicous. It was definitey worth the wait. I was stuffed after 1 1/2 pieces. It was very heavy. I am a New Yorker and I know pizza. Deep dish isn't my favorite but Pequod's is the place to get deep dish in Chicago. I suggest ordering an appetizer while you wait. "Then all collapsed, and the great shroud of the sea rolled on as it rolled five thousand years ago." - Last line of Moby Dick.

My party of 8 dined here for lunch on a Saturday . We used the website to request seating a few days in advance . We were seated right away. The food was amazing. We ordered the appetizer combo, everything tasted fresh. We also had a sausage and cheese thin crust pizza, it was really good. A few people in my party thought the sausage tasted weird or like it came from a box. I do not eat sausage so I wouldn't know. I would come back

I have eaten at about 5 Chicago pizza places now and I must say that this is the best pizza in the city. Came here mainly because I have heard so much about it and I just had to give it a try. When you first walk in, it looks like a bar and grill with an upstairs, not to mention the small size menu. For starters, I went the buffalo wings, which were really really good. As for the pizza, I went with a sausage, pepperoni, and garlic. The pizza is simply greatness. The sausage is on point, they give you a lot of pepperoni and the garlic blends in greatly. The slices are big (got a medium with six slices for two but should of just got a small) and the addition of the legendary caramelized crust takes the pizza into a unseen stratosphere. Their beer (at $6 a glass) is even at a decent price. Overall the only pizza place I haven't ate at in Chicago is Lou malnati, but if it's anything like Pequod then lord help us all.
Yumme yumme yummee!!! One of my favorite places when I visited Chicago. Ordered the large deep dish pizza and 3 orders of wings. Both were delicious! I am a pizza lover, this place didnt dissappoint.

Pizza preferences are usually based on where you're from, so let me start this by saying that I'm from Cincinnati. I like thick-ish pan pizzas with slightly tangy sauce and a chewy, stringy mozzerella topping. I like to eat pizza with my hands, and I like to eat more than one slice (lookin' at you, deep dish). Overall I like a balance of the sauce and cheese that, in my opinion, neither NY style nor Chicago style have a lock on (NY: too much cheese, Chicago: too much sauce). So Pequod's: great or the greatest?? Lemmie break it down for you: Sauce: Killer-diller. Not too sweet and not too tart.Cheese: Mozzerella--chewy and delicious. Weirded out initially by the cheese on the crust, but it gives the pizza a nice crunch at the end. Crust: Oh god so good--this is the mother-of-all pan pizza crusts. Thick, but solid and not incredibly doughy like Chicago deep dish. Crunchy and crusty at the bottom so that you can actually eat a slice with your hands without it bending down. Sauce-to-cheese ratio: Almost perfect! A little heavy on the sauce, but way closer to my ideal ratio than any other pizza joint in the area. Toppings: This is the only thing that threw me. The garlic topped pizza was fantastic, but the sausage on the sausage-topped pizza was too chewy for me--almost seemed over-cooked. Verdict: Sausage-less Pequod's is my true-heart's desire. I can't speak for the in-restaurant service, since I got it delivered. Pequod's pizza all day, every day, now and forever, amen.
Pequod's is where you go to get your comfort food- deep dish pizza. My fiance loves Pequod's and I've learned to love it as wel. :)

Personally, my favorite pizza in Chicago! Living in the city, we've had our fair share, but nothing compares to this! And SO IMPRESSED that they deliver all the way downtown to us! Thanks, Pequod's! Best pizza in Chicago delivered right to our door!! YUMMMMM... (also, the ONLY pizza I'll cheat on my diet for) :)

Best. Pizza. In. Chicago. If you have never been here before, be prepared for the burnt cheese crust. You won't be disappointed. Also check out the weekday lunch special. $5.99 one topping personal pan pizza and a soft drink. Great neighborhood gem.

I have never dined at the restaurant, only ordered delivery.  It will be a minimum 90 minute wait to get your delivery so order early.  The individual pan pizzas are great, I am a big fan of the spinach as it is fresh and not frozen.  The Pequods salad is awesome although the big chunks of raw yellow onion are overpowering.

Always a great meal here! My boyfriend and I don't eat dairy and they always make our cheeseless pizza and it never fails to disappoint! We also had the wings here and they are very good too! Just go here, it's always good and the service is good too.
Great pizza dine in or carry out....Always consistent. Love the deep dish....

I suppose I should first share my thoughts on the other well known Chicago deep dish pizzas: Lou Malnati's - Super buttery, super greasy, and super cheesy. Immediate food coma following the meal. If you love all of the above then you'll love Lou's.Giordano's - Heavy on the sauce and cheese and the crust felt wet. So basically it's a pile of yummy mush in your mouth. That's not necessarily bad, but also not amazing. Pequod's is the perfect deep dish pizza. The ingredients are fresh. As in, the italian sausage is the best I've ever had and even the bell peppers still have a slight crunch. The crust isn't drenched in butter or grease and it has a light crunch. There's even a rim of burnt cheese around the top. (Don't make a face. Everyone loves burnt cheese.) Every person I have introduced to Pequod's has fallen in love. If you haven't already, go tonight. Also, the pizza is made to order so you should expect to wait 30 minutes for the pizza after you've placed your order. Staff has always been awesome and the atmosphere feels like you're hanging out with your best friends at a divey sports bar.

Pequod's was my first Chicago deep dish pizza experience and it was awesome!  After waiting for the 40-minute cooking time, our pie finally arrived and not a moment too soon because I was starving after a long day of sight-seeing.  Our pizza came loaded with big chunks of sausage, pepperoni, mushrooms, spinach, and copious amounts of stringy, molten mozzarella.  The thick crust had a beautifully caramelized, chewy ring of cheese surrounding the edge.  It was hands down the tastiest-looking pizza I have ever laid my eyes on.  With a whirl of knife and fork, I inhaled two delicious slices before hitting the food wall.  Deep dish pizza is deceivingly filling so if it's your first time having it, don't be surprised if you are full after two pieces.       I've since tried Jordano's deep dish and while very very good, I'd still say Pequod's is number one for me.  Lou M's is next on my list to try!

The pan is great. One of the most unique in Chicago, which is something to pull off. The thin, not so great imo. But the vibe is awesome. The people make you feel at home. And other than going to Burt's in Morton Grove, this is as good as this style of pan Za gets.

After much researching into who had the best deep dish pizza in Chicago, Pequod's made the final 4 (Art of Pizza, Lou Malnati's and Gino's East were the others), which I tried while I was in Chicago, this past Fall. After having all 4, Pequod's ended up at the top of my list. Being a Pittsburgher, I think it's a travesty that they don't ship nationwide, like Malnati's and Gino's. That said, I have asked and they said they will par bake pies for shipment, but somebody would have to pick them up and ship them themselves. Might any of you local Chicagoites be willing to help out a fellow Pequod's-lover? If so, you can reach me at bassbone26@hotmail.com. Thanks!
Best deep dish in the city!  Can be a long wait, though, even during the week.

My first pizza i had from them was nothing special.  I decided to give them another shot and try something a little more diverse.  The crust, sauce, and cheese really cant hold it's own by itself.  GET SOME TOPPINGS AND THIS PIZZA COMES ALIVE!!!!!
only place to get deep dish and not your dads rootbeer and die happy.
i am a pizza enthusiast. the best in chicago! will be back.

The year is 1994...or was it 93? Anywho, been digging this spot since the neighborhood boys washed dishes and me and the girls waited out back till they finished there shift,  toting a freshly made pie! My neighbor was one of those guys, so I got the dibs! Fast forward and I can't get a seat without a reservation. Who would have thunk it. Thanks for the memories and great Pizza! The good old days....

Being from the Suburbs of Chicago, and growing up next to a Lou Malnati's, I have never had anything close to compare to Lou's. Don't get me wrong Lou's is still #1 in my book... But if you're looking for some deep dish, this place is top notch. Pizza is a staple around these parts, and everyone has their deep dish pizzas, but nothing touches Pequod's style. Their caramelized crust is delicious, you cant just have one slice of it, likely half a pie in a sitting if you're being true to yourself. If you have a chance to get over there, do not pass it up. The parking for this place can be a little tricky, there is paid parking across the street, and if you're reaaaaaaally lucky you might be able to find local free parking, or maybe a meter'ed spot. Also the place is very small, so be prepared to wait for seating if you go during peak hours. Open late, and they deliver!

This is the best Pizza in Chicago. lou malnati's and uno's pizza has nothing on this pizza. I like thin crust pizza, not into eating a bunch of dough with my pizza with deep dish. But I did try a few bites of the deep and it is by far the best. The thin is even better. This place is always packed and forget getting a table if you get here late. The best time to come is between 4-6p. Make it another night if you get there any later.

My now husband and I knew we were meant to be when we determined our favorite Chicago pizza was undoubtedly Pequod's. When faced with the decision of where to have our rehearsal dinner last February, the solution was a no-brainer. The evening of the rehearsal dinner went perfectly. Their upstairs private party room is a little tight, but it was cozy, intimate and casual - just what we were looking for. The service was awesome. As a type-A bride-to-be, I have to say the only negative was their lack of traditional planning/coordination. We "booked" our event about 9 months out with an email from Pequod's saying, "You got it, the date is yours." We didn't sign a contract or put any money down, which felt different from the other vendors we booked. Regardless, after I allowed myself to trust in their process, we followed up with them a few times leading up to the event and they were warm, kind, and accommodating when we wanted to come tour the space. Would recommending hosting an intimate event here! And this goes without saying at this point - there pizza trumps all.

My second favorite after lous. Unlike most pequads is more crust less cheese. The sauce is great the burnt crust is amazing! Don't underestimate the beef sandwich it was so good!! Prices should be higher I would pay more Service was bar service not bad not great! But the food is worth going for

I can only speak on Pequod's delivery as I have never actually been to the restaurant.Co-workers and I had a hankering for good Chicago style pizza, so we decided on Pequod's. I called right when they opened at 11am, and ordered two large pan pizzas for the 8 of us. The lady on the phone was less than polite, but it sounded like it was busy in there. Our office was out of the delivery zone but only by a few blocks, so they charged us a buck more and accommodated the order. She said it would be there in about an hour. I ended up getting a call from the delivery guy an hour an a half later. Bye bye, 5 star rating. The pizza was delicious. It had had enough time to cool off a bit and was the perfect temperature. Toppings were plentiful and that cheesy caramelized crust really sets it apart from its competitors. Will definitely order again.

Pequod's Pizzeria has both thin crust and pan pizza offerings. I had to go pan because that's the way you get the caramelized crust which is Pequod's claim to fame. I'll admit I'm a bit particularly when it comes to pizza and really feel like the essential elements (crust, sauce, and cheese) have to come together to hit pizza perfection. The crust: true to style, chewy and bready on the interior but crispy and crunchy where it hits the pan with the carmelization from the cheese. The sauce: savory and really good, I actually got extra sauce on my pizza which is a great call for the pan style. The cheese: way too much for me, really the thing that makes this pizza the hardest to eat. If you want pan pizza in Chicago this is the place to come though. So far one of my favorite pie's in the city.

YOU MUST GET THE SAUSAGE!!!! It's the best pizza sausage you can have. The ingredients are wonderful. The pizza has the perfect blend of cheese, sauce and crust.If there is one minute flaw to Pequod's it's that you have to take it easy on the toppings, because they really pile them up and it can overtake the pizza. Stick with 1-2 toppings and you'll be happy.Access to this place is not easy. It's a good 10-15 minute walk from the Fullerton Red Line. Parking is not fun. Unless you live in Lincoln Park, it's difficult. It's TOTALLY worth it though to try. Fantastic pizza!

I walked into this restaurant and knew right away this was my kind of place. It has a neighborhood "everybody knows your name" vibe. Our waitress was full of personality and very nice. She definitely added to the experience. Additionally, she provided us some sightseeing spots for the area to maximize our trip from downtown (Wicker Park). I had their wings which were tender with the perfect amount of heat. I highly recommend starting your meal off with a plate of them. Next, came the pizza. The deep dish was absolutely yummy. The sauce was smooth versus chunky and plentiful versus missing. The cheese and pepperoni were good completing the pie. Finally, this spot offers a lunch special of cheese personal size pizza with a drink, M-F, for only $4.95. You can't beat that deal!

Yum yum yum. If you love a pan pizza with a crispy crust, this is the place for you! When it comes out, you see it's a darken crust and you know that you're going to get that perfect crunch when you take a bite. The crust is so flakey and exactly what I look for in a pan pizza. We order a medium sausage, onion and garlic pizza. The sausage is more like balls, like a meatball versus smaller pieces. I wasn't quite the fan of that, despite it being good. And I could only smell the garlic versus tasting it on the pizza. I think next time I'll switch it up and try other toppings. But it's definitely delicious!!!

I never really liked deep dish pizza because the crust is waaaaayyy too thick and not much filling. Zachary's in the bay area made me like deep dish pizza, I figured I just had really bad ones (BJ's and the like). I was in Chicago not too long ago and we had to come here because it's voted one of the best deep dishes in town. And I concur, it was AMMMMAAAZIIINNNGGGG. I don't even know how to describe that taste, it definitely hit the umami level. You just have to try it for yourself, it's really hard to explain. They use very fresh ingredients and are not cheap with it. The sausage pieces are GINORM!!! The bread is actually thin and crispy, it's alllll filling!!! yey!If i could add another star, I would, for the whale that wears a thong over its head.
I've eaten here about half a dozen times. It definitely gets crowded, so I suggest ordering to go. It's a place that shows what Chicago pizza can be.

Ordered delivery on a Sunday night at 7:30.  Told delivery would take about an hour and a half but it came in about an hour. Yeah!First time ordering- and it sure is yummy!! Got  a thin crust and a deep dish and both were fabulous.

This is by far...The. Best. Pizza. In. Chicago.  I was going to say, "in the world", but I don't want to over-sell.  Granted, I only lived in Chicago for 4 precious, wonderful, joyful years, but I had the opportunity to eat a lot of pizza, including the more "trendy" ones.  You know which ones I'm talking about.  This pizzeria blows all the rest away.  The caramelized crust...Oh-Mylanta!  The only downside is that it's SORT OF off the beaten path.  So the nearest El stop is 0.8 miles away.  No bus that I know of goes near their either.  My recommendation: get off the red/brown line stop at Fullerton and just enjoy a nice walk there and back...it'll help burn off the calories you are sure to accumulate from stuffing your face full of delicious pizza!  Just trust me.  GO NOW!Oh, I forgot to mention the whole "Is this really deep-dish pizza?" question.  Now, I am a fan of deep-dish pizza, BUT it can get a little overwhelming.  Pequod's airs on the side of a "conservative deep-dish", so you aren't going to get a pizza that is quite as pie-like as the other guys.  I appreciate this.  You may not.  But I just wanted to throw that out there so there are no surprises!

My favorite deep dish/pan pizza in the city, and it's not even a close call. First you must recognize the difference between pan pizza and deep dish/stuffed pizza. If you're looking for a cheese overdose and are expecting that mozza string that only breaks when you're holding the paddle a foot over your head, that is not this pizza, that is stuffed pizza. I prefer the "light" and fluffy crust of pan pizza to the thickly packed, flattened down cornmeal covered deep dish crust. Admittedly no there is not a ton of cheese on here, but I don't think that's too bad of a thing, especially when they offer extra cheese. I remember having Lou Malnati's for the first time and feeling disappointed. I don't like the patty layer of sausage, and with a lot of stuffed pizza places the toppings are under the cheese, which I really don't care for. The toppings should be crispy on top with a little char, not soggy floating around in cheese. Peqoud's took every tweak I would make in other pan pizza formulas and applied the changes I would make to create the perfect pie. LOL @ the review that said the cheesy garlic bread looked like they just added butter, garlic, and cheese to the bread wtf did you think cheesy garlic bread would have on it, foie gras? The caramelized cheese crust, I don't even need to tell you about, you've already heard it. Service is spot on, not in your face every minute, but your glass is never empty. The place is deceivingly larger than you think because they have an upstairs, so don't be discouraged if it looks full when you walk in! Anyway the pizza is also gorgeous, I remember finishing a huge slice and being full, and the table next to us was just getting their pie delivered to their table and I was like "Ooo I want that. Wait. I have that. I just ate that. Omg I want theirs too though." Anyway I'm in love with Peqoud's and if you have a single taste bud and/or brain cell you will too.

I really enjoyed the laid back atmosphere of this place. And the service was quick and good as well. We got small jalapeño, mushroom, sausage and pepperoni pan pizza. It was awesome. One of the best deep dish pizzas. Sauce was perfect. And so was the ratio of toppings, cheese, and sauce. The cheese baked on the crust was so good. Can't wait to come back to Chicago to eat there again.

There's Pizza and then there's PEQUOD'S PIZZA. It's off the chart and as original as it gets!When you get a craving for it, no other slice will do..Morton Grove location is an old house, pretty cool place.

Caramelized crust won me over.   sauce is very good and not too much. for any deep dish pizza noob, please note that deep dish does take longer to make (40-45 mins) so please be prepared for that.another useful tip for deep dish, if you order it to go or delivery, as them NOT to cut it for you.the crust will stay cripsy longer if you dont cut it and cut it yourself at home.during the wait we would just drink and have an app or two.  that should suffice .as for time to go, place gets packed during the weekends so if you go on a weekend.  8-830pm would be ideal.  for weekdays it's should be fine during normal dinner/supper times.

Yes this is really 'as good as it gets' for deep dish pizza in Chicago. I've tried Giardinos, Gino's, and Lou Malnati's, and this DePaul suburban establishment definitely takes the crown as BEST. This place is a no brainer and all you need are a set of taste buds to realize this is great pizza. The ingredients are phenomenally fresh and toppings are generous. Flavorful homemade marinara sauce and a buttery soft crust, make this a very well rounded pizza.Pequods is definitely the place to be and is worth the quick trip on the loop to Lincoln Park. Can't wait to visit again soon!

The herbaceousness of the sausage is a step shy of critical mass: so righteous a ratio of spices-to-meat that vegetarians get confused and carnivores...well, carnivores just feel hungry for more.But the true crown of the Pequod's 'za is the crust. It caramelizes. Put the word "caramelizes" in italics in your mind in the prior sentence. Give it urgency. Who else does that? Seriously, tell me in the comments, because I want more o' that...but I still defy any house in town to match the mystical Pequod's sausage. I don't care if it sounds gay. In fact put that in italics...just to make it fabulous. The original kitchen, In '06, burned down. The cooks, in their envelope-pushing ways, set in motion the inferno after heating the oven until it became its own sentient life form. The oven, only pretending to shut off when the kitchen staff closed, burst into flame like a teen whose parents' vacation flight just went wheels up, only the damage was harder to cover up with a Swiffer. Now, that's just rumor, but we're Americans, and we need our history to feel connected. Coming soon: an app to track the oven temperatures at Pequod's, but instead of a red "warning" indicator, there's a cute graphic of ingredients for s'mores. Open up your uber when it reaches "graham cracker smoosh" (looks as cute it sounds). Parking, like the sausage, will get out of hand.

I had this place written down as a restaurant to try, based on a food show I watched years ago.  My husband and I were running errands and got hungry.  We decided to stop in for lunch since we were only a few blocks away (thank you trusty list of restaurants to try).   The place has an Interesting vibe and great pricing for lunch.  I can say the rave review from that food show was totally appropriate.  Perfect pizza!  And we have driven there for a pizza since having lunch silently wishing there was a downtown location.
Best pizza I have had in Chicago. Apparently fly more people from out of town come out to check this place out. Go with with basil and giardinera deep dish pizz.
I am not a lover of deep dish pizza. But this is off the chart delicious!   The place is crowded all the time, but well worth the wait. The best deep dish pizza in the world!

Ask your Chicago friends where to eat and they give you the best!Under the recommendation from my brother from another mother, he told us that this place is one of the best pizza places! He was right! It is walking distance to DePaul University (he went there) and about 3 miles from our hotel. We decided to cab it to this pizzeria and walk back to burn off those calories! The restaurant/bar looks small on the outside, but when you get in, it is actually bigger. It is two stories and there is plenty of seating upstairs. We arrived pretty early (round 12) to beat the crowds and there was no wait for us to be seated. This is the "official" Blackhawks bar. My friend says "EVERY bar" is the official Blackhawks bar. Anyway, we got the lunch special (individual pizza and soda) for about $6.00. It was a good deal! Apparently, they used to serve the special with beer, but that stopped due to the new laws. Anyway, we shared a salad which tasted very fresh and helped ease my hunger pains while waiting for the deep dish. Deep dish pizza takes awhile, but it is worth the wait!I got pepperoni and spinach for my deep dish and I am a fan of deep dish. Wow. The sauce is sweet but tangy and the cheese....so much goodness! The small individual pizza looks small, but is fairly big and difficult to finish. The crust is crunchy and a bit thicker than I hoped for, but still very tasty! I did not finish my deep dish because it was just so much (Shame, shame!), but was glad to have it while on the walk back. The staff is friendly and really nice. Our waitress gave good recommendations and told of us other tourist attractions. She was very knowledgeable! The atmosphere is very chill and seems to be frequented by the college audience, since DePaul University is within walking distance.

I do not like pan pizza in general. Too much bread. HOWEVER, I LOVE Pequod's pan pizza. The carmelization, the generous toppings, the sauce. This is, to me, the very definition of Chicago pizza. This is a must-go for anyone visiting and looking for good pizza. I just wish I lived closer, but I'll always make the special trip.
the.best.pizza.ever. It gets super packed but is well worth the wait. Bring anyone here to show them *true* chicago style pizza!

I stopped by here for the first time a couple days ago after a workout. I had heard a ton of amazing things, but I was especially drawn in by the lunch special. For $4.95 you can get a personal pan pizza with one topping and a fountain soda (no refills)!! If you check in on Yelp, you can get the same deal but with a beer. The pizza took a while to prepare, but hopefully that means the lunch portions are made to order (some places have frozen lunch pizzas). The pizza was delicious and the service was excellent. I'll definitely be back!
Best deep dish in the city!  Keep in mind we live on the west side,  within 15 min of 3 Lou's and a Giordano's, and we'd still prefer to trek up here for delicious pizza!

Pequod's is truly one of the best pizza's ever. The butter crust with the carmelized cheese to the edge is amazing. Every place else wishes they were Pequod's. Only downside is the location is small. But they make up for it with great pizza.

After having two deep dishes with cornmeal crust, I was ready for straight up crust and this place came recommended.  After walking 10 miles around the city that day, I wasn't up for the trek so we were glad to see we fell within their delivery window.  It was a 90 minute wait but worth it.  That burnt looking stuff you see around the edge of your pizza is what they call caramelization...they are correct.  Not a hint of burnt on the area.  I will say though if you're on a first date, bring toothpicks because that stuff gets in every crevice in your mouth you can imagine.  Makes for an attractive smile.  Lots of pepperoni, good quality cheese and a small is plenty for 2 people.  We'll definitely be getting this again the next time we're in town.

Went to Chicago for the first time and of course had to try some Chicago deep dish pizza.  My wife and I shared a meat lovers style pizza.  It was very good but the crust only covered about half the pizza on the bottom which was odd.  Flavor was very good though.  We also had fried mozzarella sticks and fried mushrooms and they were great.  We enjoyed the place overall but the pizza didn't quite live up to the hype.  Maybe we came on an off day...

Pequod's is my favorite pizza in town.  They are the only place I enjoy that does multiple types - pan, stuffed, tossed - and they are all amazing to me to in their own way.  Its a fun place to watch the game, and they have good service.  Only issue is when you are seated downstairs at a two top and the bar gets to crowded if feels like you are being elbowed or someone might splash their drink on your pizza.  If you can sit upstairs, this is a great experience.

Incredibly good pan pizza.  I only go here for the pizza, and don't usually get anything else.  This last time, got the appetizer combo and it was quite good (though all fried, for those who avoid such things).Took off one star because the ingredients were just extra-skimpy.  Otherwise, everything was great as always.

One of my favorite pizza places in Chicago! I always try to take my guests here when they come visit Chicago. The atmosphere has a sports bar feel but is very family friendly. It's usually fairly busy so be sure to get there before the rush in order to get a table in a decent amount of time. Great pizza, good drink selection, clean and fun environment. Don't pass up this gem!

I was raised on Home Run Inn and The original Giordano's on South California when it was BYOB. These were my childhood sweethearts. Both were outstanding pizzas in the late 70's but now that I'm older I have  found superior pie. Lou's and Geno's East are good but this is the place for the best. You forget life for a while while eating this magnificent offering. Well done Pequods
Best deep dish in Chicago! Caramelized crust FTW! Try giardiniera on it!

BEST PIZZA I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE (I've eaten many pizzas in my day). Seriously, this is the Chicago-style experience everyone should have. The ONLY downfall to this place is that you may literally wait more than an hour to sit down, as it is SO busy and a little crammed inside because of that. Call-ahead seating is available though... So I DEFINITELY recommend this place! YUM!
Sausage and Giardiniera caramelized crust pizza will be the best you've had in Chicago or ever!!!

The first thing I think of when someone says Chicago is PIZZA! My all time favorite food :)   So when my friends recommend pizza places I get excited to try them all.Pequods was 1st on my list. My favorite ingredient in a pizza is the sauce. The Saudi is what makes or breaks the pizza. & Pequods hit the spot. The pizza was absolutely delicious. I would have given the pizzeria 5 stars but the staff needs to be friendlier.

Went year a while back for my birthday and absolutely enjoyed it. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was pretty cool.  We started with a party of 6 and ended up with 10 and they were more than accommodating.  The only reason this place is missing a star is because our waitress was acting like she had attitude because it was 10 of us and then when we asked for napkins, she literally brought us 5 napkins.

It's soooo good! The sauce is not as chunky as other places and the crust isn't as thick as some of the others, but the emphasis here is on the toppings!! We got sausage, pepperoni, and black olives and it was sooooo good! The sausage was nice, high quality and there were stacks of pepperoni. Yum! The place is crazy busy, so definitely take advantage of their call ahead table service.

Before visiting Pequod's, I officially completed the TRIFECTA! (Gino's, Giordano's and Lou's) I saved this place for last because I wanted to get all the other "Famous Chicago Pizza Joint"s out of the way. I'm not going to write a full on review of this place because there are plenty here. But from the sauce to the cheese to the toppings (SAUSAGE) and to that flipping delicious cheese crust.. I will not be partaking in pizza eating anywhere else when I come to Chicago!! (Unless a local tells me about another hidden gem i MUST TRY) Pequod's is where I'll be!!

I didn't grow up in this city, I grew up with pizza chains.  Of all the pizza chains that were in my life, there was nothing that could top a pan pizza from Pizza Hut.  Chefs, employees, fans of Pequod's, please don't take offense to this statement....Pequods pizza is a Chicago Style Pizza Hut pan pizza on steroids.  I truly mean that in the highest compliment possible.We got a pan pizza the other night before seeing Ninja Turtles 3d.  Since we obviously weren't getting anchovies on the pizza (hardy har har), we decided on sausage and giardinera.  If you are a meat lover, be sure to go with sausage, as they throw HUGE chunks all up and in that pie.  I also liked how the crust was a little burnt on the sides, but not in a bad way.  I can only write so much about a pizza place, but I will say this place jumped up to one of my favorites in the city, go check it out if you haven't already.

Top three pizzas in Chicago!  Period.  Always crowded whenever I go so expect waiting time but well worth the wait!  They're known for their crust.  Thin, slightly burnt, crispy!  Yum.  And I'm not a crust person at all.
Our 30 minute pizza came out partially charred, but they remedied it with another (unfortunately, 30-minute) pizza. It tasted much better. I still would recommend.

The pizza is insane good! I had the pizza and added onions,  mushrooms basil and jalapeño.  Was a interesting mix but actually worked nicely! We also had the jalapeño poppers and those were also great! The place was a recommendation from our can driver and it was a great suggestion! Here's a tip if you are traveling: talk to your cab drivers as a lot of them may have some great insights! After chatting with ours,  he used to be a sous chef at Michelin star restaurant and had some great suggestions for us when it came to food.  We weren't disappointed with any of his suggestions!

I've been going to Pequod's for years.  The pizza is AWESOME.  The restaurant is very cool on the inside.  They also have great lunch deals during the week.  Make sure you get the pan pizza with the "caramelized" cheese.

So a friend of mine  that leave in Cali told me about this pizza place that I have never hear before. I decided to yelp it to see pic and reviews and when I saw they had more than a thousand reviews I was like this must be good place. Line was long but totally worth. We ordered a deep dish pepperoni, basil, meatball pizza and also garlic bread since a lot of people said were good. This was my first time there and won't be last one this pizza was just AMAZINGGGGGGGG for me so far best in chicago.

This is the best deep dish in Chicago.  It is best to order take out as there is very little seating.  The service is good but when dining in it can be slow.  Overall if you are wanting deep dish pizza in Chicago, this is the place to go.

Best deep dish pizza in town! Every person I have ever taken here loves the pizza. I've had people tell me they never liked deep dish till they had Pequod's. Do yourself a favor if you're here from out of town and want some good Chicago style pizza, please, please go to Pequod's. The lines can be quite long for dinner, so if you want to avoid them go for lunch.
So good! I love that this place delivers too. I love to get the deep dish with sausage and garlic. The crust is awesome and it's very filling.

I've come to Pequod's multiple times, and as a chicago deep dish pizza lover, I'd give Pequod's number 1 for pizza. It's disappointing though because their service has been less than mediocre almost every time I've gone. I understand the wait times, it's a popular place, of course on a Saturday night you'll have to wait. I understand the long wait for the pizza, I mean it's a thick, delicious circle of goodness! But while waiting for your pie to come out it would be nice to be actually waited on. I had only 1 drink while waiting over an hour and a half for our pizza. Had our waitress (who we only saw once at the beginning) come by more frequently, myself and my party would have ordered plenty of drinks. We didn't even get refills of our water. After complaining the manager did give us a discount which was much appreciated. The pizza is soo delicious I of course will be back, but just a heads up, give yourself lots of time and don't expect a lot out of the waitstaff.

Great deep dish pizza. I've been to a number of really good Chicago pizza places. Pequods is hands down the best. I liked the laid back atmosphere, beer selection and staff. Get there early or late, it's gets crowded.

I'm not in love with deep dish pizza, but this is my favorite of the thicker style in Chicago, probably because it's actually pan pizza. This means that the crust gets nice and caramelized, which adds textural contrast and helps it not to be all mushy. Pequods also makes phenomenal meatballs - worth a detour just for them.
My favorite deep dish in Chicago.  Second favorite thin crust pizza.  Definitely a place I need to bring people visiting Chicago.
Best deep dish in the city, you'll never go back to lous or giordanos after eating here.
Holy cow! Amazing pizza! I think this is the best in Chicago! The service is bad (I really mean bad) but the food is worth it. I think the secret is in the unwashed pans they use to cook the pizza.

Amazing, amazing, amazing!  There is nothing left I can say about Pequod's that hasn't already been said by the other 1,100 reviewers.  The caramelized crust, the pan blackened bottom, and the secret sauce are the 3 components that make this the best deep dish in Chicago. Seating can be tricky on a busy night and the pizza can take a while to come out at times but to me this is all just part of Pequod's personality and vibe.  Pizza this delicious shouldn't be made too easy to get, so the long wait only adds to the appreciation of the magic.There are times where I wake up salivating from dreaming about the Pequod's tomato sauce and that blackened and buttery crust.  If you haven't tried Pequod's yet, then do yourself a favor and go there immediately!
Pizza is freaking amazing!  Unique crust and great flavored sauce.  Right near Wrigley!  Go! Go! Go! Highly recommend!
Fantastic pizza. Incredible crust. Definitely one of my favorite places

I love pizza and more importantly i love deep dish sausage pizza and pequods is so awesome...this carmelized crust is too die for. Ive been to a lot of pizza places and I'm counting this one as one of my favorites and i will be back

6 years ago I hated deep dish pizza (and yes, I'm am a Chicagoan born and raised), HOWEVER, when my wife brought me to Pequods in 2008 my taste buds experienced a moment of pure ecstasy that only a perfect Chicago deep dish pizza can create! We had a sausage and spinach deep dish pizza and my mind was blown! Alas, I have been forever ruined. When I eat regular pizza I think of only Pequods and how I could be experiencing something better. When I'm eating there I never wanna leave. My fat soul has been won over by their incredibly, mind changing recipe and all I wanna do is shout out their amazing-ness from the top of the Sears tower (I refuse to call it the "W" word)! Anyways, please don't give up on deep dish till you have tried Peqouds... I DARE YOU!!!! Muahhaahaahhaaaaa!!!!!
Caramelized onion crust deep dish pizza!  Phenomenal is an understatement!

Simply the best. There's just not much else to say about Pequods. Coming from the south side of Chicago, I find it very difficult to get a delicious za basically anywhere north of 87th. But....Pequods is the exception. I've been here many a time and it never disappoints. Basically stick to pizza and beers here. They don't take reservations really so plan accordingly. It gets crowded if there is a big game on, but trust me it's worth the wait. Personal favs=mushroom+sausage and the pepperoni+pepperoncini. But really, come to think of it, their veggie is killer too! IN SHORT, ALL ZA HERE IS OUT OF THIS WORLD! If you have not been to Pequods yet, I highly suggest you get there ASAP for good food and good times.

Went here with friends this past weekend.  Even though we did a call ahead we had to wait two hours to get a table.  They were telling walk-ins that it would be over three hours, and I had no idea why someone would wait so long for pizza.  Now I completely understand.  This was easily the best Chicago-style pizza I have ever had, and I've been to a number of places that are "the best".  Pequod's blew it out of the water.  Will definitely be back next time I'm in Chicago, but I'll probably do carry out.

Hands down the best Chicago style deep dish pizza AND lunch special in the city! Monday- Friday until 3pm, you can order a personal pizza and a soda/draft beer for a measly $5!  You can't beat that!But let's talk about what makes the pizza magical. It's all in the crust! How I have dreamed of only devouring the crust! It will blow your mind! Everyone that I know who has experienced the magic of Pequods will agree. Also, considering that Pequods is also a bar, you wouldn't expect top quality customer service, but that's what I have gotten here.  I don't eat pork but love pepperoni...turkey that is. I actually called Pequods and asked them if they would be ok with me brining in my own turkey pepperoni. Most restaurants have never obliged, but Pequods was more Han happy to meet my request. I was pleasantly surprised and even more enamored by the delicious food but wonderful customer service. Oh, they now deliver and even delivered to my home though I was a little outside their delivery range because they weren't busy at that moment. That's customer service at its best!

Great Chicago deep dish. It's fun atmosphere, your typical Chicago pizza joint. Lots of wood, stuff about sports, booths, etc. The waitstaff is incredibly nice. My friend lost her phone into the abyss of a crack in between the wall and a booth and they were very nice to fish it out for her. We ordered mozzarella sticks and a salad (in our poor attempt to have something healthy), which were good. We also did a couple slices of the thin crust (because none of us had ever tried it before). We ordered 2 deep dishes, and since there was 6 of us, we had plenty to take home. The sausage is incredible on the pizza and all the veggies are fresh and crisp, even after being in the oven. It's a must if you are visiting the city.
You WILL wait two days for a table BUT the pizza IS THAT good. Don't let the sad, sad table assigner put you off. Now a must-do on all Chicago trips.

We were told Pequod's has some of the best deep dish Chicago-style pizza in the whole city. Coming from the East Coast, we were excited to try it. Although the restaurant is known to be packed on the weekends, we easily got a table on a Monday evening. Each additional topping was $2.75, which seemed like a lot considering we only ordered pepperoni and black olive. Pequod's famously uses old cast iron pans that have been blackened over the years, allowing the crust and the cheese to melt together and form a crispy caramelized layer. We learned that "deep-dish" at Pequod's refers to a thick bottom crust, as opposed to "stuffed" deep dish where your chosen topics are incorporated inside the pizza. Pequod's was a great introduction to Chicago-style deep dish.
came here for dinner on a weekend, thankfully we didn't have to wait too long. We were sat upstairs in a huge comfy booth and the pizza was absolutely delicious
With almost 1800 reviews adding more of the same is redundant, this is great pizza.Take it from me, order extra sauce and cheese because the deep dish is pretty doughy.
17 years in the city and this is hands down my favorite pizza!!! Amazing flavor and the caramelized crust (which looks burnt) is the BEST part!!

Definitely order the pan pizza. The thin crust was just average. We ordered sausage, mushroom, and spinach, and it was delish. The wait time nearly killed me, over an hour to bring out our pizzas, but I was starving. I think I actually prefer Giordanos because it has the extra sauce and the layers, but this was also phenomenal. Chicago deep dish delish.

I love deep dish and before going here it was hard to find a place that can compete with Lou Malnati's. This place definitely does. The pizza styles are still different both the pan pizza at Pequod's was delicious. I am excited to go back and have another.  Plus, the prices were very reasonable.  Go early as you can pretty much guarantee there will be a wait!
2nd favorite pizza place. Burt's is my number 1 but I still suggest this place to people who aren't from here.

I visited Pequod's on my first trip to Chicago after attempting unsuccessfully to get into uber-famous Lou Malnati's, which was jam-packed on a Friday night at 8PM. I wasn't going to wait 2 hours for pizza, so a friend who lives in the city suggested we try the less-famous Pequods.I am so glad we tried this place instead. We still had to wait an hour to be seated (this is after calling ahead for what I was told was "priority seating" and a 25 minute wait), but it was worth it. And, seriously, if you're getting pizza on a Friday night, you should expect heavy wait times.Our party of 4 ordered a medium deep dish pizza. The men in our group protested the idea of such a "small" pie, but the ladies were glad we stuck to our guns. 6 pieces of deep dish glory was plenty to go around.Our pan pizza had mushrooms, sausage and pepperoni on it. The crust was crunchy and delicious at first, though it did get soggy after a few minutes. But I have no complaints. The burnt cheese around the edge of this pizza was sublime.And the sausage:  Oh, the sausage. It was soft and casing-free (score! I hate chewing on sausage casings), and had a lovely hint of fennel. I've never tasted such yummy sausage.I wished there was more cheese, but I'm not complaining. This was my first Chicago pizza, and it was pretty darn good.

The pizza. What can I say?  It's honestly freaking delicious.  Now, I am not one to stand on a soapbox and diatribe daily about the superiority of pizza to other foods. Because usually- I wouldn't eat pizza if you paid me.  But here... This pizza is seriously delicious.We came on a Friday evening, it was jammed pack. More sardines than in a old Soviet tin but we held on to our patience and stalked the guests at the bar for their seat like hawks.  It's the only way to eat in a halfway reasonable amount of time- say an hour. But a good 2 hours later, when the pizza finally came.  It melted away my angry.  You say, oh it must be the joy of alleviating hungry after such a long wait.  But no sir- I kindly filled my gluttony with wings and salad.  But let's get back to the main point- the pizza was the bombdiggity.  The crust was thick but not soggy.  Cheese, this could be improved as I could barely taste it. But the toppings.  Oh the toppings! Seriously made you want to slap your female paternal unit- yes it was that good.  Dense, packed and meatballs the size of fists- it definitely didn't leave you wanting.Trust me. Coming from someone who literally lives to eat and studies taste like the Quran, if you ever feel the need for pizza.  You will not regret eating here, as long you can survive the painful waiting.

Pequod's has been by far the best restaurant that I've been to in Chicago. I had the fries for an appetizer which were excellent. And the deep dish took a while to cook but it was obviously homemade and was indescribably delicious. The servers were friendly but were not on top of out drinks and napkins. But overall great experience.
Great neighborhood pizza joint.  I love their deep dish pizza.  The place gets crowded very quickly so plan accordingly

Best deep dish in town. Careful on the weekend or during a Hawks game because it gets really crowded. You can duck into the Drinking Bird next door while you wait though, so at least you've got options.
I love this place. If you are looking for a good Chicago style pizza, this place is worth checking out. I like it better than Lou's, and that is when I really like Lou's as well.

I was so impressed with Pequods, but not for typical reasons.  Obviously their pizza is something that everyone raves about-and I agree.  But the service was also fantastic.  I had a group of 20 people going on a Saturday night for my birthday.  A lot of restaurants have an attitude when you have this many people and I sometimes they still make you wait or even lose reservations all together.  Although Pequod's walk-in wait was 2 hours, my reservation was brought right to the front and seated right away.  Within minutes our waitress was taking orders and accommodating my party.  She was so friendly and made us feel welcome despite how busy and crowded the restaurant was.  This is so rare and so appreciated! Since then, I have been back and will continue to dine there.

I am a fan.  If you're looking to change up the normal Chicago deep dish routine, Pequod's is the place to go.  I ordered a deep dish pizza with sausage, green peppers, onions, and mushrooms.  Let me tell ya... it was tastey.  The crush is nice and thick, a little less crunchy than Lou's and definitely more pizza for each slice.  The best part about it was that it all looked like one big, happy pizza.  All the ingredients had great proportion and I will definitely come back!

My buddies took me here 8 years ago to try the "caramelized crust" deep dish pizza. I haven't been able to stay away since! The deep dish has that homemade, fresh ingredient taste to it. Hearty yet light enough to make you keep grabbing for more slices. Great, garlicky tomato sauce. Cheese that's not too greasy. Darn... I'm getting hungry just thinking about it! Go here. You will enjoy it I promise.
My favorite pizza. Case closed. There is nothing else to even discuss other than the fact that you WILL regret it for the rest of your life if you do not come here.
This is one of my favorite pizza spots in Chicago! I always order extra pepperoni and extra sauce on my pizza and it's amazing! I have never had a bad meal here!

The best deep dish in the city. Don't agree with me, well your wrong and you're probably a damn New Yorker. The crust is fluffy and the the cheese ring completes the experience. The awesome sauce is just the icing on This triumph of gastronomy.

Pizza was awesome. The deep dish was to as good as it gets. We ordered a gardinara, pepperoni, sausage and meatball pie.The cheesy bread was delicious, service was great and overall was amazing meal.  Highly recommend to anyone who liked Deep Dish, or want to try Deep Dish Pizza.

Came here with my cousins, brother and sis-in-law on a chilly Saturday night.  After about 90 minutes and a cocktail at The Drinkingbird next door, we were seated at a rather tight table for our group of 6 -- but we made it work. We started with an order of Pequods Salad and Cheesy Garlic Bread to shared.  Then, shared a large veggie pan pizza and a large meat pan pizza and washed them down with some pitchers of Blue Moon.  Everything was delicious and our waitress was extremely sweet and patient.  Atmosphere was loud and fun -- overall great night for some Chicago pie.

Amazing, amazing, amazing. I love Chicago deep-dish pizza and I wish LA really had some awesome places to eat it at but we don't sadly. My cousins introduced me to deep dish pizza back when I first visited Illinois in 2006 and ever since then I've always wanted it in LA. This place makes just perfect pizza. Nothing else needs to be said. We sat on the second floor and had great service. I really wish they could send me some pizza right about now cause I'm really craving it. Anyways, ambiance was cool and the only thing I didn't like was the crummy Blackhawks sign when you come down the stairwell (Go Kings)..but I am in their territory so I can't be mad! Also, the painted wizard in the upstairs bathroom just adds more character to the place. I found that extremely cool too! Will be back when I'm in Chicago again.
Love the pizza here. I don't know if it was because I was ravenous or that the food was really that good but I dream of Pequod's pizza all the time!

Best deep dish in the city. If you're not from Chicago you need to come here for deep dish! If you are from Chicago you need to come here for deep dish!! I absolutely love how crunchy the caramelized crust is. They're not stingy on the toppings either! Expect a wait, but have no fear it's all worth it!
I just have to say best deep dish in Chicago  1.Pequods  2. Lou Malnati's 3. Gino's East.
OMG!  Pequod's pan pizza is so delicious!  Just be prepared to wait a little longer than expected for your food on game days. But, well worth the wait!
Went there for a final stop of a pub crawl. Service was fun and entertaining. Appetizers were good, especially the wings. Great deep dish. The cheesy  crust is one of the best. What a great spot.

I got a pizza for pick up last weekend. They open at 11am on Saturdays, but I called at 10:45 to see if I could place the order and they were ready to start taking orders. Pizza was ready at 11:30am sharp. Thanks!

I stopped in for lunch and with this being my 1st time I sorted thru the reviews to help me make my decision. I opted for the $ 4.95 lunch special that included a personal pan pizza and a soda. I had a sausage pizza which was highly recommended and added pepperoni with extra cheese. The additional toppings were extra. It came out in about 30 minutes and I was impressed with the sausage"s flavor, pepperoni was meh, extra cheese was also a good choice as always. The crust was very crispy around the edges and caramelized cheese set it the f off.

I have been to Pequod's so many times!
