This is the place to go get your pizza.  Service can be slow at times but mostly because they are always packed (which is a good sign) .They make one of the few deep dish pizza I actually like, extensive drinking menu, and TVs all around for you to follow that game you like so much.

My favorite deep dish in Chicago. The atmosphere is cozy and perfect for a pizza place. and they let you order your deep dish when you put your name in so the wait time once you sit down is minimal. Sometimes I dream about the caramelized crust...

Best deep dish pizza in the city, hands down.Get literally anything and it'll be awesome. Staff is friendly and outgoing, area is nice, upstairs seating is pretty nifty, and the food is amazing if I haven't already mentioned.I'm not even kidding... I noticed their fountain soda just tastes better than other fountain sodas. They must have a really good water purification system for making their pizza dough? Just a guess, but I bet I'm right!Oh also! If you get your pizza wrapped up to go, they put aluminum foil around it. This impressed the hell out of me because I've always done that to my pizza when I bring it home anyway. Well done Pequod's, well done.
Best deep dish in Chicago! Only slightly more amazing than lou's, because of the bubbly crispy cheese crust.
Awesome pizza i'm not a big deep dish Pearson but i love this pizza .The caramelized crust is the best .tell your friends it's the real deal.
Order the deep dish sausage pizza. They have other things on the menu, but if this is not part of your order, then don't even go here. It is sooooo good and nobody in chicago does it like them!!

At the time of this writing, Peaquod's has 1568 reviews, the majority of which are four and five stars. I doubt there's anything I can say that hasn't already been mentioned. I've heard a lot about this place from various people who claimed that it was one of the best pizza joints in the city. Today I finally tried it. You know all that hype you've heard about this place? It's all true.

I called ahead at lunch yesterday for a large pan pizza, and it was nicely packaged and piping hot 40 minutes later.  Staff was friendly.  Parking easy at lunch.  The pizza was quite good.  Not the best ever but flavorful (nice sauce and sausage).  Decent pizza.

Came in here for lunch. Had there lunch special which is a personal pizza, salad and drink for $5-6 bucks. When I came on a Friday afternoon, place was busy. Sat at the bar with some coworkers so we didn't have to wait as long. The guy at the bar was really friendly and helped us with our order. I'm from SoCal and pizza is def my favorite thing to eat so Chicago style was a must to get when in town. Thought pizza was excellent. It reminded me of what Chicago style pizza is about. This place does get crowded and service can run a little on the slow side so be prepared. Overall good experience.

Definitely a tasty deep dish spot. I wasn't thrilled with the service - it felt like it took us forever to get drinks, and then forever again to order. Once we actually got our food they were pretty attentive, though. Somewhat limited drink selection, but it's definitely worth a try!

I had always heard about Pequod's from all my friends, but never went. FINALLY, I went and had the pizza. I will have to agree with everyone that it really is great pizza! Highly recommend checking it out!
Loved this place. Have been here a couple of times. It's always crowded. Great, great pizza.

If you are in the Lincoln Park/DePaul area, you really need to check out Pequod's Pizzeria.  Until yesterday, I've never been but some friends were hungry after seeing a move at the Regal Webster Place 11 (which is across the street) and they have been here several times,When you approach this "hole-in-the-wall" pizzeria, you may want to walk right past it since it's among other stores.  Once inside, you'll be "greeted" by the "self- important" hostess.   We were seated at a great table by the door - no big deal.  It was a great table to watch people and watch sports on the many tvs.The restaurant is long and narrow with plenty of booths and small tables for two.  Towards, the back by the kitchen, there were larger tables that could be larger groups - not to large.  The bar was also very accessible for those waiting for a table.  I could image this place get packed on the weekends.The server was very pleasant and very inattentive.  Never overbearing.  Yes, the servers wear sports shirts or t-shirts but it fit in the atmosphere, which is very casual, sports bar, family neighborhood place.  I noticed a lot of carry outs which is a good sign.For as steady as the restaurant was, the pizzas came to our table in a reasonable amount of time.  My buddies had the deep dish with just about everything on it and I had the thin crust with pepperoni which was excellent!  The deep dish looked just as good and as much as they ate, it must have been also good.   The sauce was just right...not to spicy and not overbearing.  Looking forward trying the deep dish next time.The prices are very reasonable for the area.So if you are the neighborhood, I would highly recommend that you check this place out!

Best pizza on the universe - this place is no joke.As a Chicago native (and pizza lover) transplanted to the west coast, any time a friend is headed to Chicago and asks me where to eat this is where I send them.  This is not your touristy Gino's, Uno, Lou Malnati's type pizza - this is a legit locals only spot.
PIZZA.IS.DELICIOUS. don't be tempted by apps just go for the pizza!!!! :heart:
Pequod's to me is the real authentic CHICAGO deep dish pizza!!! The caramelized crust is to die for! Absolutely a must for those people looking to eat the best of the best deep dish!

A virgin to Chiciago's deep dish pizza, I was thoroughly impressed - almost. The almost is that I'd recommend they serve sides of sauce to dip the extra thick crust in. But, that's just my own personal preference. Expect  to wait at least 45 minutes when ordering a deep-dish pizza (it just takes awhile to bake) but expect to fill your stomach with one epic slice! (maybe two if you're really hungry!) The crush is absolutely amazing. At first glance it looks burnt, but, oh so good! This place is popular so if you time it right you may be seated right away, otherwise you are probably looking at a 1-2 hour wait, especially on a weekend.The ambiance is a darker and slightly loud setting with dark wood tables and a "bar like" feel to it. Overall a casual, young, trendy and fun for all ages restaurant. The service was smooth and friendly.
Best deep dish in Chicago if you like crust more than sauce. Their crust is soft and crunchy... It's really good!

These guys do deep dish right! I got the personal size pizza with pepperoni and olives. After I ordered, I feared they would overdo it with the olives like some places, but they keep the olives to a moderate amount. The crust! It was amazing. The carmelized cheese was delicious and the pizza in general was solid.

Although it's a bit different from your traditional Chicago style deep dish, Pequods pan pizza is my favorite when I am craving pizza.  The way they sprinkle the crust with cheese to create the burnt cheese on the edge of the crust is unique and delicious.  They have great appetizers - wings are solid.  Stop by the Drinkingbird if there is a long line on the weekends, it's the bar right near it which is awesome as well.If I could eat Pequod's every day and not get fat I would do it without thinking twice.Lately we have been getting pinapple, onion, and canadian bacon.  In the past I usually stuck to sausage, spinach and mushroom.  Yum.

One of my favorites in the city for sit down real pizza in the pan type of place. Love the food, hate the wait. This is beyond good pizza and a rare take on a crust. You need to try it to understand. You should give this at least one try and you will be hooked - pepperoni is the best! Like Gino's East but better! Great service but can be very long wait for a table - call ahead to check on wait time no reservations accepted on some nights. Forget a game night service will lack. Parking is tough, they have a location in Morton Grove which is even a longer wait but easier parking.
Pequod's is the only "pan" pizza my family eats, definitely a landmark restaurant!
Pequod's is super loud and incredibly busy, but it's worth it. Their pizza is my favorite in the city known for stuffed pizza.

BEST pizza in Chicago hands down. It's the perfect combination between thin and the traditional deep dish Chicago pizza, it's a not too thick pan style pizza with crunchy cheese melted on the crust. It's pure perfection. Add meatballs to your pizza, you won't be disappointed!
Not deep dish pizza but the best pan pizza you are going to get in the area. The lunch special is the ways to go.

I am a huge fan of deep dish and this spot is one of the best in Chicago.A lot of deep dish places in the city are chains, even some of the best ones, but this one is not which gives it a ton of street cred.Lets start with their crust, a very important part of any pizza, especially deep dish.It's amazing. It's thinner than most and although it may look burnt it's actually just blackened with tons and tons of flavor so don't skip eating it.The cheese, sauce, and pepperoni (the last pizza I got from here) blended together in a perfect mix of flavors and textures that only deep dish could.Their ingredients taste fresh and are very flavorful. Some of the better pepperoni I have had in my life.Will order from here again, guaranteed.

You can't beat their deep dish. My favorite deep dish pizza for sure. When my manfriend lived in Chicago, I would beg to go to this place! It's always packed, so you order your pizza, and then when it's ready, they seat you. It's somewhat chaotic sometimes, but grab a beer and relax! :-) Even though you don't get seated till the pizza is done, it's always piping hot!

Definitely the best Chicago style pizza I've had. Something about that cheesy caramelized dough that gets all crispy and wonderful. Also, one of the best lunch deals ever, if you've got the time to spare. Can't speak to more than the lunch portion of pizza, but why should I need to? This is a Chicago pizza place, and that's what they do and they do it really well. My go to is extra cheese and extra sauce, can't go wrong.

Pequot's makes me want to go back to Chicago!!!! When I visited Chicago we asked every uber/lyft/local from Chicago where the best deep dish pizza was and everyone geared us toward Lou Malnati's or Giordano's Pizzeria. So we tired all of them and hands down Pequot's was the best deep dish in Chicago!!!! loved it!

The meatballs were amazing on this pan dish pizza. The crust was extremely buttery and cheesy, however, I do prefer a deep dish pizza as opposed to the pan pizza that they have here, it's just all about preference.  It was a nice change especially as I pigged out on Chicago deep dish pizzas for about 3-4 weekends in a row.  Don't judge!  ;P

Yes. Best pizza in Chicago. Its a hike from a train station, but the whole walk back I'm thinking, "that was delicious." Not that I sit around talking about food with my friends often, but Pequods is a regular topic of conversation among a group of friends I have.

On my visit to Chicago I made it my business to try every single deep dish pizza there is. Pequod's takes the prize. Skip the others - this is the deep dish that you want!My bartender also made my jack and coke pretty strong, so there's another plus.

I was told by a local restaurant owner (not pizza) that no one in Chicago eats deep dish pizza. That it's only there for the tourists. That might be true, but I was a tourist at the moment. I arrived at Pequod's at 11:30am on a weekday and this place was packed within 40 minutes. This was exactly what I was looking for coming to town to experience some local pizza. I love deep dish, well I love pizza and deep dish being a type. Pequod's is everything. The slightly dive bar ambiance and awesome staff add to it's brilliance. The brilliance being their pizza. Perfect quantity and flavored sauce balances the amount of cheese on the pie. The cheese is brought right to the edge of the pan and then forms the best cheese crust around the edges. The bit everyone wants from the lasagna pan. This touch was so great I ate these slices sideways. Adding to the balance was the crunchy crust slightly between the famous places in town holding this beast up. Perquod's is really how I would like to eat for a visit. Something that is authentic; place, people and food. I wish I had more time and appetite to have sought out more of these types of places while in town, but there is always next time. Pequod's will keep me coming back.

Pretty darn good deep dish if you ask me! I've been to Gino's as well but I think this place takes the cake. The burned cheese is everything that a cheese lover such as myself could ask for, and the staff is friendly and very well versed in the pizza cutting world.
best pizza and hang out place . best place to invite your out of state visitors to try Chicago style pizza .

Best pizza in the city. Hands down. Deep dish, thin crust, you name it. Some people complain about the wait but honestly, there wouldn't be a wait if it wasn't worth it. Atmosphere in the restaurant itself is old school Chicago. Great for delivery or dine-in. Quality sauce, quality toppings...this is it if you're coming to Chicago looking for a good pie.
THE BEST PAN PIZZA IN CHICAGO!!!(or deep dish if you think it's deep dish, but really it's pan)Caramelized cheese crust is all i need to say.

This is one of the best pizza places in Chicago.  The place is always busy so show up early to get your name in.I would say pass on the appetizers.  the appetizers are bar quality, but the pizza definitely makes up for it!

Even though Lou's just opened a new location in my hood (Lincoln Square), my first love will always be Pequod's! I wish they took reservations so I could better plan around movie start times across the street, but I'll always return for the za!

Unlike many places around the city, this place is completely worth the wait (or ordering from home and having it delivered). Skip the touristy places like Uno, Due, Malnati's, and Gino's (unless you like 2" thick gummy dough). Great beer, great staff (sometimes caddy, sometimes straight to the point), and, of course, amazing pizza.
Best deep dish in Chicago! The ingredients are super fresh! The waiters are hottttt. The cheesy crust is bomb. Go there.
they sat a party of 3 before us even though we saw that party walk in and request their buzzer... even though we were there 1st... need to keep their buzzers functioning.

Best. Pizza. In. Chicago! The sausage and deep dish is a must. I used to think Lou Malnati's was king, but every reign has its end. Side note: Giordanos is not even top 5 compared to Pequods deep dish. The sauce and carmelized crust at Pequods is beyond this galaxy. *** lunch special which consists of a personal deep dish and soft drink is only $5! Unreal GO!

It's my first time in Chicago by way of San Francisco and my girlfriend found this place on yelp. Gotta say, this pizza is HELLA bomb. Definitely set the standard for Chicago style deep dish pizza. GO GIANTS/49ERS/WARRIORS/SHARKS....hehe :D

Great deep dish! Our waitress was super unfriendly which is the reason no 5 stars. Also, we had a reservation but we still has to wait 20 minutes. Be careful of you have a show to get to because the pizzas take an hour to be made. Delicious though if you like deep dish.

MMM mmmm! Finally came here after hearing about it from lots of people- it hasn't disappointed. I have only had the pan pizza- and that cheese crust is SO good. Service can be slow but my husband and I have taken to calling in our order ahead which speeds up the process a bit. Overall we've never had a bad pizza there. It can get crowded so try to call in for a table. Lots of TVs if you want to watch a game. Pequods has turned into our deep-dish default pizza place (and we do Piece when we want thin crust!).

One of the best pizza pies I've had in a really long time! It's in-between deep dish and thin crust, of course more thick than thin. Their sauce and toppings were excellent but the crust steals the show!

If you're not into the really saucy stuffed pies like at Giordanos and Pizzeria Uno/Duo, this is a great deep dish pizza! The dough is fluffy and tasty, and the toppings are excellent!The appetizers were normal run of the mill fried bar foods, and the drinks were standard. Overall the atmosphere is solid and the place appears to be able to accommodate decent large groups.

Pizza was fabulous!  I could've eaten 300 slices, but settled for the individual pie.  Service was incredibly slow, but perhaps this was because we were the only party upstairs and they forgot about us?  It's ok, I won't hold a grudge because the pizza is so damn good.  I also enjoyed watching the Olympics on the several HD flat screens they have hanging throughout the joint.
The best deep dish in the city! Be prepared to wait for a table but it's worth it.

$5 for a deep dish pizza lunch! Perfect crunch. There was a good amount of sauce and cheese. It is definitely fresh pizza so its a pretty long wait. It was a good 25 minutes before the pizzas came out.

Was surprised by my boyfriend with a night at Pequod's. Had the deep dish which was amazing. The carmelized cheese from the seasoned pans was so delicious. The staff was courteous and extremely professional. Everyone was smiling - employees and customers! Can't wait to go back.

I waited almost two hours to eat at this place, AND IT WAS WORTH IT.My Chicago friend warned me that this place could have crazy lines, but I was all like "Worse lines than NYC? Psh, Impossible!" Nope. Definitely possible. There was a Blackhawks game on and the place was packed. We had some beers at the bar and put in our order with the hostess stand; the pizzas take like 30-45 minutes to make, so it's smart to put in an advance order.This was my first authentic Chicago-style pizza (Uno's doesn't count), and it's enough to make me question Jon Stewart's epic NYC-versus-Chicago-Deep-Dish rant. Maybe it IS an above-ground marinara swimming pool, but encased into an impossibly crispy pan crust and loaded down with so much cheese and sausage and olives and mushrooms. Quite the dramatic presentation when the server thunks it down on the table. A small pizza was too much food for the two of us. I still dream about this place.
My favorite Chicago Pan Pizza! Yum! Crust melts in your mouth. Fresh delicious toppings and cold beer!

Went a few months back and never got around to reviewing.Probably the best pizza I've ever had and I've had most of them.  The restaurant was really cool.My only disclaimer is that if you don't like things a little burnt, this may not be your favorite pizza.  The cheese is burnt, er I mean 'caramelized'.  But I love that.

Definitely worth the (probably insane) wait to get a table. The pizza is delicious and so much better than other places. I love the carmelized cheese crust. Plus, it's across the street from the Webster Place theater, so it's great to go out for pizza and a movie.

Hands down, this is the BEST PIZZZA IN CHICAGO. Don't let anyone tell you different. I always bring out of town guests here to have a true pizza experience that can't be found anywhere else. The pizzas are well worth the wait, and the crust is a sure fire winner.
wow. the deep dish is really something to write home about the front of house staff is pretty crappy though
Great place - authentic Chicago deep dish!Really nice place to chill out on the weekends.

Pequod's has my favorite chicago style pizza. Their crust is perfection. It's buttery and light without being soggy which I often find to be a problem with some deep dish pizzas. The servers are great and friendly. On one occasion I did run into a host that seemed to be a bit of a ditz but besides that, the service is good.

While visiting Chicago I asked a group Chicago's best (under cover police) who had the best deep dish pizza in the city - Pequod's!  I was not disappointed. Service was good and the sauce had a great flavor.

The only thing that makes this pizza good is the carmelized edge.  Other than that it's like eating a big doughy cake disguised with cheese and red sauce.  They did put up with us tourists changing our reservation multiple times, so extra points for their patience.

I ordered a 12 inch Peperoni & onion pan pizza. The crust is really thick and tastey. The 12 inch is the perfect size for two hungry people...just enough for leftovers :P only downside was that we had to wait an hour and fifteen minutes but it was so good and so worth the wait! You know what they say.. you have to wait for the best things in life amirite?! FIVE STARS! Go pequods!
My favorite deep-dish Pizza. The sausage is the way to go. Plus it's nice that they will deliver both to my work and home... neither of which are exactly close to the restaurant.
Great thin crust pizza. Fresh toppings love the sausage.  I personally dont recommend the  deep dish tho..

I'm from the east coast, so clearly I think you all are weird neophytes for thinking pie is pizza. However, Pequod's is the absolute best, and I refuse to let weird pie you people call pizza pass my lips unless it is from Pequod's.

Best deep dish pizza in Chicago. Best part is the crust.Most after midnight pizza places are horrendous, this place has amazing deep dish pizza. I've ordered after 1am before and the quality is on point.I am kind of bummed I don't live in Chicago to order a pie right now!
My favorite pizza! :)

Great pizza near the wrigleyille area. The best part of this pizza is the crust, they cook it till it Browns on top I think it's the cheese crusting on it but it's sop good. In comparison to the other Chicago pizza I have had on my vacation, this place is less cheese than Giordano's, peqouds is more tomato saucy. The crust is crispy that other places but has a sweet taste similar to Gino's East. I definitely recommend trying this place. It's also a chill bar to drink in and watch a game. It's a Blackhawks bar.
Not much else to say other than best deep dish in Chicago! This is where I take friends and family visiting Chicago to get pizza. Can't beat that caramelized crust!

Well it's official I have a new favorite Chicago deep dish pizza and it's Pequods!Every place claims to have the best deep dish pizza in Chicago, but there can only be one winner and that winner is Pequods. I came here with my girlfriend and we got a deep dish pizza with sausage and giardiniera that was simply amazing.This place is well worth the wait and I guarantee you will not be disappointed in Pequods deep dish pizza!

Gets busy and the pan pizzas take time so plan ahead. I like the option to do toppings to just half of the pizza to get variety. We opted for Canadian bacon and pineapple on one side, and pepperoni and green peppers on the other side. The crust is Carmelized and so so good. We ordered a medium which was 6 huge slices. It was way too much. I'd like to come back and try the thin crust. That looked good also. Service was friendly.
Good pizza. Love the lunch special. Love the burnt cheese crust.Art C

WOW is all I can say. This place is amazing. I grew up in Chicago and have had pizza from all the best places, at least I thought so until last night. We had a small group of 3 couples and everyone (2 Canadians and 4 Chicagoans) thought this was the best pizza we have ever had.  We tried a Deepdish and a thin crust. While I prefer a thinner, thin crust the crust was amazing. The deep dish had the caramelized crust which was a first for us all, and we thought it was really good.Our server was just as good as the pizza, friendly and attentive.
My favorite deep dish pizza in the city, hands down. The burnt crust is actually perfection. It takes awhile for delivery, but it is well worth it.

Pequod's was some of the best deep dish pizza i've ever had - they load on toppings. We got mozzarella sticks and cheesy bread as an app (both average) and then a few deep dish pizzas. We got a veggie pizza and a pepperoni pizza - both were so good I could have killed myself by eating too much. Thankfully I finally stopped but I definitely want to go again!
Terrific deep dish pizza! We were seated immediately and the pizza didn't take too long to come out. Great service as well. Fun place on game nights!

Excellent, excellent pizza. The sausage is to die for. The restaurant is busy and it will take some time for your food. Luckily, they have Goose Island Green Line on tap to help you pass the time. The pizza is very filling, I'd suggest not filling up on Appetizers before hand. They will happily box up leftovers, and proper Chicago pizza  should always be reheated in an oven, not the microwave! Highly recommended, just try to avoid the busiest times.

Came to Chicago to stuff my face and see the sights and ended up in flavor town.I'd heard about this spot and had to give it try since they specifically bake it with cheese on top to give it a nice crunch! I made the long trek from Millennium Park ( yes, i was being touristy...sue me :P ) to a neighborhood that put the urban in suburban and plopped my hungry hungry hippo a$$ down in this bad boy.  My friend and I were immediately greeted by a cute waitress and offer drinks (+1) We ordered up some some local brews and and a shared a medium Pepperoni, Sausage, & Mushroom pie. Th wait was about 20 minutes, in the meantime we watched as local after local came through, and perused their decor. Cools dive bar-ish like feel without the same crowd..and smell ^.^ The pizza was came out piping hot and overloaded with toppings! The real coup de grace was the delectable crispity crunchy blackened lasagna-like (in a good way!!) cheesy crust!I wolfed down 3 slices and called it quits...I would have loved to sit around for another beer or two and finish off the rest, but all good things must come to an end. Plus I had reservations for L20, but that's a different story and review all together.

I can't believe the wait time for this place. I used to come here back in the day and be seated immediately for my deep dish cravings. Regardless, it's the only place I'll come for deep dish when visiting Chicago. I think their service is really great for how swamped they are on a consistent basis. Their appetizers aren't much to write home about - but I'll usually get the fried zucchini so I can nosh on something while I wait 50 minutes for my Pizza.

Moving cross country from Philly to Seattle,  passing through Chicago and per the previous reviews decided to stop here for deep dish - and it did not disappoint. Simple pepperoni pie was prefect;  and Italian beef with fresh basil (ordered on a whim) was delicious. I could not grant the final star, because of the wait staff.  Impersonal,  inattentive,  and  unknowledgeable (about the freshness/quality of ingredients)... overall poor individual job done.If anyone for the establishment is reading,  please note: Iced tea should be more than just brown-colored water.
The best Chicago-style pizza I've had yet.. this is where I bring my visitors from out of town!

Was visiting Chicago for the first time and of course needed to try some deep dish pizza. We got a recommendation from a local friend to check out Pequod's and it was definitely a great choice! We came in for lunch and the staff was really friendly and the service was quick. The pizza was, well, life changing. I'll be returning next time I come to Chicago!
A GREAT Pizza! The carmelized crust tastes sooo good!
Skip the chains and the pretenders.  This is the best neighborhood Chicago Pizza.

I guess it's pile on with the praise (so don't let it go to your head you guys) but man is this place fantastic. The best way to describe it is the "anti-Malnati's" The pizza is just as good (maybe even better) but the atmosphere is much less "corporate" with a well worn interior, t-shirts of the restaurant's mascot hanging for sale behind the bar (I think it's a whale, Lord I hope it's a whale because if it's not, I am officially concerned) and a straight view into the kitchen. Lou would never stand for such frivolity!I had a sausage pizza and it was awesome. Thick crust, perfectly done, with a nice layer of burnt cheese around the edge. A great tomato sauce and thick gooey cheese. Well worth the wait.The lunch special of a personal pizza and either draft beer (Bud Light) or soda for $5 is insane. Seriously what is wrong with you people!?Then again, it was the perfect ploy as I wanted to try it so I used the lunch special as my entree into Pequod's. Now I'll be back since I've tasted the cheese, saucy goodness.Well played Pequod's, well played...
I love pequods pizza... It's like Portillo's but in the pizza world! Just the best.  Love this place and had a birthday party here before upstairs.  Yeah.. it's awesome!
Contrary to what outsiders think of Chicagoans we rarely eat deep dish pizza but if we do its Pequods
Best pizza in the world. Their deep dish takes close to an hour to bake. Well worth the wait.
Don't tell the tourists about this place! Let them eat at Gino's East and Malnati's! Love it! Especially after a Blackhawks game!

Amazing deep dish pizza. If you're looking for authentic deep dish Chicago style pizza this is the place. After trying a few different pizzerias to find that authentic deep dish I have concluded this is the place. New favorite spot for pizzas when in town... Must try!

Very good pizza, always on my short list.  It is a little different from the other popular places but I love that caramelized cheesy deliciousness.  Plus I can buy it by the slice which helps when everyone likes something different.  I first enjoyed this pizza and a cocktail over 15 years ago and it is still delicious every time.
The best pizza in Chicago. I take everyone that visits  here and no one has ever been disappointed. I get take out often and the staff is rude but the pizza is so good I don't care.

Angela was our server and she was magical. I mean.. This pizza is superb but our service was awesome and it's because of Angela (upstairs, not to be confused with Angela downstairs). Much love for the good vibes
Best pizza in the city, hands down. The burnt cheese crust is unique and delicious. Go for the pepperoni with giardiniera.

The deep dish was good and one of the places that serve the freshly made pizza right from the grill.The pizza was soft and well done. One of the few places that makes the best deep dish pizza.But the service is too slow. Other than that, the place was dim and loud.
Excellent deep dish as a first timer. Blackened crust is different but I enjoyed it. Packed place on a Sat evening but hey if you make a good pizza people are going to want it!

There are a lot of great pizza places but I believe Pequod's Pizza stands above all others. Although the bottom of the pizza seemed little undercooked, its golden-brown crust was incredibly delicious. I can definitely eat Pequod's crust as a meal. It is true that if you want to have quote few number of toppings, it can get quite expensive. However, it is worth it. Go ahead and order a large pizza for you and your date, enjoy the best-pizza-in-Chicago, and take the leftovers home! Even the leftovers taste great (make sure to use an convection oven).

There is no other deep dish pizza in Chicago as far as I'm concerned. Sooooo good. I love that cheese you'll keep reading about in reviews, the only thing is, every great once in a while me and the boyfriend have a taste for thin crust. Not the biggest fans of their thin crust pie here....it's not nasty, just the thin crust pie I like is the real thin type with big air bubbles in the crust like say, Piece's thin crust.All in all though, there is NO OTHER, NO BETTER deep dish pizza in Chicago, hell in THE WORLD!!!!
Best chicago style deep dish in city.  The crust is unbelievable with a carmelized cheese bubbling over.  Great  lunch special!

Pequod's wasn't on my list to vist for my trip to Chicago, but my brother who visited pior highly recommended and commented that this is worth making trip and this is the best pizza he has had in his life. So, I had high expectations. After a 1 hr and 10 mins wait, we finally got our table. We ordered an appetizer combo while we wait an hour for our pizza to bake. The appetizer was very mediocre. After what seems like forever since it was past 9pm already, our pizza finally got to our table. We got a large pan pizza with mushroom, italian beef, and pepperoni topping. The portion was plenty for 4 people. Everyone was stuffed. The crust was delicious. Nothing like what I've eaten before. The first few bites were very good, but it got really salty after the first few bites. It was likely because the pepperoni that was piled on. There was at least 2 layers of pepperoni. If only there was less, maybe I would've gave it a 5 star. Service was very good. The waitress checked up on us very often and was a delight.

Pequods is the bomb. Their deep dish is one of the best the city has to offer-the burnt cheesy crust makes it, and the tomato sauce---yummmm! Family loves pepperoni/sausage combo. Thin crust is also good if that's what you're in the mood for but the deep dish at Pequods is what's up. Haven't tried anything else so I can't review any other food items.

I'm from NYC and I had my fair share of pizza. This is my first time having deep dish pizza. We added pepperoni and mushrooms as toppings, which made the pizza more delicious. The pizza is good, but I definitely prefer thin crust than the thick crust. I recommend trying this place out if you're ever going to Chicago.
Better than Giordanos. The crust is pretty heavenly but next time I'll get extra sauce and cheese. Best deep dish I've had in Chicago thus far.

First off, either make a reservation or get here before 6. They fill up real fast. Secondly, GET THE PIZZA! Thirdly, make sure you try it with meatballs. Holy crap, were they great! Having been to Giordanos, UNOs, the best part about Pequods is that there is only one location.

Now, I must admit I was rather drunk upon arriving here....at 4pm, however the pizza was great and helped soak up a lot of alcohol. The service was quick and the staff were nice. The pizza was damn right deep and tasted great. I'd recommend if you are in the neighbourhood, if not, get some bikes (sober) or a cab (which are cheap in Chicago) for a thick slice.

The beef sandwich combo with sausage, cheese, peppers and garlic toast was awesome.  Deep dish was better than Giordanos and Lou Malnatis. Lou's butter crust is better but overall this place was top notch.

Wow!  The pizza is awesome!  I have turned on many friends and family to this place.  The pizza is well done and buttery/carmelized which I like.  A must try for anyone visiting Chicago.  I have been to both Clybourn and The Loop location, both are fun!
Pequod's is amazing. Perfect crust, not too doughy like some others, probably my #2 favorite pizza place in Chicago. Worth a try!

Stop acting like a misguided tourist by going to those "other" pizza places. THIS IS CHICAGO DEEP DISH! But in all seriousness you will not regret it! The pizza is a perfect ratio of cheese, sauce, and that sweet sweet caramelized crust. The rest of the menu beyond the pizza is rather average, but let's be honest if you're ordering something other than pizza you're doing it wrong.

Solid deep dish. Their caramelized crust is the best! Also, they have a really great lunch special (monday-friday) where you can get a personal pan pizza and a beer for $4.95. They are also open really late at night and have plenty of upstairs seating.
Best deep dish in Chicago in my opinion. Definitely better than Giordano's, Lou's or Pizano's.
Best pizza in town! Anyone visiting, its a must!! Can get a little annoyingly packed. But thats just a sign of a great product.
amazing caramelized crust on their deep dish. Should be the new 'Chicago' staple. I now bring out of town guests here instead of the Lou's, because it's just better. it is.

THE BEST deep dish in Chicago. Skip the chain restaurants and come here. Get there early though and you can wait up to 2.5-3 hours to eat (unlike the chain places, they don't let you preorder your pizza).
I love Pequots so much!  Best Pizza in Chicago hands down.  The crust is so good and the ingredients are so fresh!

Pequod's has been my favorite Chicago pizza for quite some time, but tonight's visit was exceptional thanks to our server. Halfway through our meal my mom and I actually both said how much we liked her - she was personable, kind, and cheerful which goes a long way. On top of that, she bought us our dinner for no reason other than to spread some smiles! I will ABSOLUTELY be paying this forward and hope I can brighten someone else's day the way she brightened ours. Thank you, Romi!
Best deep dish I've had in Chicago. Better than Gino's and Malnatis. Immediate seating on a Sunday afternoon for 3 people.
deep dish peperoni is as good as it gets!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
The caramelized cheese crust is awesome but has high variance in delivery quality.  Sometimes crust can be soggy other times it is great.
Worth the wait! The pan style pizza is amazing. Takes about 30-45min to make but it comes out with the most delicious bubbly carmalized crust.  Great for take out or dine in.

As an appetizer we ordered the fried zucchini.  It came with ranch sauce and the combination was delicious!!We also ordered the pan pizza with sausage, mushroom and onion.  The pieces of sausages on our pizza were huge!  While many yelpers raved of the caramelized crust, I was not a fan of it.  The crust looked more black and burnt than caramelized to me. No thanks.  The bottom of the crust was more bread like (fluffy) and not crispy than what I've had from other pizzerias.However, service was top notch. Everyone was very friendly. We were checked up upon multiple times by multiple people.  Since this pizzeria is a little out of the way for me, I don't think I will be visiting again for a while.

Best deep dish in Chicago, and one of the Chicago spots I miss most since moving out west.  It takes forever, as good deep dish tends to, but Pequod's takes waiting to another level. Luckily there are some ways to get around this: a) arrive early, or go on a weeknight; or if there's a wait, put your name in and b) head to the co-owned bar up the street for drinks and appetizers or c) hang by the bar in Pequod's and grab a brew while you wait.  I've done both b) and c) and recommend b) because you can actually sit down, and the wait can stretch up to 2hrs. After you brave the gauntlet of waiting, being seated, and deciding what you want to order, the pizzas are hefty and delicious--two mediums will feed four hungry adults and there will still likely be leftovers. It's not a sports bar but there are some TVs which was great for watching the Cubbies in the NLDS one night I went. Love Pequod's!

Yaas, finally some outstanding deep dish!  I had the Pequod salad and the personal pan deep dish with sausage and pepperoni and both were amazing!!!  I live nowhere near this place but I'll drive the 35 min one way to eat it!  Definitely a must if your looking for good deep dish Chicago style pizza!

THIS IS HANDS DOWN THE BEST DEEP DISH PIZZA EVER!!!My boyfriend and I  was on a mission to find the best pizza in Chicago! Our friends recommended trying Lou Malnati's so we went to Pequod's first thinking we would save the best for last. Well let me tell you PEQUOD's was the best we've ever had! We are from Los Angeles so we dont mind waiting in line to be seated. The wait was about 30mins, not too bad. We ordered the deep dish with Sausage, Pepperoni and Mushrooms.  It was the biggest sausages we've seen on a pizza! This place out beats all the places in Los Angeles and everywhere else! The sauce / cheese everything was sooo good and fresh!! I'm getting hungry just thinking about it. YOU HAVE TO TRY THIS PLACE IF YOU'RE IN CHICAGO!!! TOTALLY WORTH IT!!!

Best deep dish pizza ever! Nothing compares, especially when you dine-in (rather than carry-out). I don't think they have very good apps or a salad, and the thin isn't very good either, but they still get 5 stars because the deep dish is incredible. They really should improve the quality of their other offerings

U gotta go!!!! Best pizza , how is this possible when there giordano and Gino east in town. Affordable and local place. Take an uber driver there. Ordered individual deep pan. Great to do when you don't want to share.
Forget Lou, forget Giordano, go to Pequod.It is definitely the best deep dish pizza of Chicago.

Pizza is great, as per usual. Be forewarned, you'll need to set aside a MINIMUM of two hours to eat here at any point after 5:30p. Even if they tell you that the pizza is a 40 minute bake time, plan on them suddenly adding 20-30 minutes to that.
Great tasting pan or deep dish pizza, while we didn't have the thin crust, I'm sure it would be just as good.  Would certainly be back.

I feel terrible for cheating on my beloved Gino's east.  But, alas it had to be done.Pequods for sure is by far the BEST DEEP DISH pizza in Chicago...well...ok its as good as Gino's East.  I love the spinach and garlic, it's amazing.Definitely has a decent crowd, went on a weeknight and it was great.Also has pretty cool lunch specials for anyone thats in the area that can stop by for lunch...Great Beer list as well.Dessert...meh..go somewhere else (they get it from a bakery anyway...the carrot cake...not the best just fyi)...and service is pretty awesome.will be back for sure!
Friendly staff, quick deep dish, and great atmosphere. A True Chicago pizzeria,
So delicious! Their lunch special is every college student's dream.

The first time I came here I made the mistake of not making a reservation. We ended up waiting upwards of two hours for a table. Since then, I've learned that they do take reservations! Amazing. Another tip-- even after you make a reservation you should call about an hour before you get there to start your pizza. The pizzas take a long time to cook, so this will get the za on your table soon after you arrive. The pizza itself is delicious. The sauce is the best! The crust and base are breadier than Lou Malnati's but not as bready as Giordano's.

The caramelized cheese on the crust for the pan pizza is magical. This is one of the best pies in Chicago. Absolutely delicious. Pequod's delivers. And that is fantastic. However, the problem is that they take this magical pizza and put it in a styrofoam clamshell and then put that clamshell in a plastic bag, which they tie tightly at the top. By the time you get the delivery, it is a soggy mess inside a plastic bag wet with condensation. I've asked them to simply box the pizza, but they won't. I'd eat here every week if they could deliver me a pizza in a box rather than a steam bath. Don't get delivery. But DEFINITELY go there and get this pizza. It is incredibly delicious.

If you're deciding on where to get pizza, THIS IS THE PLACE! Ive had everything from the thin crust pizza for an appetizer to party sized three appetizers and their famous pan pizza for dinner. Being a picky person I've never had a complaint. Although I'm out of their delivery area I still pick up all the time. The wait is worth it, after all it takes some time to bake such an amazing pizza, wouldn't expect anything less.

If  Michelangelo (Ninja Turtles) could write a review about pizza this would be one of them. Where to begin? I have been going to Pequod's for the past 10 years.  I love two types of pizza Thin Crust and Pan.  This review is based on Pan pizza. Nowhere have I tried a better Pan pizza other than Pequod's. Their Thin crust pizza is not as great as their Pan,  I would say mediocre to any other Mom and Pops shop.  Moving forward with their Pan pizza you can expect a HIT OR A MISS. By this I mean they're not always consistent. I've been going to this place so often that I know when they get their ingredients right on cue. Sometimes, they add too much cheese, other times they overwhelm you with water down sauce. Even so, when they do get it right all I could say is COWABUNGA! The infused  burned cheese with the sweet crunch crust touching that flavorful tomato sauce that makes my friend Leonardo scream WICKED AWESOME! Moving forward, this place can get hectic. Every time I go I always have hours to spare so I don't mind the wait.  Having some beers while waiting is the norm. Appetizers are 7/10 nothing special, but great to kill some time. I rather stick to the pizza and beers. Staff are most of the time attentive. I see how they can become agitated by all the customers, but work with them and they'll work with you. Like I said if you come to this place don't expect to have that perfect pan pizza all the time. I heard from friends that their second location is better than the Chicago location. Can't say for sure. All I can say for this location is that  if they happen to get it right "Bravo" you have finally tried a bite of heaven my friend.
Fernald location is the only one I've been to. Fresh ingredients and crispy crust...I dream of this pizza.

LOVE this place!! Easily one of my favorite pizza joints in Chicago. I live and die by Lou Malnati's, but this is a solid alternative if I don't feel like waiting 2 hours to dine in. Probably some of the best Chicago style pizza I've ever had; their toppings are high-quality, and the crust isn't too dense or bogged down with too much sauce/toppings. I LOVE their sausage pizza, and I always order it with the giardiniera, which tastes awesome! Laid back dining in environment, and friendly staff. Good place to catch a Hawks game over a good pizza and some beers. Highly recommend it!!

Spinach, tomato, and garlic on a pan pizza is the best!Yes, I said it.  No meat, just a good veg deep dish - notice the lack of onions?  the lack of olives or any such unnecessary "ingredients"?  Pequod's makes an amazing deep dish, and if you want to get a good pie without feeling like you overdid it, go veg.  Drink a beer, wine, or soda and be happy.  I can honestly say, I've never been disappointed with the food here.

If there was only a way to give this 10 stars I would.  While I get my fair share of eye rolling from other Chicago-style pizza lovers, THIS is my favorite deep dish in town.  The sauce...  The crust...I probably eat here once a month and would go more if my wallet and waistline would allow it.  Tuesdays are my favorite night to go, because you can grab a pie (I'd suggest calling ahead and having them start it if you're in a rush--it is deep dish after all) then go see a 1/2 price movie at the Regal on Webster right across the street.  They also have a very respectable craft beer selection.  I wish they had more specials, but lets be serious, I'm definitely going to come here anyway.

My friends and I ordered two medium pan pizzas for the 5 of us (3 guys and two girls) and it was the perfect portion - the server gave a great recommendation.Overall, the pizza was very good but the "caramelized crust" I've heard raved about translates to "burnt cheese". Now, call me crazy but I liked burnt cheese (and so did others with me) so we didn't mind so much, but others may. Good amount of cheese + sauce + toppings. I took away a star mostly because it seems as though they are trying to copy Lou Malnati's butter crust, but it's not quite there that the flavor falls flat. Chicago style pizza is all about the crust and if you mess that up, it's kind of a fail. I would probably order Lou's over this, but wouldn't hate going back either.
IfYou wantPizza Cake(i.e. deep dish)Then caramelized crust coma it is. Yum.

The pizza is really good, and they are a Hawks bar, so there is Blackhawks swag everywhere which is nice. Is it worth waiting outside in line for? No, probably not. But if you happen to drive by and there's no line, you should totally check this place out.
Great Pizza and Cool Environment. Great place to catch up with friends and enjoy some really good food and cold beer!
Since I was a kid this is my fav pizza place in the city over Lous for sure! Always willing to accommodate us and so great to their guests!

I know, this is one of those hyped up Chicago pizza joints and you probably have your own secret neighborhood spot that's waaaayyyy better... Am I right?  Get over it.  Sure this is somewhat touristy, but you know what, it's good. If you're willing to put up with a long wait to get in and then an equally long wait for them to cook the pizza, then this isn't a bad option for you.  Great sauce, awesome caramelized cheese crust, big portions, but I never walk away feeling overly full.  The sausage is delicious. It's also not that greasy which is a bonus for me. Unfortunately the service last time was a little hit or miss. We showed up with a group of 5 around 4:30 and they clearly didn't know how to handle it. Two tables pushed together?  Cram us in a big booth?  They couldn't figure it out. They decided to make us wait 10 minutes until they decided on a table. It was a bit ridiculous considering the place wasn't even that crowded yet. All that aside this is a good pizza spot and I'll be back.
Good pizza, certainly earns four stars!!!
Pequod's makes a delicious pan pizza! A 'must visit' for the Za Connoisseur.  Cheers Pequod's!

We ordered Pequod's for delivery after a recommendation from a friend. I'm not usually a review person, but I was so impressed I had to write one for this place! I'm reeeeeaaallly picky about my pizza--I hate thin crust and Chicago-style deep dish usually makes me sick. Pequod's pan pizza was a perfect medium. We ordered a plain ol' pepperoni for our first try, and it was literally what you think of when you think of Pizza, all cheesy, hot, and delicious. Plus, they initially told us an hour and 45 minutes for delivery (nbd, Saturday night at a popular place) and they came after just over an hour with hot, fresh pizza.

The pizza is AWESOME.  We absolutely love it.  The salads are really good, too.  We usually have pretty good service but it's never spectacular.  We overlook that as their schtick and well worth it for Pequod's delicious pizza creations.I'd give the place 5 stars but they really need to clean up their act....literally.  I noticed that the bathrooms were incredibly dirty but didn't say anything about it until my partner mentioned on the way home how dirty the men's room was and that the garbage cans in the hallway to the kitchen were absolutely over-flowing.  It's a moderately busy late lunch hour.  Get one of the folks standing around to take out the freakin' trash cans!  Gross.I was also really put off when the guy up front told the hostess to seat us at "Table 12."  Table 12 is the worst table in the entire place -- it 1/2 blocks the hallway to the super hot and humid kitchen by the phone order room and bathrooms with no view of the TVs so you can really focus on the dirty bathrooms and garbage cans outside of the kitchen.  We immediately asked to be seated in one of the 6-7 open tables at the front of the house rather than the dreaded Table 12.  The crappiest tables should be used only when absolutely necessary.  If a waitress in one section is getting slammed with too many customers, they should just reconfigure the table assignments rather than have people suffer at a horrible table.  Oh, and the waitress forgot part of our order.  And, yet, we give it high marks and will still go back for the pizza....although probably not as often....and, we may do pick up or delivery instead.
That crust is the stuff of legends, and for good reason.  And delivery until 2AM doesn't hurt either.**except for my waistline, but it's so worth it

On a Bucket List tour of Chicago, so I got to try Pequod's finally! Got delivery, was totally worth it. Reminds me of what pizza hut could be if they didn't SUCK and what Noble Romans in Northern Indiana was in my childhood....Had sausage on my half. Just fantastic. Just enough cheese, maybe a TINY bit more sauce would have been good, but it wasn't dry at all like other reviewers experienced. The plain cheese was also fantastic, but the crispy, blackened cheese on the edges of the crust made it even BETTER!I am going to be so sad when I move to Nashville and there is NO GOOD PIZZA :'''(

Yes the pizza was unique and different than what I am used to having here in Chicago but I have to say that Lou's is still my favorite.The sausage had really good flavor and I enjoyed my meal, minus one star for the abrupt and kinda rude hostess ;0(

Hands down, my favorite deep dish in the city. Their wait time can be a bit annoying, but that caramelized crust is worth the wait! I always try to take out-of-town guests here because it just epitomizes Chicago.

I've been here a few times whenever I'm out in Chicago and it's hands down one of the best pan pizzas you can get in Chicago.  Special caramelized cheese crust.  The sausage is the bomb-diggity.  There's a pretty good lunch special with a Bud Lite and personal pan pizza for like 7 or 8 bucks.  But if you're here with 2 people, you may as well just get a medium pizza.Tons of TVs.  Great divey, yet family-friendly atmosphere.  Daisy Cutter on draft.  Affordable.  What more can you want?

What a hidden gem! This is in the running for best deep dish in the city. You can't beat their lunch special in the city: $4.95 for personal pizza +1 topping and a drink (including Bud Light). Staff is cool-- extremely efficient, but not pushy. I would recommend this place to everyone. P.S. Has upstairs seating that is available for private parties. enjoy!
Hands down the best pizza in Chicago! The cost is out of this world, definitely worth the long wait!

Amazing deep dish pizza here.  The place was not packed when we got there around 5, but by the time we left, there was enough of a queue.  It was worth the 45 minute wait for the pizza.  It is the only deep dish I had while in Chicago - and it was the only one I needed.  Two of us shared a medium and it was more than enough... took home some leftovers, and enjoyed the pizza cold later!Would definitely come again!

Look, we all know deep dish comes in many forms here in Chicago, and everyone has their favorite. This just happens to be mine. I love the bread/crust-forward approach, since I feel some other pies around the city are drowning in too much sauce, without good bread to back it up. The caramelization on this beast is also bomb. Doesn't get any better. And there are just enough toppings to give good flavors while still letting the bread shine. I also like the fact that it retains its unique feel, being just a humble neighborhood bar rather than one of the many chains. In the end, this joint might not become your favorite, but that's just fine with me. Helps keep the always ridiculous wait times in check.
I love this place. Now that Door Dash will deliver it to my house ( I moved out of their normal delivery zone), I eat it 2-3 times a month. Mmmmmmmm. Caramelized cheese.

Amazing food!! We got the garlic bread and two small pan pizzas - one meat and one veggie. The sausage was to die for!! Rebecca served us and was really funny and helpful. She gave us great recommendations for our stay. We'll definitely be back the next time we're in town :)

I've been to Pequod's in Morton Grove,  the individual stuffed pizza is the best!buttery crust.  The individual size is just enough for one person.  The wait service is good.  And i love the old-fashioned divvy bar.  Good beer selection, sometimes you have to wait, but worth it.

Largely considered the best deep dish in Chicago and they deliver on that thought. If you are ordering delivery give yourself plenty of time. Delivery times are around 90 minutes no matter when you order.

I am more of a thin slice pizza lover but when you are in Chicago you need eat the deep dish, and damn this was deep and delicious. I ordered a pepperoni and olive personal pizza and it blew me away. What got me was the crust which was very flavorful. Also had a decent amount of sauce on it, which was also very good.I live in Seattle and we have a Chicago Style Pizza place here. I will have to check it out and see how it compares but I do know I will have to come back when I am in Chicago again.Zipzap Zubidy Bop!

Met there with a large group of relatives for the very first time a few weeks back. (Reservation a must for a large group!) It was a little tight on space but yet still comfortable. The staff was very friendly and super accommodating. Our server was great- very on top of things and made some good recommendations. On to the pizza: delicious! My family loves a good deep dish and this did not disappoint. It's more in between a pan and deep dish. The sauce was very good, the toppings very fresh and the dough had good density. And I personally loved the burnt cheese crust, yum! I didn't try the thin crust but it looked pretty good too.We will def come back when we're in the area.
A marvelous member of the Deep Dish family - Pequod's makes a very fresh, rich pizza with the most amazing toasted-black-cheese crust. Love it every single time!

Pequod's ranks up there with Lou Malnatis or Gullivers Pizza when it comes to deep-dish pizza in Chicago.  They've got a thicker, denser, but still light and airy base crust to the pizza compared to the other deep-dish pizza places, but its easy to develop a craving for that unique texture.I've yet to venture outside my usual pepperoni-topped pizza, which comes with a few of the pieces charred to a delicious black.  They also cook the pizza long enough to crisp ("burn") some of the cheese on the edges of the crust.  I find it a delicious, salty, chewy addition to the texture of the pizza.
They now deliver all the way out to me in Logan Square!  Took awhile to get here, but it was worth it.
Very delicious! Call ahead to be placed on the top of the waitlist when you arrive. Takes a while for the food to come out but won't be disappointed! Very good!
Want some Chicago style Pizza?  I'll save you some time.  Pequod's beats Giordano's beats Lou Malnati's beats Pizzeria Uno beats Gino's East
Best pizza in Chicago. If you don't like it at first, keep coming back.  Their delivery area is SO LARGE and it takes 90 mins usually, but no pizza is better.

Best deep dish pizza in Chicago, hands down!  If you want FLAVOR, with great crust, NOT over loaded with cheese, check this place out.  The sauce is awesome not sweet, has a tang...full of flavor; the crust is sturdy and crisp on the bottom, and a soft pillow on top; not too much cheese and the cheese creeps up the the edge and caramelizes -- wow is this fantastic!  Top it with sausage and pepperoni -- yum!

I order from here often once or twice a week it's either big or a small order and Im always indecisive depending on what I'm ordering because I always get a big order for my office but I call during the day and I must say I'm absolutely always satisfied and impressed with the phone girl named (Natalie) she is so efficient and fast and knows what I want and talks to fast it's amazing (sometimes I could be a pain asking a lot of questions to help me figure out how much pizza I need) I usually never leave reviews but I order from here often and I wanted to show some love so she doesn't get unnoticed she's doing a great job her customer service is awesome, as far as pizza it's a amazing I recommend the deep dish over the thin crust I am generally not a fan of deep dish, but this pizza is a MUST! I love pequods

Best Pizza in the Chicagoland area hands down!! Always saw my friends on Facebook post pictures and statuses about how this was the best place in Chicago to get pizza. Well they were right!!Went to this place on a Saturday. And it was packed!! The restaurant itself has a bar look to it. Definitely recommend ordering pick-up or delivery unless you don't mind waiting for 30-50 minutes to be seated and then having to probably wait for your pizza. Overall the pizza hit the spot! I definitely will come back and order from this place for future pizza cravings. Forget that weak stuff like Papa Johns.

I have criss-crossed this great nation, sampling the local varieties. I lived for a year in Italy. I eat pizza a lot. This is my favorite pizza.This is not "Chicago-style Pizza", though it is Pizza from Chicago.This is the Cadillac of Pizzas. It takes a super long time to cook and the lines at Pequod's are always horrendous, so it is not the pizza that I eat most often. But it is the pizza that I dream about most often. (side note, italian pizza is really great, and may be the "original" or whatever, but the spirit of America is progress, and Pequod's is progress)

There's simply no other choice where pizza is concerned. I'm a devoted crust-first kind of girl, but this caramelized crust is SERIOUS, enough to make me reconsider my stance. My go-to is sausage and spinach, a truly glorious combination. One or two pieces will fill you up, which is just fine because it reheats perfectly in an oven. Service is satisfactory, but nothing stellar, and I also think that beers are overpriced. This is a pizza joint all the way, and nothing else compares.

I like big crusts and I cannot lie.Alright, I'm going to stop there and not try to make this into a thing.  But really, I could sing praises of Pequod's big crusts and their carmelized perfection.My husband, who is originally from Chicago,  has Lou Malnati's delivered from Chicago to Denver on his birthday, but one visit to Pequod's was enough to make him completely disregard his loyalties.  So, if you're like me and only visiting Chicago, you can get the legit deep dish experience at this pizzeria.  We had walked approximately a bajillion miles while we were out exploring the neighborhoods on foot, so we arrived hungry.  We waited about 30 minutes fo rour pizza to arrive and when it did one slice of our sausage and olive pie was enough to fill me up.  They have a decent selection of beers, as well, so you can arrive thirsty, too.

Everything said already - ditto! I will take it a step further; I live in New York. I've tried all the New York favs, i.e. Grimaldi's and crew. Honestly, Pequod's is officially, hands down, the best pizza in the USA! That's right, Pequod's Chicago Deep Dish beats New York pizza hands down, from a real New Yorker; and I've got several friends of mine that agrees. The worst part of Pequod's is that I can't get it delivered to me in NYCIf it's your first visit, the perfect order at Pequod's is small pan pizza with sausage, pepperoni, and extra cheese. ***druel

The only reason it doesn't get five stars is because the servers looked like they didn't want to be there.The food is so great...!!!. We got the Pequads salad and it was delcious.The pan pizza is buttery and delicious. We heated it up the next day and it was better than the first day! I'm a Lou's girl normally, but Pequads put up a good fight and it's 4 minutes away from my house. Boom.

Pequods!!!! OMG! Their crust is the most amazing thing in life! Solid deep dish pizza! Their delivery time is pretty quick and the pizza itself is damn awesome! Can't wait to order from here again! Absolutely love this place!!!!

The quintessential Chicago deep dish.  Why is this place not the poster child for Chicago pizza?  Everything on the menu is amazing.  Ambience is energetic, yet intimate.  I used to live within walking distance of this place, and miss living closer.

Definitely one of my favorite deep dish places in Chicago. Is it the best? I don't know, I wouldn't say that. But the crust is probably one of my favorites of all time. A delicate airy caramelized crust. Ughhhhhh so good, need it in my life now. If only the wait wasn't two hours every time I've gone. I myself would like it if they had some more toppings but hey, I get it. They focus on the crust and keep it simple. You do you gurl. Just do something about that wait time. It kills me everytime.

It gets no better than this!  The best deep dish pizza in Chicago, hands down.  It is unassuming on the outside but you will typically see a line to get in.  They also have great lunch specials.  Highly recommend!!

Went here during the Blackhawks playoffs with my family who was in town and the pizza was to die for. The cheese crust did not disappoint and I see why it was voted the best in Chicago.  The best part of the experience was the waitstaff who, without us even asking, told us we were welcome to watch the rest of the game there, even when people were packing into the bar.

Sometimes this place has wait times of 2 hours, because it's so good. Your best bet is pickup, which takes about 45 minutes, or even delivery, which can take up to 90 minutes. Either way, you'll be getting some of the best pizza anywhere. Chicago people joke that the best pizza in the city is always "my neighborhood."  Peqoud's is a great neighbor to have.

Best deep dish in Chicago. Recommend the sausage & jalapeño. Thick deep dish with burnt cheese crust. Nothing compares to a Pequods pie, unlike any other pizza I've ever tried. Take out frequently from here. However, if you prefer to dine in it's a hip & swanky atmosphere. Great selections of brews.

Mmmmm best deep dish pizza in Chicago!  I love Pequod's, they have some awesome pizza.  They bake the pizza in cast iron pizza pans which gives the crust the crispy texture I love and the flavor is great as well.  The sauce, cheese, and toppings are always spot on too.  All together you have one tasty pizza!Once you step in, it doesn't look like a very big place, but they have a 2nd floor which is quite large.  The atmosphere is very lively since it's always busy, they have tv's throughout the place, and though small, a decent beer list.  This is a pizza place though so I can't complain.Yes, I've had Lou Malnati's and they do have great pizza too, but I prefer Pequod's, especially if I'm dining in.  Lou's is a boring place to eat unless you're looking for a nice quite dinner in what looks like your grandma's living room.You need to eat at Pequod's if you haven't done so already.

First let me say that the service was excellent both the waitress and server went out of the way to explain to us what made their pizza different to the rest and gave us great recommendations. We started with mozzarella sticks (very yummy) then we had pepperoni pizza which was different to a chicago deep dish because this was more crush but it was good. For dessert the lovely waitress recommend the brownie and we also ordered a peanut butter and chocolate chip cookie and both were delicious and served warm.
What a special & different kind of deep-dish - caramelized with a slight burnt taste, nothing like it. VERY delish!

On the plane coming from Orange County, CA to Chicago a man recommended this place to me. My friend I was staying with happened to live a block away so we checked it out. I'm so glad we did. Pequods pizza out of all the pizza places I tried while I was in Chicago was the best hands down. What made it so fucking good was that there pepperoni had a nice quality feel to it and sauce was incredible. But the real kick in the teeth was the caramelization at the end of the piece of pizza. That was like the desert. I cant even begin to explain how good that was. It was so good that we went 2 days in a row to Pequods. I also learned that you can ask for extra caramelization so when I come back to Chi town you can find me in Pequads drinking a ice cold pale ale. CHEERS

Walking through the Lincoln Park neighborhood I knew I had to try Peqoud's.  The accolades from this establishment stem from the original owner and his understanding of what makes a good deep dish pizza.  I've even seen the food being sampled on TV as I was channel surfing.  Dropped in and tried a Large deep dish pizza, half pepperoni, half sausage, extra cheese, extra sauce, and garlic.  Not surprisingly the caramelized cheese crust immediately set this pizza apart from all others.  I've never had so much cheese crust on one pizza before, which I highly appreciated, as it's my favorite part of a good pizza.  It's nice to have a pizza place where you don't have to hope there will be sufficient caramelized cheese on the crust due to chance, I will definitely be returning.

What a great Chicago experience! Fun environment with plenty of opportunity to watch sports and have a cold beer. The service was swift and friendly. Now the deep dish pizza... Well crafted, oozing with cheese, sausage, garlic, and olives. Nothing short of Delicious. I really felt like I was eating Chicago. Highly recommended.

I have been a fan of this place for over 10 years!  The crispy garlicky crust is the absolute best.  Only warning..you WILL have to wait to get a table most nights AND then you will have to wait for your pizza to be made.  So sit down and order right away to get the pizza's in the oven.  Well worth the wait in my opinion however.

Stop #4 on my "Eating my way through Chicago/St. Louis and possibly doing other things on this trip Summer Tour 2011" found me finally at some deep dish pizza.  Another recommendation from my friend.  It is all about the crust at Pequod's.  Yum freakin' yum.Another place you will wait in line for.  The friend that I was staying with hadn't heard of Pequod's.  I was hoping we were in for a treat.  The beauty of Pequod's is that they will take your pizza order while you wait to be seated.  Deep dish usually takes a while to cook, so ordering it while you have yet to sit is a really nice thing for them to do.Once seated, we started out with the Appetizer Combo which was a bunch of fried things like mozzarella sticks, zucchini, poppers and mushrooms.  It was ok.  Fried is fried.  You can't really do a terrible job at frying things.  I was ready for the pizza.We had the pan pizza with onions and pepperoni.  The pizza is baked in cast iron pans blackened by decades of seasoning and the overflowing cheese emerges from the oven as a halo of caramelized crust.  If that doesn't sound good to you, what does?  This is not a pizza for the faint of heart.  Deep dish is heavy and we didn't see anyone leaving the restaurant without a to go bag.  We ended up taking a good portion home and I had a slice 2 days later.  Still tasted really good.There are a ton of pizza shops in Chicago.  Everyone has a favorite.  If I lived here I can see Pequod's being a favorite for years and years.
Love this place and keep coming back. Consistant everytime, only issue is everyone knows how good the pizza is here. Sometimes the wait time is long, but we'll worth it.

Have always been a fan of their thin crust, and they may possibly have the best pepperoni In Chicago. Went in recently there to dine in and try theirDeep Dish. I'd give their deep dish a nod above most but still partial to Lou's. Fresh toppings were solid. The garden salad was great as well.
This place has some good cheesy bread (and pizza too). Of course you come here for the pizza but it's always nice to chomp on a tizer' while you wait the 30min for your fresh pie to finish

I'm not a deep dish connoisseur. Living on the West Coast my entire life probably precludes me from making a judgment on deep dish pizza. But this establishment is a lot of fun. And the pizza is very tasty.

This place has the best deep dish pizza in Chicago! I tell everyone to go try this place and they all get hooked. Don't let the look of the crust fool you. It's one of the best parts of the pizza. Nice 2 level place and good service. Parking can be a little bit of an issue, but well worth it. Blackhawks bar as well with lots of craft beers, etc.

Ordered delivery from this place after a recommendation from a friend. My friend and I were too tired to go eat at the place and we were close enough for delivery! yay! :) the pizza was really good. It is a deep dish pizza so order a smaller pizza. We ordered a medium, but in hindsight a small would have been sufficient. The wait for delivery was an hour and 20 minutes but we figured it would be long since it's such a popular place and it was during the weekend. Would definitely order from here again.
- The pizza is outstanding.- $5 for a personal pan pizza /and/ a drink at lunchtime?  How can you top that?
The best deep dish pizza within city limits. ((Drops mic))Otherwise... it gets crowded. Its loud. Get a reservation and order ahead.

Finally I've tried the pizza that my friends have been raving about!  I've had a lot of deep dish in the last few weeks, trying to find the best in town for my English boyfriend.  Together we've had Uno's, Lou Malnati's, and Gino's East - of course I've tried Giordano's too.  Some better than others, but I don't think he ever got what the fuss was about with Chicago style deep dish.  Too bad he left before I came here!On a warm, sunny Saturday, the place was pretty busy with a 30 minute wait around 6:45 pm.  You'd do well to order while you wait since the pizzas can take 45 minutes or more to make.  We waited outside on the bench facing Clybourn, until our buzzer finally went off and we went to our booth - the place is bigger than it looks, with two floors and several rooms.  The atmosphere was a lot like a neighborhood bar - lively and fun, with TVs playing the game and lots of people drinking and laughing.We started with a pitcher of Blue Moon, the first of two, and after about 45 minutes in the oven our spinach-and-sausage pizza came to the table.  The server cut the first slices, and the hot cheese stretched high - so appetizing!  Unlike a lot of deep dish, this pizza doesn't taste greasy or heavy.  Sure it's a lot of food, but it tastes almost fresh.  The spinach was abundant, the sausage had to be homemade - it was full of flavor and spices.  The crust stayed crispy the whole time, never getting weighed down by sauce and toppings.  My friend pointed out that I'd basically inhaled my first slice - I was hungry, but it was also so delicious I didn't want to take a break!  A large pizza filled three of us (with one piece left over).  Any appetizers would've just filled us up for no good reason so I'm glad we just stuck to pizza.It's not overpriced, the atmosphere is fun, the pizza is great, and it's worth a little wait outside.  I still have love for Lou's and Gino's East, but this is definitely the place to go for Chicago deep dish.
Best Chicago deep dish. Need I say more?

Best pizza in Chicago, hands down.  I wish they would expand or move since the wait time is usually really long and sometimes even pickup takes hours since they are backed up.  There's a gym across the street that you can work out at while you wait... you'll need it since you will want everything on the menu.  Twice.

Pequod's is my current favorite Chicago style deep dish joint. The crust is hearty and stays crisp and the caramelized edges are great. The sauce is well seasoned the cheese/sauce/ingredients/crust ratio is just right.I recently took another yelper's suggestion to try sausage and giardiniera and now I'm hooked.

Slightly different spin on Chicago Deep Dish. More of a well done pan pizza. Overall in my top 3 deep dishes I've eaten. Love the burnt cheese around the edges. Great beer selection and prices. Get there early, it gets crowded quickly!
Best deep dish in chicago , better than Lou malnati's.Try going during off times (Saturday night is usually a 2 hour wait) or order for pick up.

Recently appointed as my favorite pizza place in Chicago.Love both their deep dish and pan pizzas and their drink selection is perfect for the type of food being served.I love going here during basketball season to catch a game, eat some delicious food and great drinks. Although it can be really crowded we never feel rushed and the service is great.

I'm a New York pizza kinda guy, but when it comes to pan pizza, only Pequod's can make you desire a pan pizza more than a New York style pizza. Let's start with the marinara sauce: A little sour, garlicky and spicy. Unlike other pizzas, where the marinara it's just there almost for decor, in pequod's the marinara elevates the flavor to new heights!The borders of the crust are composed of burnt cheese which makes it crispy and chewy at the same time. The only downside to this place is that it gets packed! Beware people! Don't go there hungry. And if you crave for it during the weekends, plan it because sometimes it takes them more than 1hr for pick up orders and more than 1.5 hrs for a table.
Literally the best deep dish on earth. Make sure you make reservation! Or else you'll be in line for 2 hours!!!
First a point of clarification.  Chicago is the pizza capitol of the world.  To rebuttals, especially from New York, I chuckle condescendingly. Pequod's serves Chicago's best pan pizza.

The deep dish pizzas are really good, but they're super filling. My friend and I couldn't finish the smallest one. I'm not usually a fan of sausage on my pizza, but it was good here.Side note: The regular--- thin crust one... don't even bother.

Called ahead to put my name on the list (no reservations but priority seating instead), and when we got there around 7pm, we were seated within five minutes. Really impressed by the service!  Our waitress was really sweet and took our beer & salad orders. Then another waitress came by within a few minutes to take our pizza orders. The restaurant was mostly full, so it was nice that they were working together to take orders. Decent selection of beers with most of the craft beers being local.  Goose Island, Fat Tire, Bell's... can't really go wrong there.  The house salad is not your typical iceberg lettuce with a few carrot shavings, but a large bowl of leafy greens plus some fixin's.  Great way to start the meal. Now, the thing everyone actually cares about. Pizza! I'm not a deep dish expert, but this is gooooood. Crunchy exterior (I hear they melt cheese on the crust) and soft on the inside. I ordered a personal pan with pepperoncini and mushrooms. It's a 7-inch pan that is supposed to be for one person. I ate two slices and had to call it quits, but my friends both crushed theirs, so maybe I'm just a lightweight. If you're not super hungry, or don't want to leave feeling stuffed, the personal pan is enough for two!

Ordered deep dish spinach for delivery.  When I opened the box, it looked...questionable.  Then I had my first bite and it is probably the best deep dish I've ever had.  Deeeeeeeeeeeelicious!Definitely not overrated.  GREAT PIZZA!

Love the pizza. Carmelized Crust.... DUH. Two slices leave me comatosed.Love the choice of beer.I like to hit pequods Monday- Weds.Less of a crowd and wait.PS you can call in and have it start before you get there.The only issue I had was I didn't feel like my server was very attentive. She was dancing and talking about music videos with the hostess.I'm NEEDY sometimes!

Both the wait to be seated and the wait for the pizza are long, yet their deep dish pizza was exceptionally good.  Our order seemed to have been skipped in the kitchen so our waiter spoke to the manager and she gave us half off our pizzas. Great alternative to the popular chain deep dish restaurants you see in Chicago.
Best deep dish pizza in Chicago! The cheese crust makes the difference! The ambiance is more like a pub! Definitely recommend either if you're visiting Chicago or are here for good

went with a friend cause he said the pizza was amazing.
